All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*

title: Reservkraftstekniker
description:
**Hur skapar vi succé?** 




 Vi är en komplett leverantör med lång erfarenhet att planera, projektera och bygga datacenter tillsammans med våra kunder. Vi har samlat experter och specialister som med bredd, spetskompetens och många års erfarenhet erbjuder de bästa förutsättningarna för en kritisk infrastruktur och en avbrottsfri IT-drift. Vi samarbetar med ledande leverantörer inom branschen för att kunna erbjuda flexibla och kundanpassade lösningar. Våra tjänster erbjuder allt från lokala nätverksinstallationer till driftsättningar av kompletta IT-miljöer. Vår styrka och filosofi har alltid varit att ha kundens behov och utmaningar i centrum och det ta fram lösningar utifrån våra kunders unika situation.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en Senior Reservkraftstekniker för att ansluta till vårt team som arbetar inom kritisk infrastruktur. Som en av våra reservkraftstekniker kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa driften och underhållet av reservkraften och relaterad utrustning som är avgörande för att bibehålla kontinuiteten och tillförlitligheten inom våra kunders verksamhet.
 



  





**Vad ingår i rollen;** 




 Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar främst utförande av service av och arbeten med el- och kraftförsörjningssystem. Du har ansvar för att planera utförandet av ditt arbete i form av inköp av material, dokumentera, föra protokoll och rapportering av avvikelser. Du ska känna till och följa gällande standarder och regler, hålla dig uppdaterad med utveckling av produkter, metoder och teknik. Jour och ev resor ingår i tjänsten.
 


* Planera och genomföra regelbundna inspektioner, underhåll och reparationer av reservkraftsutrustning för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
* Ha en kontinuerlig dialog med kunden och föreslå förbättringsåtgärder när möjlighet finns.
* Leverera dokumentation efter underhållsaktiviteter, projektarbeten och vid



  





**Vad är viktigast?** 




 Vi tror att du är en person som arbetat med el och kraftförsörjning och motorer under en längre period och som kanske söker en ny utmaning. Du är en lagspelare med en positiv och nyfiken inställning till kunder och deras utmaningar. Du har antagligen en teknisk utbildning i grunden och har erfarenhet av liknande arbete inom reservkraft i en miljö med kritisk infrastruktur såsom sjukhus, datacenter, eller annan relevant erfarenhet inom el eller som mekaniker. Du har ett affärsmässigt tänk i det du gör och har god struktur. Vi tror också att du har stark problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att fatta snabba beslut även under stress. Du behöver också ha en vilja och möjlighet att ibland behöva arbeta under flexibla arbetstider och vara i tjänst vid akuta situationer eller driftsstörningar.
 


* 10 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, El, Motor,Styr/reglerteknik, tunga fordon, industrielektriker, marintekniker/ingenjör, motormekaniker.
* Förmåga att planera och även leda service och installationsarbeten.
* Utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga och vana att samarbeta effektivt med olika intressenter.
* ECY – certifikat är ett krav
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl muntligt som skriftligt är ett krav
* B-körkort är ett krav



  





 Vi kommer också att utföra en säkerhetsprövning enligt SUA som en del i rekryteringsprocessen.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande;** 




 Vi är i en just nu i en expansiv fas där du har möjlighet att utvecklas och påverka framtiden för både dig och vårt företags fortsatta resa! Vi erbjuder dig att bli del i ett team av erfarna kollegor och ett engagerat ledarskap där samarbete och utveckling är ledstjärnor! Våra kunder är allt från stora, internationella, företag till myndigheter och instanser som är av stor samhällelig betydelse vilket innebär en chans för dig som anställd att vara med i intressanta projekt i unika miljöer. Vi är också stolta att ha fått utmärkelsen Great Place to Work och för oss är yrkesstolthet och teamwork a och o för att kunna leverera förstklassig service till våra kunder. Om du är en driven individ och vill vara en del av ett team som säkerställer driftskritiska system, uppmanar vi dig att skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Digital Ecosystem Manager
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 We are JTI, Japan Tobacco International, and we are present in 130 countries. We have spent years innovating, creating new and better products for
 **the consumers to choose from** 
 . This is our business. But not only. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe that when they are
 **free to be themselves** 
 , and they are given the opportunity to grow, travel and develop,
 **amazing things can happen** 
 .
   

  

 That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI.
 **It is why 80% of employees feel happy working at JTI.** 
 And why we’ve been awarded
 **Global Top Employer status, ten years running** 
 .
   

  

 So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.
   

  

 Learn more: jti.com
   

  

*Department: Commercial Planning*
*Location: Stockholm*
*Reporting to: Sales Planning Manager*
*Role: Permanent*
**Digital Ecosystem Manager**
**What This Position Is About - Purpose**
 In this role, you will be responsible for developing a stable and accurate data platform for the Scandinavia Digital Ecosystem, ensuring it meets business objectives and aligns with the CRM Business Plan Global. You will lead the platform's development, implementation, and execution, and communicate the CRM annual plan from the global team. Additionally, you will evaluate all Marketing & Sales activities within the ecosystem, ensuring the availability of relevant data. Collaborating with the Sales Planning Associate, you will implement marketing and sales activities. You will also work with IT, SI, and other cofunctions to establish a single source of truth for data to advise decision-making.
   

  

**What Will You Do - Responsibilities**
* Develop and implement the Scandinavia digital ecosystem, aligning it with the annual business plan and Sales & Marketing needs
* Be responsible for all aspects of Power BI design and development, ensuring accurate data from various sources
* Plan and implement global improvement initiatives, develop new CRM functionalities, and lead testing for Siebel Sales and Sales Force App
* Support Power BI end-users, resolve incidents, and provide training
* Handle ecosystem's database for accurate Power BI results and reports
* Collaborate with the Sales Planning to identify gaps and opportunities
* Handle additional tasks and projects as needed


**Who Are We Looking For - Requirements**
* University degree or equivalent experience with a mathematical and/or CRM system (Power BI) knowledge
* Confirmed experience within the FMCG or Tobacco Industry in planning, analytical and CRM-related positions
* Exposure to CRM systems (preferably Siebel)
* Deep knowledge of PowerBI
* Fluency in English & Swedish
* Excellent computer skills - proficiency in MS Office (especially Microsoft Excel and Power BI)
* Knowledge of Oracle will be an advantage


**You will be successful in this role if you :**
* Are data-driven
* Have strong logical thinking
* Like to optimise and simplify
* Have "can do" mindset


**What Do You Get - Benefits**
 You will have the opportunity to work in a role with a lot of variety in a great working culture and environment in a multinational company. Besides this, we are operating in a modern environment with beautiful surroundings. In addition, we will offer you:
   

  

* Development opportunities: both personally and professionally
* Company performance bonus scheme
* Wellness allowance
* Health benefits such as medical care and doctor visits
* Access to the local company benefits portal, providing exclusive discounts and services
* To support us in maintaining a safe and secure work environment, we adhere to local collective bargaining agreements


**What Are The Next Steps – Recruitment Process**
 Thank you very much for your interest in the role. You are welcome to apply.

title: Product Analyst | Candy Crush Soda | FTC 12-months
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
 As a Product Analyst you will work in close collaboration with product managers, data scientists, designers and developers supporting the design, execution and evaluation of new experiments and features in Candy Crush Soda Saga. Your role will include translating business questions into data questions and data answers into business answers. You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment.
   

  

 This is a fixed-term position for 12 months.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include:**
 Data analysis and insights generation
   

  

* Conduct thorough data analysis using statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to product performance and user behaviour
* Propose data-informed product changes or enhancements to improve user engagement and product performance
* Monitor product KPIs and user engagement metrics, identifying areas for improvement or optimization
* Develop and maintain regular reports and dashboards for tracking product metrics, ensuring accuracy and relevance of the data presented


**Experimentation**
* Design, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of changes to the product, features, or user experience, making recommendations based on test outcomes
* Monitor the performance of experiments and provide insights to optimise product features


**Opportunity identification**
* Support the product/feature maturity and delivery with evaluation, recommendations, and performance reporting
* Identify data-driven opportunities to support PMs and having experience with data/tech coordination and analysis
* Work on problems both with and without predefined solutions or operational guidelines


**Documentation and knowledge sharing**
* Communicate findings and recommendations clearly to stakeholders across Soda
* Document analytical processes, findings, and recommendations, ensuring knowledge is shared and accessible within the team and Soda


****Skills to create thrills****
* Hands-on experience with data analysis in a business or product context
* Demonstrable ability to extract, manipulate, and interpret large datasets, identifying trends, and making data-driven recommendations. This includes understanding key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to product success
* Experience working with data using SQL and creating sophisticated queries
* Good understanding of statistics and the ability to interpret these with confidence to support recommendations
* Adept in visualisation tools with experience in information visualisation and presentation
* Experience working closely with product managers in product development, including the application of data analysis to inform the prioritisation of new features or enhancements to existing ones
* Ability to clearly articulate insights and recommendations to stakeholders, including those without a technical background. This includes excellent written and verbal communication skills


**Bonus Skills**
* Previous experience working with Looker
* Practical experience with an analytical programming language such as R or Python for data manipulation
* Knowledge of user research and design thinking principles
* Experience with roadmap planning, understanding how data analysis informs the prioritisation of new features or enhancements to existing ones


**About King**
 At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Facility Manager
description:
**FACILITY MANAGER FOR CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE IN STOCKHOLM** 




  





 On behalf of Digital Realty, Kelly is searching for a Facility Manager. The increasing demand for IT infrastructure is clear, the Stockholm campus and data centers are strategically located to meet the need for business-critical IT infrastructure. Digital Realty is a leading provider of data center services across EMEA.
 



  





 Digital Realty is a company that understands the importance of keeping business-critical infrastructure running safely. In Facility they play a key role, ensuring everything in their data centers operates as it should for the customers. Their infrastructure consists of diesel generators, chillers, UPS, fire suppression systems and much more. It’s about understanding the importance of the data center infrastructure and collaborating closely with other teams across the business to maintain it effectively.
 



  





 Are you ready to lead and ensure the seamless operation of the data centers' critical physical infrastructure? Then join us and take pride in being a leader in this vital area and you’ll discover a supportive and open environment where you’ll be encouraged to be yourself. This means you’ll have the chance to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of training and development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career.
 



  





  





**YOUR PRIMARY WORK TASKS** 



* You will oversee all aspects of the data centers, ensuring high-quality performance and minimizing any impact on the internal and external customers
* You will bring your technical expertise to guide and support your team, planning, coordinating, and managing the data center’s equipment, systems, and infrastructure.
* You will mentor a team of technicians, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, continuous improvement, and professional development
* Maintain business continuity, your team will be scheduled for day shifts and on-call rotations, with you serving as their primary point of escalation. This key role is an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact on infrastructure critical to our society



  





  





**PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS** 



* Experience of managing a maintenance team with on call reasonability in a technical organization, supporting critical infrastructure
* Strong resource planning, administrative and leadership skills
* Knowledge of managing a team to meet KPIs
* Good technical/electrical and maintenance background
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical subject or equivalent
* Extensive engineering experience in an electro-technical or industrial/mechanical environment
* Fluent in both Swedish and English



  





  





**PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS** 



* You are service orientated
* You have excellent problem-solving skills
* You have Excellent people management skills
* You have good communication skills
* You show a flexible working attitude
* You are proactive and stress-resilient



  





  





**YOU ARE OFFERED** 



* A rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers
* Join Digital Realty and you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of the facility team, you’ll get to collaborate with people from different business areas, challenge the way things done and put your ideas into action
* You will also be given plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with Digital Realty



  





**APPLICATION** 




 If you are interested in the above position, press 'Apply now' and attach your complete CV. You can create a user profile on our website if you have additional relevant documents. All applications are treated with full discretion.
 



  





**APPLICATION DEADLINE** 




 We regularly call candidates for interview, so please submit your application as soon as possible. All applications are treated with full discretion.
 



  





**PLEASE FOLLOW US ON LINKEDIN AND FACEBOOK, TO CONTINUALLY KEEP UP TO DATE ON OUR VACANCIES.**

title: Professor - School of Information Systems and Technology Management - UNSW Business School
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

**Employment Duration: Continuing position**
**Employment Type: Full Time - 35 hours per week**
**Remuneration: Competitive industry salary**
**Location: Hybrid model of working from our Kensington, NSW Campus and working remotely**

* Work at a world-renowned institution where new ideas can come to life and impact lives
* See the difference you can make, through the work you do
* Feel motivated and driven by the scale and dynamism of everything happening around you



**About UNSW**
 UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community; a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. It’s the reason we’re one of the top 50 universities in the world and a member of Australia’s prestigious Group of Eight. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.
   

  

 UNSW is currently implementing a ten-year 2025+ strategy and our ambition is nothing less than to establish UNSW as Australia’s global university. We aspire to this in the belief that a great university, which is a global leader in discovery, innovation, impact, education and thought leadership, can make an enormous difference to the lives of people in Australia and around the world. This position, which is in line with our 2025 Strategy, emphasises our commitment to promoting equity, diversity, and social justice. For further information, see: https://www.2025.unsw.edu.au/
   

  

 The School of Information Systems & Technology Management (SISTM) is one of eight schools within the Business School that comprises over 30 staff from all over the world. It offers a vibrant and dynamic academic community engaged in leading-edge research, innovative teaching as well as constructive community and professional engagement. SISTM is one of the largest and oldest such schools in Australia. The School is currently ranked 1st in Australia, 2nd in Asia, and 11th worldwide (Worldwide) in the latest Association of Information Systems (AIS) research productivity ranking, and has highly developed local and international links.
   

  

  

  

**Why your role matters**
 The Professor (Level E) position is expected to provide academic leadership and foster excellence in research, innovative teaching, and engagement activities in their area of expertise.  If you have an expertise in cybersecurity, business analytics and digital transformation, this might be the position for you. The role of Professor reports to the Head of School and has no direct reports.
   

  

*This position is open to Women applicants only. UNSW has obtained an exemption under section 126 of the Anti-Discrimination Act 1977 (NSW) to designate and recruit senior academic level D (Associate Professor) and level E (Professor) roles within UNSW Sydney Faculties where the percentage of women is below 40%, to fulfil UNSW’s goal of a representative workforce rate.*
 Visa sponsorship and relocation allowance will be considered and may be offered to the preferred candidate.
   

  

**Accountabilities For This Role Include**
* Lead and conduct original/innovative research at the highest level, actively contributing to the advancement of knowledge in the relevant subject area/s, while ensuring the publication of outcomes in high quality research outlets and translation to relevant stakeholders in the field of expertise.
* Make internationally recognised contributions to secure competitive government and industry research funding, and/or external education funding.
* Establish and influence research network/s (based on the norms of the discipline) at an international level.
* Apply a well-defined teaching philosophy and a critically reflective teaching practice that inspires student learning and cultivates a positive attitude towards teaching in both postgraduate and undergraduate courses in line with UNSW policy as an exemplar for others.
* Design and develop learning activities and resources, provide assessment and feedback at both course and program level using a range of suitable approaches and learning environments that inspires excellence in others by providing mentorship and peer review.
* Mentor and guide students and colleagues, as well as UNSW's early career academics and postdoctoral fellows. This includes supporting early career academics to obtain research and/or education grant funding, including external competitive fellowships.
* Lead strategic initiatives that contribute to the engagement and social impact priorities (e.g., the United Nations Principles of Responsible Management Education and Sustainable Development Goals) of the School, Faculty and University.


**About You**
 Skills and experience required for the role:
   

  

* A PhD in a related discipline, and/or relevant work experience.
* A distinguished research record and international reputation evidenced by high quality publications in top tier Business and Information Systems journals (e.g., AIS Basket of 8, Financial Times 50); as well as premier IS conferences such as ICIS, ECIS, AMCIS, and PACIS and editorial board memberships
* Demonstrated experience in teaching and learning design using a range of pedagogical approaches, development and delivery of courses and programs, at undergraduate and/or postgraduate level.
* Evidence of being an inspirational role model for other academics seeking mentoring, guidance, advice and support.
* Proven leadership of research projects and leadership of research teams, including high quality HDR supervision.
* Proven leadership in developing significant productive relationships and engagement with industry and the community, with success in attracting significant industry funding.


 To learn more about this position, our selection criteria, as well as view a more detailed description of the accountabilities and skills and experience associated with the role, please review the position description attached.
   

  

 Position-Description-Level-E-Professor-Teaching-Research ISTM.docx
   

  

  

  

**Benefits And Culture**
* Flexible Working Options (work from home, flexible hours etc)
* Career development opportunities
* 17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments
* Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period
* Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)


 For further details on the benefits, please visit https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/lifestyle-benefits
   

  

  

  

**How To Apply**
 Make each day matter with a meaningful career at UNSW. To be considered please upload your CV and a document outlining how your experience meets the skills and experience criteria (document up to 8 pages) and submit your application online. Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their applications promptly as applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
   

  

**Get in Touch**
 For any questions regarding the position, please contact:
   

  

 Professor Barney Tan
   

  

 Head of School, School of Information and Systems Technology Management
   

  

 barney.tan@unsw.edu.au
   

  

 For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact:
   

  

 Persa Tzakis
   

  

 Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant
   

  

 p.tzakis@unsw.edu.au
   

  

 Please apply through the application portal and not via the contact above.
   

  

 UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.
   

  

 The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

title: Finance Manager – Market Strategy & Planning
description:
**Job Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job Description**
 Ready to fuel the success of globally renowned brands like Gillette, Pampers, Head & Shoulders and Oral-B that millions of consumers can’t live without? Ever dreamt of a career where you are fully supported by world-class training and development to progress to leadership? Want to work for a company consistently recognised as one of the UK’s leading graduate employers?
   

  

 In this finance manager role, you will be responsible for identifying, assessing and developing value creation opportunities for the respective business / category. The job requires strong analytical skills in the development of the insight, communication skills to translate the analysis into insights and attract others to the vision, and collaboration skills to execute. This role is located in the Regional HQ location in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What You Will Gain**
* Responsibilities from Day 1 – Right from the start you will be doing a full-time leadership job in Finance, working with some of our biggest brands.
* Build from Within Career - You'll collaborate with passionate individuals and receive both formal training and day-to-day mentoring from your manager. As a 'build from within' company, our people start at entry level and progress through the organization. When we make a job offer, it’s with the expectation that you will grow into one of our future leaders, and to help you get there, you will work closely with skilled P&G veterans for mentoring and coaching at every step.
* Competitive Compensation: We consistently benchmark our salaries against top competitors and every P&G employee’s salary is reviewed at least annually so there is ample room for growth.
* Great Benefits on top of your great salary you can enjoy lots of benefits including a competitive double-matched pension scheme, private health insurance, participation in a stock ownership scheme and discounted products and perks. We also offer hybrid/flexible work arrangements to accommodate your needs. To find more information about our benefits package take a look here: https://www.pgcareers.com/benefits


**Job Qualifications**
**What We Look For:**
* University undergraduates/graduates who have completed a degree or will complete their degree by Summer 2024. We accept applicants from any discipline who have a passion for Finance.
* Evidence of passion and achievements in academic and/or non-academic activities. Tell us what you’re proud of – be it tutoring, holding down a job alongside your studies, engaging in student run activities, or another passion of yours. We want to get to know you!
* Demonstrated leadership skills and analytical capability.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong verbal and written English language skills.


**Start dates** 
**:** 
 July 2024.
   

  

**Application Deadline:** 
 Apply soon to secure your chance, as positions could be filled before the deadline. We may close early if all roles are filled.
   

  

**At P&G #weseeequal**
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
   

  

 We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.
   

  

**Job Schedule**
 Full time
   

  

**Job Number**
 R000105355
   

  

**Job Segmentation**
 Recent Grads/Entry Level (Job Segmentation)

title: Teknikansvarig Radiolänk
description:
*Ett land ska leva överallt, oavsett – i glesbygd och storstad, vid kriser och omvälvande händelser. Det är just därför Teracom Samhällsnät finns. Vi levererar robusta och säkra kommunikationstjänster som omfattar ansvar för marknätet för tv och radio, VMA (Viktigt Meddelande till Allmänheten), Rakel (det svenska blåljusnätet) samt VPN-nät som ligger skyddade utanför det publika internet. Vi ägs av svenska staten och våra kunder utgörs av både privata och offentliga aktörer. Vårt uppdrag är viktigt för att samhället ska vara hållbart och tryggt. I Sverige är vi ca 500 medarbetare och finns på ca 50 orter i landet.* 




  





 Idag är samhället under särskilt press och vi behöver alla hjälpas åt att värna ett samhälle som ska fungera alltid och oavsett. Teracom och Teracoms transmissionsnät är en viktig pusselbit i detta och våra leveranser hjälper en mängd samhällsviktiga uppdragsgivare att utföra sina uppdrag. Efterfrågan på vår kunskap och på våra förmågor ökar och nu har du chansen att vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt för samhället och vara med och bygga upp dess förmåga att stå starkt oavsett vad som händer framöver.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Inom gruppen transmissionsnät på Teracom Samhällsnät ansvarar vi för våra nät inom WDM, access- och stamnätsradiolänk med flera. Gruppen består av 14 medarbetare med olika ansvar inom design och utveckling av näten samt är företagets support för näten gentemot driften hos NOC, Region.
 



  





 Du kommer delta i att ta ansvar för att utveckla våra radiolänknät och systematisera och analysera de utmaningar vi har i näten. Du ska också delta i planering och utskick av reservdelar samt optimera arbetet med detta. I tjänsten ingår arbete med och operativt ansvar för både vårt centrala radiolänkstamnät samt med accesslänk.
 



  





 Du kommer att tillsammans med kollegor agera eskaleringspunkt när NOC:ens första och andralinjessupport eller vår serviceorganisation inte når hela vägen fram i ett felärende. Du ska vara en teknisk förebild och hålla i utbildningar men även guida NOC och service i att själva kunna lösa mer och mer avancerade uppgifter.
 



  





 Dagliga arbetet kan utöver support bestå i att driftsätta nya utrustningar och konfigurera dessa men även göra omkonfigurering och uppgraderingar. I rollen ingår också att vidmakthålla teknikområdets managementsystem, samt att tillsammans med IT och leverantörer drifta, uppgradera, ansvara för och hålla igång systemen och se till att de uppfyller de krav som utrustningar och verksamheten kräver.
 



  





 Tjänsten ställer inte bara krav på dina tekniska kunskaper utan också på dina kommunikativa färdigheter som vi tror är mycket viktiga för att du och gruppen ska lyckas med sitt uppdrag.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker nu en positiv, kompetent och erfaren person inom radiolänkområdet eller liknande teknisk erfarenhet.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som gillar högt tempo och att jobba tätt tillsammans med andra i gruppen, övriga organisationen och även i förekommande fall med leverantörer och kunder.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har kunskaper och erfarenhet inom radiolänk och arbete med Ericsson MINI-LINK och NEC/Aviat iPasolink samt managementsystem för dessa (ENM/SOEM och MS5000/UNMS).
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av IP-baserade nätverk och QoS.
 



 Allmänt goda IT-kunskaper och gärna specifikt om script, servrar och managementsystem är meriterande.
 



  





 Du bör vara en lagspelare ända ut i fingerspetsarna.
 



  





**I rollen ingår** 



* Tekniskt ansvar för planeringen och genomförande av nätplaner inom ditt område
* Ge input för förvaltning och utveckling inom radiolänknäten
* Planera och leverera tillsammans med din grupp på beslutade aktiviteter inom ditt område
* Utveckla arbetssätt och vara en teknisk förebild
* Medverka i projekt inom ramen för din roll
* 3:rd line support för samtliga Radiolänkfrågor
* Driftsätta, konfigurera och uppgradera utrustningar i näten
* Ta fram driftstatistik och analysera denna inom området
* Vidmakthålla områdets managementsystem
* Hantera reservdelar
* Utbilda NOC och serviceorganisationen inom lösningar kopplade till radiolänk
* Hantering av säkerhetsklassad information



  





**Formella krav** 



* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet: minst 3 års erfarenhet inom liknande roller
* Erfarenhet av felsökning inom radiolänkområdet eller motsvarande
* Kunskaper inom konfiguration av radiolänk eller liknande utrustningar
* Kunskaper inom operativsystemen Linux och Windows.
* Flytande i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga
* God förmåga att arbeta med vidareutveckling och dokumentation



  





**Övrigt** 




 På Teracom Samhällsnät anser vi att olikheter mellan människor bidrar till ett dynamiskt, kreativt och utvecklande arbetsklimat. Vi ser därför varje rekrytering som ett sätt att öka mångfalden i företaget.
 



  





 Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs;
 


* Godkänd registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövning och bakgrundskontroll
* Svenskt och/eller nordiskt medborgarskap
* Godkänt alkohol- och drogtest



  





 Arbetet är i huvudsak förlagt till kontorstid men arbete kvällar och helger förekommer.
 



  





 Vissa arbetsuppgifter kräver att du är på plats och vi önskar att du är på plats 3 dagar per vecka eller mer.
 



  





 En medarbetare hos oss ska vara ett gott föredöme och praktisera sitt medarbetarskap utifrån våra kärnvärden; ansvarstagande, lösningsorienterad och engagerad.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos Teracom Samhällsnät får du vara med och göra skillnad varje dag. Det är vårt gemensamma ansvar att de samhällsviktiga tjänster vi levererar, med höga krav på både tillgänglighet, säkerhet och kvalitet, fungerar dygnet runt, året runt - oavsett. Vi erbjuder ett positivt arbetsklimat med högt engagemang och ansvarstagande och kompetenta kollegor. Hos oss får du vara med och påverka och bidra till bolagets fortsatta utveckling. På Teracom Samhällsnät strävar vi efter att skapa en kultur som inspirerar till lärande och utveckling där medarbetarna känner engagemang och trivs på jobbet, samtidigt som vi värnar om balans mellan arbete och fritid.
 



  





 Teracom sitter i trevliga lokaler på Kungsholmen i Stockholm.
 



  





**Din ansökan** 




 Vill du bli en av oss? Ansök online genom att skicka in ditt CV och ett personligt brev. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig chef Lars Drougge på lars.drougge@teracom.se.
 **Sista ansökningsdag är 31 augusti 2024** 
 , men ansökningarna hanteras löpande, så vänta inte med att höra av dig. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Testledare till ICA Sveriges Test Excellence Center
description:
Testledare till ICA Sveriges Test Excellence Center
   

  

 Som vår nya testledare kommer du att vara en nyckelförmåga, leda testning i projekt och forma framtidens testmetoder för hela ICA. Din roll innebär att inte bara leda testningen utan också påverka val av verktyg och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Testledning på ICAs Test Excellence Center
   

  

 Som Testledare hos ICA får du en nyckelroll i att lyfta testförmågan och driva förändringar över hela organisationen. Du kommer att leda tvärfunktionella projekt och initiativ, koordinera flera team och testare samt sätta strategier för att förbättra vår testförmåga. Din insats är avgörande när vi tar steget mot att implementera en ny ERP-plattform, där du kommer att leda och samordna ett stort antal team för att säkerställa effektiva flöden och leverans. Med din förmåga att skapa en gemensam syn och fokus på resultat kommer du att vara nyckeln till vår framgång.
   

  

 Är du den vi söker?
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som:
   

  

* har erfarenhet av att leda test i projekt med stora plattformsbyten, särskilt inom logistikflöden.
* kan navigera både agila och traditionella arbetssätt och leveransmodeller.
* trivs med komplexa projekt och har erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera teststrategier i stora systemlandskap.
* är skicklig på att skapa engagemang, etablera gemensamma arbetssätt och kommunicera tydligt med olika intressenter.


 Om du är en strukturerad, leveransinriktad och kommunikativ ledare som vill vara med och driva framgång hos ICA, då är det dig vi letar efter. Kom och gör skillnad med oss!
   

  

 Därför ska du välja ICA
   

  

 Ser du också möjligheterna med digital innovation? Vi tycker att det är bland det bästa som hänt vår bransch. För det gör att vi kan förenkla vardagen för så många människor därute. I nära samarbeten med varandra, för att verkligen kunna maximera allas individuella insatser i varje utmaning vi möter, skapar vi riktig kundnytta. Oavsett om vi jobbar med IT inom banktjänster, fastigheter eller kring all vår goda mat är vi nära kundens vardag. Och vi driver den digitala utvecklingen framåt inom våra olika områden. Varje dag.
   

  

 Läs mer om livet på ICA här.
   

  

 Vad händer nu?
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-06-20.
   

  

 Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Annica Nylund: 076-696 23 75
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Är du Centrics nya 3rd line supporttekniker?
description:
Vi söker efter erfarna 2nd line tekniker som nyligen tagit nästa steg i karriären och idag arbetar inom 3rd line support. Du erbjuds hjälp med att ta IT-certifikat.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Som 3rd line supporttekniker är du användarnas och dina kollegors räddare i nöden! Du tar emot ärenden som eskalerats i organisationen, från 1st och 2nd line. Med detta sagt kommer du förmodligen stöta på nya, spännande och komplexa ärenden varje dag. Det kan exempelvis röra sig om nätverksrelaterade problem och systemfel i kundspecifika miljöer. Du kommer arbeta med teknisk support i Windowsmiljö samt arbeta med felsökning, förvaltning och enklare drift av Windows Servrar.
   

  

 I och med att arbetsuppgifterna är varierande beroende på hos vilken kund du hamnar så kan det även innefatta hantering av virtuella maskiner, så som VMware och HyperV.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är en person som drivs och motiveras av utveckling! Att arbeta strukturerat och lösningsorienterat är ditt ledord. Du ser övergripande på komplexa problem och med hjälp av ditt analytiska tänkande har du förmågan att kunna isolera orsaker, utveckla och använda metoder som tar dig vidare i din felsökning. Du komminucerar mycket väl på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. Vidare är du en flexibel person som uppskattar teamarbete likväl som du själv tar ansvar och driver fram lösningar hela vägen till mål!
   

  

*Krav*
* 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom support
* Relevant utbildning inom IT
* Erfarenhet av felsökning och förvaltning av Windows Server
* Paketering av applikationer i SCCM
* Felsökning av nätverk
* Djup kunskap i Microsoft365
* Azure/Intune


*Meriterande*
* Linux
* Hantering av virtuella maskiner, HyperV / VMware
* Administration av databaser


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.
   

  

**Omge dig med möjligheter på Centric** 
 Till uppdrag hos flera av våra kunder i Stockholmsområdet söker vi nu efter erfarna 2nd line tekniker som nyligen tagit nästa steg i karriären och idag arbetar inom 3rd line support. Vi söker efter dig som till vardags trivs med avancerad problemlösning i Windowmiljö och som vill fortsätta din IT-karriär hos oss på Centric.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.

title: Taktisk Inköpare inom IT till Dina Försäkring AB
description:
**Är du kunnig inom IT-avtal och IT-tjänster? Ansök till rollen som Taktisk Inköpare inom IT på Dina Försäkring AB i Stockholm!**
 I rollen som taktisk inköpare får du möjlighet att använda din breda, affärsmässiga och regulatoriska erfarenhet inom IT för att hantera de tekniska och regulatoriska krav som finns i samband med inköp av resurskonsulter och IT-tjänster. En annan viktig del är så klart också att bygga starka relationer med både leverantörer och interna intressenter. Du kommer ges stort ansvar och möjlighet till professionell utveckling i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan redan idag och häng med på Dina Försäkringars förändringsresa!
   

  

**Ditt anställningserbjudande**
 Dina Försäkringar är inne i en stark tillväxtfas med många spännande satsningar på gång. Du spelar en central roll i att hjälpa företaget att uppnå sina mål, nå nya framgångar och öka Dina Försäkringars tydlighet och närvaro på marknaden.
   

  

 Du kommer till en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att både påverka och växa i din yrkesroll!
   

  

**Hos Dina Försäkring Kommer Du**
* Att vara en del av en stark och tydlig vision - Driv framtidens IT- och applikationsdrift inom försäkringsbranschen.
* Att ha en värderingsstyrd arbetsgivare - Vi värnar om våra värderingar, och skapar en inkluderande och trivsam arbetsmiljö.


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som IT-inköpare sitter du som spindeln i nätet mellan tekniken och juridiken och kommer ha möjlighet att arbeta med många spännande teknikprojekt.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Kommer Vara**
* Ansvara för inköp av IT-tjänster, konsultavtal och sourcing, i enlighet med våra interna rutiner och krav på regelefterlevnad.
* Arbeta nära chefer och förvaltningsteam för att förstå deras behov och krav.
* Förhandla avtal med leverantörer och säkerställa bästa möjliga villkor.
* Utveckla och underhålla starka relationer med befintliga och potentiella leverantörer.
* Stötta i uppföljningen av leveranser gentemot avtal och säkerställa att de uppfyller våra krav tillsammans med förvaltnings- och avtalsansvariga.
* Upprätthålla avtalsregister.
* Hantera livscykelhantering och återrapportering.


**Värt att veta**
 Du kommer att vara placerad i Stockholm och arbeta i ett litet, dynamiskt team på Skeppsbron 2. Teamet består av en informationssäkerhetsspecialist, en risk manager, och en IT-jurist. Du rapporterar till chefen för Enhetsstöd.
   

  

**Våra förväntningar**
 Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av inköp eller försäljning av IT-tjänster. Du har en god förståelse för hur ett IT-avtal är uppbyggt och hur IT-tjänster paketeras och levereras. Du är självgående, analytisk och har en stark kommunikationsförmåga. Du är flexibel som person och gillar att testa nya metoder och strategier. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med både tekniska och regulatoriska krav är det meriterande.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Managing Director
description:
*Hobbex is a dynamic and fast-growing e-commerce company specializing in sourcing high-quality products from Asia and selling them online across the Nordic region. Our mission is to provide exceptional value and service to our customers by leveraging efficient logistics and innovative marketing strategies. We are seeking a Managing Director to lead our operations, drive growth, and ensure our continued success in the competitive e-commerce landscape.* 




  





**ABOUT HOBBEX** 




  





 Join us on our exciting journey to reshape the classic mail-order company from 1961. Today, the legendary Hobbex catalog has been replaced with pure e-commerce, and we offer a well-thought-out range of remote-controlled hobby products, competitive prices, and fast deliveries. Our vision is for Hobbex to be the leading European player in remote control. We currently sell throughout the Nordics, with Sweden as our main market. Our product offering spans the entire spectrum of remote-controlled products. We aim to be a one-stop-shop for remote control, with everything from cars, boats, drones, batteries, and spare parts.
 



  





 We are a small team passionate about spreading the joy that comes with remote-controlled products. The entire team currently works remotely, and in 2023, Hobbex had a turnover of 14 MSEK. If you like rapid growth, short decision paths, a strong team spirit, and going to work with a smile, then you've come to the right place.
 



  





**SUMMARY OF THE ROLE & PROFILE** 




  





 We are looking for a Managing Director with an entrepreneurial mindset to lead the work of taking Hobbex into its next development phase. You have an inherent drive, are good with numbers, and have an analytical mindset. In your role as a developer of the company, you will build, train and mentor a high-performing team. You have previously had a leadership role, but not necessarily as a Managing Director.
 



  





 Being able to offer our customers the right products at the right price lies at the heart of Hobbex. Therefore, purchasing, inventory planning, and cash flow will be central areas in your role as Managing Director. Our purchases have long lead times, and planning in collaboration with the team is therefore an important part of your work.
 



  





 You enjoy working in a small driven team where you can lead and motivate employees remotely. Everyone helps out when needed, so it is important that you have a hands-on approach and want to get involved in Hobbex's various work areas. You work well under stress and can quickly steer the remote-controlled boat when needed.
 



  





 Qualifications:
 


* Minimum of 5 years retail experience in a leadership role and preferably in the e-commerce sector.
* Proven track record of successfully managing operations and driving business growth.
* Strong understanding of e-commerce platforms and basic understand of digital marketing including SEO, SEM.
* Experience in purchasing is seen as an extra merit.
* Fluency in spoken and written English.



  





 Skills:
 


* Entrepreneurial spirit.
* Strong strategic and analytical thinking abilities.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Financial acumen and experience in budgeting and financial analysis.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Hands-on approach.



  





 You will lead a motivated team during an extremely exciting time with many opportunities. As Managing Director, you will report to the owners.
 



  





  





**APPLICATION\* & OTHER INFORMATION** 




 Scope: Fulltime, permanent position.
 



 Location: Remote.
 



 Starting Date: As soon as possible.
 



 Salary: Individual salary setting applies.
 



  





 For more information please visit:
 




 www.hobbex.se
 





 www.wesgroup.se
 




  





  





 Hobbex is collaborating with Wes in this recruitment. For more information or questions about the position, do not hesitate to contact our consultants:
 



  





 Neda Järnland at +46 733 58 99 34 or neda.jarnland@wesgroup.se
 



 Henrik Alm at +46 739 13 58 27 or henrik.alm@wesgroup.se
 



  





*\*Please note that we unfortunately do not accept application documents via email. Keep in mind that your application should not contain sensitive personal data, such as information about health, religious or philosophical beliefs, political opinions, or union membership.*

title: Solution Architect, Tietoevry Banking
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 The Tietoevry Custom Implementations business area is experiencing growth, and as a result, we are searching for additional colleagues who are interested in making a significant impact on the future of banking solutions for prominent Nordic players. We are currently in need of an experienced
 **solution architect** 
 , someone who possesses a wide range of knowledge in solution architecture and is capable of effectively leading architecture initiatives with development teams and engaging in productive conversations with clients.
   

  

**In the role of a solution architect, you will be responsible for:**
* Creating architecture and designs that prioritize quality and the long-term sustainability of solutions.
* Working on comprehensive assignments alongside motivated colleagues who share a strong commitment to delivering quality results, while also maintaining ongoing customer relationships.
* Collaborating with other architects as part of the architecture forum, which provides valuable opportunities for professional growth and the ability to shape technical decisions.
* Working at the forefront of technology, tackling transaction-heavy operations, addressing integration challenges, and participating in stimulating development projects with esteemed banking clients.


**What we are looking for:**
* Demonstrating a strong environmental awareness and an ability to identify opportunities through the application of new technologies.
* Possessing a background as a developer, which equips you with extensive knowledge of programming, system design, and system integration.


**Experience in the following areas is considered a plus:**
* Mini/micro services architecture.
* Utilizing Java and Groovy for enterprise services, leveraging well-known open-source libraries such as Apache Camel, Spring, Spring Boot, Apache Kafka, and more.
* Implementing CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Azure DevOps.
* Working with containerized runtime environments utilizing Kubernetes.
* Developing APIs based on OpenAPI specifications.


 As an individual, we believe that you thrive in collaborative customer-centric environments and enjoy working as part of a team. You possess drive, adaptability, and independence.
   

  

**In return, we offer you the following benefits:**
* Strength in Size: Being one of the leading IT companies in the Nordics, we provide you with more opportunities compared to similar organizations. Our extensive geographical presence in Sweden and worldwide brings a diverse range of customers, from small local businesses to large global enterprises - presenting you with a wealth of experiences and challenges.
* Continuous Development: Our broad scope of operations, coupled with our dynamic and fast-paced environment, supports your professional growth and development. We strive to remain at the forefront of industry trends and technology advancements.
* Modern and Inclusive Workplace: We are dedicated to creating a modern and attractive workplace. To foster innovation and skill development, we form workgroups that embrace diversity, harnessing unique perspectives and promoting collaboration.


 Overall, we aim to offer you ample opportunities for advancement, a supportive and progressive environment, and the chance to contribute to meaningful projects.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn profile and we’ll reach out to you.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact hiring manager Åsa Um, asa.um@tietoevry.com. Employment with us can mean placement in a security class. A security check with register control according to the Security Protection Act (2018: 585) may therefore be carried out before a decision on employment.
   

  

* We perform background checks on all final candidates.
* Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
* Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.


**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.

title: Senior CRM Business Consultant
description:
**What we are looking for:** 




  




* You should be the person that can show potential customers how a CRM solution can unleash the customers full potential.
* A senior CRM consultant with 10+ years experience
* You will have a strong track record of delivering CRM solutions at your customers and therefore have a great reputation with them. This reputation will have allowed you to expand your offering with them.
* An excellent business developer, someone who understands how to build relationships with clients and create new opportunities in Sweden.
* Someone who can attract top talent to Monfido.
* A proactive business builder, who has the drive and personality to help Monfido grow.
* Fluency in Swedish



  





  





**What we will offer:** 




  




* The opportunity to join a new Salesforce/CRM consulting company, where you will have the mandate to lead Monfido on their growth journey.
* To leverage your experience into an environment where you have the possibility to shape your own role and target model.
* You will have a clear growth target in relation to new business creation and talent attraction.
* A challenging and international business environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* To be part of an alliance of ten consulting companies, that employ approximately 260 consultants. Within Newground Alliance, you will have the opportunity to collaborate and work with other the companies and their colleagues



  





  





**Who is Monfido:** 




  





 We are a new player on the market aiming to change the way Salesforce projects are done. With our background in the industry, we have seen many examples of what works, and more importantly, what doesn’t work. We love Salesforce, but we also know it can be confusing – and that once they’ve bought it, many companies simply don’t know how to realise value from it.
 



 We aim to change that.
 



  





 By bringing people and processes together, we work to ensure consistency, compliance, and scalability for our customers. We know businesses can get more from Salesforce. We’re the people who can make it happen.
 



  





 Monfido is part of Newground Alliance, a group of independent, multi-sector specialist consultancies. We put tasks and people before process and structure, and simplicity before ego.
 



  





 That’s consulting done right
 



  





 We review applications continuously and look forward to your application!

title: AFRY Future söker nyexaminerad produktionsberedare
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Ta möjligheten att ansluta dig till AFRY Future Graduate Program - ett samarbete mellan AFRY och vår framgångsrika kund i Södertälje. Vår kund befinner dig i en period av flera spännande förändringar och utmaningar och söker nu en driven och teknikintresserad produktionsberedare.
   

  

 Som beredare har du en central roll för att säkra störningsfria produktintroduktioner och produktförbättringar i produktion. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med produktionstekniker, både på plats i Södertälje och i en internationell miljö. I rollen som beredare kommer du att fungera som länken mellan produktion och konstruktion.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att kvalitetssäkra avdelningens processer. Detta görs genom att bl.a. arkivera, lagerlägga och optimera verktygsdetaljer. Du kommer arbeta med kontinuerliga förbättringar och säkerställer att förbättringarna genomförs enligt företagets rutiner. Modellering i CAD (CATIA) förekommer som en naturlig del av arbetet.
   

  

 Teamet består av ett gäng engagerade och arbetsglada kollegor där du erbjuds goda möjligheter att utvecklas.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Du är en civilingenjör, gärna inom Maskinteknik eller Design och Produktuveckling, och har erfarenhet från en produktionsmiljö - i den bästa av världar från fordonsbranschen. Om du dessutom har kunskap inom skärande bearbetning anses detta extra meriterande.
   

  

 Som person är du noggrann, strukturerad och gillar ordning och reda.
   

  

 Som beredare på avdelningen ställs krav på både projektledaregenskaper och en generell teknisk kompetens. Du trivs med att ha många kontaktytor och samarbetar gärna brett för att säkerställa att så bra resultat som möjligt nås.
   

  

 Du har lätt för att både läsa och förstå ritningar och behärskar åtminstone något CAD-program, gärna CATIA. Du har dessutom god IT-vana och har inget emot att arbeta i komplexa IT-system.
   

  

 Att fördjupa dig i tekniska frågeställningar är något som du drivs av. Du tar gärna egna initiativ och ställer frågor eller letar svaret på egen hand när frågeställningar uppstår.
   

  

*Kandidatutvärdering sker löpande så tveka inte att ansöka redan idag. Sista dag för ansökan är 2024-06-23.*
**Ytterligare information**
 AFRYs Future-koncept ger dig en konkurrenskraftig väg in på arbetsmarknaden. Konceptet sker i samarbete med kunden och du får under uppdraget testa på konsultrollen samtidigt som du redan från dag 1 får en god insikt i en mycket spännande kund. Efter avslutat Future-uppdrag är ambitionen från kunden att erbjuda en fast tjänst till konsulten.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår Future-väg här https://afry.com/sv/bli-en-del-av-afry/studenter-och-nyexaminerade/afry-future-graduate-program
   

  

 För frågor kring tjänsten eller Future-konceptet, kontakta rekryterande chef på henrik.kindstrand@afry.com
   

  

 För frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryteringspartner Fanny Sjödell, fanny.sjodell@afry.com
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Senior Project Manager for the Internal PMO at Atea Managed Services
description:
***Are you a skilled Senior project manager with a high degree of IT business understanding and proven experience in managing IT projects? Then we do have an exciting and challenging job for you.**
**Succeed as Senior Project Manager in our global PMO in Managed Services***
 As senior Project Manager in Development & Governance in Atea Managed Services you will lead IT Capability projects, IT Service Development projects, solution implementation, and transformation projects serving all Atea Managed Services divisions with a focus on delivering value.
   

  

 You will be responsible for the management of projects when assessing, planning, resource allocation, execution, daily management, together with the project team do technical and organizational problem solving as well as follow-up, hand over, evaluation and closure of the project. You must manage the stakeholder’s expectations, drive, and motivate the project team and be the link between management and project team, organize internal team and cross-team cooperation, control task completion and project deliveries to ensure scope and quality is fulfilled.
   

  

 You will lead the project on behalf of the Steering Committee and ensure project deliveries meet required scope, time, budget, and quality constraints. You liaise throughout the project with the Steering Committee, the Sponsor and the PMO Manager. You are responsible for compliance with the Internal Project process and agreed governance. This includes planning, taking active part in activities, that involve communicating with project team and project Steering Committee, other departments in Atea, managing local as well as 3rd party resources for being able to deliver project outcome.
   

  

**Working with your project team your primary tasks will be to~**
* Take ownership of the project and drive it proactively following Internal Project Process to implement projects according to agreed governance.
* Unleash creativity and innovation from the Project Team.
* Carry out risk analysis, risk response planning, and risk monitoring and control with respect for budgets, governance, and deadlines.
* Ensure knowledge sharing with project manager colleagues as well as provide expert advice to lower-level project managers.
* Create and manage clear scope, milestones, tasks, handover activities for all involved parties.
* Plan and manage resources (time, people, assets, 3rd party involvement) to meet project completion deadlines.
* Share knowledge with relevant stakeholders throughout the project timeline.
* Cooperate with Enterprise Architects, Service Owners, Product Managers, IT Operations Tower Leads and Team Leads, IT Operations Experts (SME) and Service Delivery Managers during the project.
* Facilitate workshops and planning activities and participate in solution implementation activities as a management force.
* Ensure that necessary documentation is gathered, stored, and passed according to agreed knowledge management policy (KB, emails, internet etc.) for the individual projects.
* Gather financial documentation and align with accounting department.


**Qualifications**
* You have solid theoretical knowledge and practical experience in managing IT projects.
* You are driven by delivering high quality aligned with the expectations of the management.
* You preferably have a PRINCE2 Practitioner and / or PRINCE2 Agile Practitioner certification.
* You are familiar with RISK management, cost management, quality processes, project change management, leadership, and team building, problem-solving, reporting, facilitating meetings and workshops.
* You have high sense of responsibility, timeliness, and structure.
* English at a good level, both orally and in writing.


**About You**
 We are searching for a professional who is not only goal-oriented and precise but also flexible and innovative in your approach. You should possess a strong sense of responsibility and professionalism that complements your superb communication and coordination skills. A diplomatic touch is essential as you navigate through the complexities of project and team dynamics.
   

  

 Your strong business acumen and comprehensive understanding of the organizational aspects surrounding a project set you apart. With an enterprise mindset, you are outgoing and structured, driven by self-motivation and a relentless pursuit of results. We value commitment to continuous improvement and are looking for someone who is eager to develop both personally and professionally. If you are ready to bring your dynamic skill set to a role where you can make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Apply and become part of our journey!** 
  

  

 Applications are handled continuously, and the role can be filled before the final application date. Please respect to apply through our online portal and not by email. For questions or further information about the role contact PMO Manager, Peter Balslev, peter.balslev@atea.dk or telephone +45 3078 0676. To work within Atea AMS, you need to be a citizen of Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland or Latvia. As part of Ateas recruitment process, background checks are included. Atea wants to be the The Place To Be for our customers, partners, and employees as we value and work actively with diversity and inclusion. We welcome your application!
   

  

**About Atea**
 Atea is the leading supplier of IT infrastructure in the Nordic and Baltic regions. Atea is present in 88 cities with over 8,000 employees in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. Atea delivers hardware and software from leading global vendors and provides consulting and technical services to support its customers with the design, implementation, and operation of their IT environments. Atea had gross sales of approximately NOK 47 billion (EUR 4.6 billion) in 2022 and is listed on Oslo Stock Exchange.
 
 www.atea.com
   

  

 Within Atea Managed Services (AMS), we are experts in IT operations. Regardless of whether our customers want to outsource parts or the entire IT operation, we are our customers preferred operating partner. We help free up resources and increase the overall efficiency of their IT organizations. We do this by delivering cost-effective operational services with the highest quality regardless of the customers platform requirements. This can mean in the customers own datacenter, in public cloud platforms or in our own Atea Cloud. Atea Managed Services is available in five countries and more than 1,500 employees work within the business area. We have operating personnel on duty around the clock.

title: M&A and Business Development Director
description:
*THIS IS NCAB GROUP: We are a leading global PCB supplier founded in 1993. Today, we have local presence in 15 countries in Europe, Asia and North America and customers in approximately 45 countries worldwide. Revenue in 2022 amounted to 440,000,000 USD.*
**M&A and Business Development Director**
 At NCAB Group, it is our people that make us unique. As our new M&A and Business Development Director, you will be part of a global and fast-growing environment with high employee engagement and continuous competence development. Join us on our journey to become the Number 1 PCB producer, wherever we are.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Acquisitions are an integral part of NCAB’s growth strategy. Whilst maintaining a high focus on organic growth our aim is that in the coming years ~50% of our total revenue growth will come from acquisitions. This means that the scope of our M&A activities will continue to increase and we need to increase the team working with these activities. This means strengthening our capabilities and increase our capacity for Pipeline development, Deal execution and Integration capabilities of acquired companies.
   

  

 As part of these activities, we are now looking for a Director of M&A and Business development leading these activities on a global level for the Group reporting to the CEO and CFO at the NCAB Group’s head office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Of The Role**
 Lead NCAB’s global M&A activities with the objective to generate at least 10% of group top line growth
   

  

* Pipeline development
* Target approach, negotiation execution of transactions
* Coordinate integration processes


 Strategic Business Development
   

  

* Support Group Management with strategic business and market analysis
* Lead the strategy development process within the Group
* Identify and initiate improvement activities


**Qualifications**
* Solid experience of all aspects of M&A (pipeline, transaction, integration)
* Track record of having been responsible for multiple transactions
* Experience of working in an industrial setting
* Proven leadership skills and management experience of direct reports
* Experience of managing cross regional projects
* Accustomed to work in an international setting
* Fluent English a requirement and further language skills a merit


**About NCAB**
 NCAB Group are a fast growing global, market-leading printed circuit board supplier that was founded in 1993. Today, we have a local presence in 18 countries in Europe, Asia and North America and customers in around 45 countries worldwide. Headquarters are based in Stockholm.
   

  

**How to apply?**
 Please send in your CV in Swedish or English via the form below. We handle selections and book interviews on an ongoing basis. All applications and contacts remain confidential.
   

  

 If any questions please contact Eva Holm, VP People & Culture, eva.holm@ncabgroup.com
   

  

 Welcome with your application!

title: Category Development Manager Nordics
description:
**General information**
**All posting locations** 
 Stockholm, , Sweden
   

  

**Job Function** 
 01 - Sales
   

  

**Date Published** 
 04-Apr-2024
   

  

**Ref #** 
 R-81160
   

  

**Remote, Hybrid or Onsite** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Description & Requirements**
**About Kraft Heinz & Nordics Business**
 As a global powerhouse, Kraft Heinz represents over $26 billion in revenue and is the 5th largest food and beverage company in the world. At Kraft Heinz, we want to be the BEST food company, growing a BETTER world. To be the best, we want the best – best brands, best practices and, most importantly the BEST PEOPLE.
   

  

 Nordics is a key growth engine within Kraft Heinz, having doubled the business in the last 4 years, but we have just started. An ambitious growth strategy has been set, supported by increased investments. To deliver this we have put together an exceptional team and are now looking for a new top talent.
   

  

**About The Position**
 Nordics consists of five markets (SWE, FI, NO, DK, ICE). We have an excellent opportunity available for an experienced Category Manager to join our Nordic HQ in central Stockholm and make a difference at Kraft Heinz Nordics.
   

  

 The Category Manager lies within the Nordic business unit. You’ll be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level.
   

  

 You will work in the marketing team reporting into Head of Marketing & Commercial Nordics. Get ready for a lot of exposure to internal senior stakeholders. The execution of the category strategy for one of the world’s strongest and most loved brands, Heinz, will be your primary responsibility.
   

  

 In brief, you will
   

  

* Analyze & identify key growth opportunities for Kraft Heinz Brands & Categories within the Nordics markets and also by retailers
* Continuous monitoring of category and Kraft Heinz portfolio performance and develop actions plans based on the analysis and insights
* Lead the insights agenda, using platforms including Nielsen and Euromonitor and develop insights for our long term category strategy
* Play a key role to drive future innovation pipeline development and lead the assessment of NPD post launch performance
* Lead category workshops such as Brand Day by customer
* Support sales team with trade window range reviews, portfolio strategy and planogram negotiations etc.


**Qualifications**
**Hard Skills**
* Bachelor’s Degree required (preferably in Business or Marketing); Master’s Degree is a plus
* Ideallyt 5-6 years’ experience in FMCG category development & analytics
* Experience with Nielsen/Euromonitor or other insights platforms and retailer shopper insight platforms.
* Highly numerate and strategic thinking with the ability to analyze market, category and financial data to identify key trends and recommend solutions.
* Strong analytical, presentation, and communication skill.
* Highly organized with good planning skills and the ability to manage cross functional category projects both within and outside of the company.
* Strong key stakeholder management skills (both internal and external)
* Language skills Fluent in English, both written and oral is a must. Nordic language is a plus.
* Other skills Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint is essential


 Professional Attributes
   

  

* Commercial Sense You’re always seeking for opportunities to expand your business
* Analytical. We’re a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset
* Result driven. You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s best for the company
* Ability to Simplify. We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges
* Key stakeholder management you are good at key stakeholder management both within Nordics, but also others from the organization, able to influence and drive things forward
* Curiosity, positivity, resilience & enthusiasm. You’re curious, positive and enthusiastic. People know you as the driver of the team. You are a team player


**What We Offer You**
 At Kraft Heinz, we’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are what makes us successful. As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve and will be recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
   

  

* An ambitious employer; we only want to the best for our people!
* Trainings and coaching to help develop your skills and behaviours
* A career track like only few other companies can match
* Flexible and hybrid working approach (3 from the office or with customers / 2 from home)
* Family-friendly and inclusive work environment
* Competitive benefits package to support mental, physical, financial and social well-being
* A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market)
* Always room for new ideas; if you have a good idea, please let us know, and we can set it in action!


**Location** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About Us**
 The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
   

  

 No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers and creative thinkers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities.
