Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do join our table and let’s make life delicious!
   

  

**Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration**
 We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
   

  

 As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
   

  

**About Us**
 Kraft Heinz is a global food company with a delicious heritage. With iconic and emerging food and beverage brands around the world, we deliver the best taste, fun and quality to every meal table we touch. We’re on a mission to disrupt not only our own business, but the global food industry. A consumer obsession and unexpected partnerships fuel our progress as we drive innovation across every part of our company.
   

  

 Around the world, our people are connected by a culture of ownership, agility and endless curiosity. We also believe in being good humans, who are working to improve our company, communities, and planet. We’re proud of where we’ve been – and even more thrilled about where we’re headed – as we nourish the world and lead the future of food.
   

  

**Why Us**
 We grow our people to grow our business. We champion great people who bring ambition, curiosity, and high performance to the table as the guardians of our beloved and nostalgic brands. Good isn't good enough. We choose greatness every day by challenging the ordinary and making bold decisions. All while celebrating our wins - and our failures – as we work together to lead the future of food.
   

  

 Challenging the status quo takes talent. We invest in your purpose and potential by developing skills and nurturing strengths that leave a legacy on our business and a lasting impact on your career. Because great people make great companies, and we’re growing something great here at Kraft Heinz.

title: Senior Consultant Digital Trust & Security
description:
**Are you passionate about building secure digital futures for clients and do you thrive at the intersection of strategy and execution? If so, this is your opportunity to make an impact as one of our Senior Consultants in Digital Trust & Security at Capgemini Invent.** 




  





 At Capgemini Invent, we help businesses navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital transformation. As a leading management consultancy, we empower our clients to embrace new technologies while safeguarding their critical data and assets.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 As a Senior Consultant in our Digital Trust & Security practice, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of how we help clients build resilience and achieve their strategic goals. Key responsibilities include:
 


* Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge cyber and data protection strategies, including best-in-class awareness programs.
* Conduct maturity level assessments, benchmarking clients' security posture against national and international standards.
* Develop robust governance, risk, and compliance frameworks, incorporating both traditional and innovative approaches.
* Guide clients through business resilience transformations, ensuring they are prepared for any crisis or disruption.
* Champion the integration of Digital Trust & Security into cloud and digital workplace initiatives.
* Collaborate closely with our Nordic Digital Trust & Security teams.



  





 We are driven by a shared purpose: Unleashing human energy through technology, data, creative and innovation for an inclusive and sustainable future.
 **The person we want to invite to join our mission will likely have:** 



* Proven experience leading digital transformation projects focused on information security, data protection, or cybersecurity, and the application of cybertechnology.
* Previous management consulting experience.
* Degree in economics, technology (including cyber-related technology), or IT.
* Passion for combining strategic thinking with hands-on implementation.
* High integrity, collaborative spirit, and a strong fit with our dynamic culture.
* Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.
* Fluency in English, with Swedish or another Scandinavian language being a plus.
* Familiarity with current security standards (ISO 2700x, NIST) is advantageous.
* Relevant certifications (ISO 2700x, CISM, CISA, CISSP) and experience with legal and regulatory requirements (EU-GDPR, NIS2) are a strong plus.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* The opportunity to shape the future of a leading management consultancy practice.
* Collaborate with a team of passionate and talented professionals.
* Make a real difference for our clients, helping them thrive in today’s digital world.
* Build a rewarding career with a company that invests in your growth and development.



  





**Sounds like the next step in your career?** 
 If you are ready to innovate and drive change in the realm of Digital Trust & Security, apply now, and build a secure digital future with Capgemini Invent.
 **Please submit your application and CV in English.** 
 We screen CVs on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible!
 



  





 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of
 **strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists** 
 who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





 Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent, look us up on Instagram
 **@capgeminiinvent\_swedfi** 
 or listen in to an episode of our podcast
 **Future Sight with Capgemini Invent** 
 , available on Spotify.

title: TDD/ESG Specialist
description:
**About JLL**
 We are JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. Our mission is to help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
   

  

 If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!
   

  

**We are looking for a TDD/ESG Specialist to strengthen our Swedish Building Consultancy & ESG team**
**About Project And Development Services (PDS)**
 JLL is a world class real estate development partner for our investor and corporate clients. Our services affect how millions of people live, work, and play every day. It is our responsibility to nurture the impact we can have on all projects and bring value into every detail. From technical due diligence to sustainability and development advisory, from project and cost management for fit-out projects to refurbishments and major base-build schemes, our services span every dimension across all asset types, sectors and regions.
   

  

 JLL’s PDS team comprises 8,900 project managers, engineers, designers and architects across 50 countries and is actively managing 36,900+ projects yearly. Join the PDS team to expect more and achieve more. There’s room for you to design and build your career within the PDS community and the wider JLL ecosystem.
   

  

 In Sweden, PDS comprises of project managers within the Building Consultancy, Corporate Project Management, Development Advisory and Construction Management teams. The Building Consultancy team has a major focus on assisting clients in undertaking Technical & Environmental Due Diligence (TEDD) assessments prior to acquisition or disposal of assets. In addition, our team undertake ESG assessments as part of transactions or as part of improvement strategies post-acquisition to improve assets from a sustainability and value perspective.
   

  

 JLLs Building Consultancy team want to expand further to meet increased demands from clients in helping with TEDD assessments and especially ESG related queries. We assist both global and local Nordic clients in transaction advisory and asset improvement strategies concerning ESG and sustainability related items. ESG and sustainability services include but are not limited to EPC uplift assessments, energy saving and improvement calculations, building certifications, Net-Zero carbon assessments including CRREM analysis as well as climate risk assessments and EU Taxonomy compliance.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 Within the Building Consultancy department, you will provide technical advisory services for and on behalf of property companies/funds, investors and public players. Projects can vary between small scale single properties to large portfolios throughout EMEA. We are actively seeking a TDD/ESG specialist who wants to become an integral part of our diverse and talented Building Consultancy team. We summarise below the main responsibilities:
   

  

* Meaningful Impact: As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will play a critical role in helping clients make sound investment decisions by assessing the condition of the building and technical installations, providing CAPEX cost estimates, and give strategic advice to help clients in determining go/no-go decisions before acquisition/disposal.
* Key Skills: You are proficient in preparing technical reports and cost estimates such as condition surveys, maintenance plans and due diligence assessments. You actively seek new client contacts and leads and business opportunities. Your key skills in technical report writing and active client engagement will be put into action daily as you create new business opportunities, undertake assessments, and provide valuable insights to clients in a timely manner.
* Focus on ESG and Sustainability: Familiarity with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Ideally, you have worked with some of these systems or have experience in conducting assessments and identifying improvements. As a TDD/ESG specialist, you will be involved in energy-saving assessments (EPC improvement) and reducing the carbon impact of assets (via CRREM/LCA assessments).
* Wider Sustainability Services: You will actively collaborate with team members assisting with environmental desktop assessments (EDD), climate risk assessments, Life Cycle Assessments (LCA), EU Taxonomy and CSRD.


**Experience And Knowledge**
* Minimum five years’ experience working in property branch including some experience with TEDD projects, sustainable development, maintenance planning, facilities management and/or project management.
* Demonstrate a keen interest in identifying opportunities for improvements relating to cost and energy savings
* Exhibit fluent proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish.
* Have experience with or a strong interest in working with building certification systems such as BREEAM, Miljöbyggnad. Familiarity with EPC systems including improvement assessments and recommendations.


**Personal qualities**
 You should have the ability to quickly form an overall picture of complex issues and are not afraid to make decisions. As a person, you describe yourself as prestige less and easy to work with. For the role, it is important that you are someone who can build and maintain good relationships with colleagues and clients while taking great pride in doing a good job, at all levels. Furthermore, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have the ability to handle the demands of managing multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines.
* Appreciate and thrive in an international corporate environment, leveraging cultural diversity and global perspectives. Are business driven with a holistic approach
* Are outgoing and a good networker and relationship builder. See opportunities, enjoys challenges and has a positive attitude. Have energy, perseverance, and an inner drive. Have a high level of commitment, initiative, and flexibility


**Teamworking and active collaboration within JLL;**
* You enjoy working within teams throughout Europe and with different business lines within JLL (Capital Markets, Valuation, Leasing, Debt&Financing) to create value for clients and help them in determining strategy and targets regarding ESG matters and investment decisions
* Collaborate with colleagues to identify and secure new project opportunities, effectively presenting and selling the company's services.
* Contribute to the continuous development of internal structures and processes, streamlining project workflows and enhancing overall efficiency.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Collaborative and Inclusive Team Environment: We foster a supportive and inclusive team environment where diverse perspectives are valued, and ideas are encouraged. Join our team and contribute to a culture of collaboration, mutual respect, and innovation.
   

  

 Travel and Networking Opportunities: This role offers the opportunity to work on projects across the Nordics, allowing you to broaden your professional horizons and establish valuable connections within the industry. You will have the possibility to expand your network of clients and contacts, creating new opportunities and projects (within Nordics but also EMEA).
   

  

 Professional Development: We offer training programs to ensure that our team members are up to date with the latest industry standards (including building certification training plus JLL ESG training). You will have the opportunity to enhance your knowledge and skills to further advance your career.
   

  

 You will be involved in growing our project management business. You will be involved in providing strategic advice to many of Sweden’s and some of the world’s largest property and asset management funds in relation to Due Diligence and sustainability (via energy improvements).
   

  

 You will work in an international and interdisciplinary work environment together with many competent and ambitious colleagues. JLL will strive to enable you to develop via introducing you team members throughout EMEA who work with similar fields to build collaboration and improve services for clients.
   

  

 You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
   

  

 Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition (including bonus system), wellbeing, benefits and pay.
   

  

 Apply today at jll.com/careers.
   

  

**JLL Corporate Solutions AB**
**Tom Lord**
**Head of Building Consultancy (TEDD GDD ESG)**
 Tom.lord@jll.com

title: Medicinsk dirigent
description:
Vill du vara med och driva och utveckla tjänsten Medicinsk dirigent där du har en nyckelfunktion i Region Stockholms preshospital vård? Har du erfarenhet av arbete på förstärkningsresurs? Då vill vi gärna ha din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi söker nu prehospitalt erfarna sjuksköterskor för att arbeta i funktionen som Medicinsk dirigent, som AISAB har fått i uppdrag, att bemanna av hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen i Region Stockholm. Funktionen bemannas dygnet runt och är placerad just nu på prioriterings- och dirigeringstjänsten.
   

  

 Du startar med en gedigen introduktionsutbildning och kommer löpande att gå riktade utbildningar för att stärka din kompetens inom området.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Medicinsk dirigent är en ny funktion i regionens prioriterings- och dirigeringstjänst, funktionen kommer ha en central roll avseende koordinering av regionens specialresurser. Som Medicinsk dirigent i Region Stockholms prioriterings- och dirigeringstjänst arbetar du i team med prehospital bakjour och operativ koordinator. Du koordinerar regionens akut- och jourläkarbilar samt ambulanshelikoptrar genom att identifiera rätt uppdrag till rätt resurs, bedömer ärenden, hanterar utalarmering, flight-following och koordinerar regionens helikopterflygplatser. Dina primära arbetsuppgifter är att ansvara att specialresurserna nyttjas optimalt.
   

  

 Du stöttar också övriga kollegor i prioriterings- och dirigeringstjänsten i medicinska bedömningar. Du kommer att tillsammans med PhB identifiera ärenden för läkarbilarna. Medicinsk dirigent är bemannad dygnet runt, året runt, likaså akut- och jourläkarbilar samt ambulanshelikoptrarna. Det betyder att du som söker kommer att arbeta dygnets alla timmar och även alla dagar i veckan. Kvalifikationer: Legitimerad sjuksköterska med vidareutbildning inom ambulanssjukvård med minst tre års yrkeserfarenhet och prehospital erfarenhet.
   

  

 Du behärskar svenska språket fullt ut i både tal och skrift samt har goda kunskaper i engelska. God kunskap om de medicinska behandlingsriktlinjer och prehospitala direktiv som gäller för ambulanssjukvården i Stockholm. Genomfört utbildning i AMLS och PS.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i en IT-intensiv miljö med ett flertal olika system som du kommer att få lära dig här. Vi förutsätter att du behärskar grunderna i de vanligaste Officeprogrammen och har god datorvana.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av akut- och jourläkarbilar eller helikopter-/flygambulans eller larmcentralsarbete. Vi ser gärna att du har vana av arbete i CoordCom eller HEMSWX.
   

  

 Väl förtrogen med Region Stockholms katastrofmedicinska plan samt goda kunskaper om 1177 Vårdguiden och Vårdgivarguiden.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du vill vara i händelsernas centrum och hjälpa människor i nöd genom att se till att de får rätt hjälp. Du måste vara stresstålig, flexibel och kunna lyssna, skriva och ställa frågor samtidigt. Vi uppskattar också en ödmjukhet, tydlighet och noggrannhet och lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vi som arbetar här har kompetens från sjukvårdens alla arenor; sjuksköterskor, läkare och undersköterskor. Verksamheten finns i prioriterings- och dirigeringstjänstens lokaler där all kompetens sitter tillsammans, vilket gör att du alltid har nära till värdefullt samarbete med kollegorna.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 I rekryteringsprocessen ingår förutom intervju ett personlighetstest. Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass vilket innebär att säkerhetsprövning med register- och bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras av slutkandidater i rekryteringsprocessen innan beslut om anställning fattas. Befattningen kan komma att bli krigsplacerad.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Ersättning**
 Månadslön
   

  

**Omfattning**
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Chef OPK, Andreas Gustafsson andreas.gustafsson@regionstockholm.se
   

  

**Om AISAB**
 AISAB ägs av Region Stockholm och är en viktig del av akutsjukvården i regionen. I våra uppdrag samverkar vi främst med Region Stockholms primärvård, akutsjukvård och SOS Alarm AB för att säkerställa snabbt omhändertagande, god vård och säker transport av sjuka och skadade till rätt vårdnivå. Vi bedriver framgångsrikt även ett prehospitalt träningscenter (KTC) och forskning inom prehospital vård. Tillsammans utvecklar vi ambulanssjukvården!
   

  

 Läs mer på vår webbplats AISAB.nu
   

  

 Följ oss gärna i sociala medier!
   

  

 Facebook
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/2408 | Kontakt: Andreas Gustafsson 08-7000000, | Publicerat: 2024-04-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-30

title: Support and Software Consultant (with Norwegian)
description:
**About Us**
 Welcome to Planet, where hospitality expertise merges seamlessly with cutting-edge technology! As a global leader in hotel management software and a world-class player in the payments industry, we are dedicated to delivering efficient solutions that enhance our customers' operations. Our suite of Property Management System (PMS) brands includes Hotsoft from Hoist, Protel On-Prem, Protel Cloud (formerly Protel Air) - all designed to meet the diverse needs of the hospitality industry.
   

  

 At Planet, our cloud and on-premise solutions have been at the forefront of revolutionizing the hospitality industry for over 25 years. Whether it's enhancing front-office operations, optimizing online sales, or providing role-specific apps for hotel managers and their teams, we continually raise the bar for excellence. Join us in shaping the future of hotel IT solutions, where your hotel experience meets a passion for technology!
   

  

**Function Overview**
 As a
 **Support & Software Consultant** 
 at Planet, you'll play a crucial role in assisting our customers over the phone, chat, or via email. With the skills we provide through comprehensive training, you'll troubleshoot issues efficiently and guide our customers on maximizing their software usage. Beyond problem-solving, your responsibilities will extend to consulting with, installing, and training our new hotel customers.
   

  

 We prioritize candidates with a background in the hotel industry, ensuring familiarity with its processes and procedures. An innate curiosity for IT technology is essential. Don’t worry - we'll equip you with the necessary technical knowledge. Our support team comprises individuals with roots in the hotel industry, all of whom have undergone tailored training.
   

  

 What matters most to us is your openness to innovation and your eagerness to explore the intricacies of our systems. Leverage your direct experience in the hotel business or comprehensive industry knowledge to understand and address customer needs.
   

  

 If you're ready to blend your hotel experience with a passion for IT, we're excited to welcome you to our dynamic support team!
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Provide technical support in one of our many products, leveraging the hotel industry experience that you bring with you and the IT knowledge that we train you in.
* Take ownership of customer inquiries, making decisions independently and assuming responsibility.
* Communicate articulately and maintain a friendly tone, even in high-pressure situations.
* Uphold a customer-centric approach, consistently striving to deliver exceptional service.
* Foster effective communication and collaboration within the team.
* Willingness to travel from time to time, if needed.
* Be flexible with your schedule, including availability for shifts and weekends, as hotels operate 24/7.


**Who you are?**
* You have a passion for learning. We will bring in-depth training for this role, and you will bring your customer and hotel experience.
* Possess friendly, polite, and respectful manners, with excellent communication skills, demonstrating a strong service orientation towards our customers.
* Display a keen affinity for IT and a willingness to embrace new technologies, coupled with logical and analytical thinking for effective problem-solving.
* Work independently with a structured and organized approach, while also being proactive in driving solutions and improvements.
* Uphold a sense of responsibility and reliability in all tasks, operating with honesty, loyalty, and integrity at all times.
* Demonstrate critical thinking abilities, contributing to a helpful work environment and maintaining a strong awareness of quality standards.
* Collaborate effectively within a team environment, projecting self-confidence and a professional demeanor when interacting with customers and business partners.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* A successfully completed apprenticeship in the field of hospitality and/or the IT industry or other educational equivalent.
* At least one year of professional experience in front office/reservations.
* Excellent spoken and written French and English language. German is also a distinct advantage.


 (Note: The first 4-6 months are in-office for training and side-by-side learning. Thereafter, some degree of home office work will be possible based on how quickly you become proficient.)
   

  

**Why Planet**
**Benefits For** 
**LOCATION HERE** 
**:** 
 Company Pension Scheme, Health Insurance, Competitive vacation days as well as an extra day off for your Birthday.
   

  

 Planet is an equal-opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
   

  

 Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you – Apply now.

title: Product Lead, FinTech - Finance Flows
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Fintech, Finance Flows team.
   

  

 The Fintech group as a whole consists of 8 different teams, building financial services used by our different Couriers, Merchants and Customers. Those financial services cover a wide range of functionalities, including various payment methods, Invoicing, Anti-Money Laundering processes, Payouts, Cash advances and User Interfaces for a varying group of users who manage all things finance.
   

  

 The Finance flows team holds a critical role within Wolt, supporting our expansion to new markets, business models and product lines with ease and cost-efficiency, by building automated and scalable Invoicing, Financial & Tax accounting and reporting solutions.
   

  

 As a Product Lead in the Finance Flows team, you will play an active role in defining the vision and strategy for your team’s portfolio of products. You will be working directly with a team of developers, designers, analysts and other product teams to achieve your product success. Furthermore, you define and analyze relevant performance metrics that ensure the success of Wolt's products, which are regularly recognized as the best in the industry. The growth possibilities are endless to you and we are looking to indulge you with a lot of ownership and responsibility.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Plenty of previous experience as a Product Lead / Product Manager, preferably in fintech space - you know what it takes to develop great financial products
* Experience working with complex financial products - you understand for example how accounting, VAT & data integrations work and how to simplify financial processes into delightful user experiences
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding and business savvy with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in how to work with and coach cross-functional teams, at least with developers, finance, data experts and with engineering teams


**Next Steps**
* Lots of room to build the direction of product management at Wolt, with a global impact!
* You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
* In addition to our country-specific benefits, our compensation package includes a monthly salary based on your expertise and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie. 🚀
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work. 🤩


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 If you want to check up on your application or have any further questions about the position you can turn to Group Talent Acquisition Partner / Analytics, Michal Szafraniec at michal.szafraniec@wolt.com
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together!
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Michal Szafraniec
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together!

title: Brand Manager Immunology at AbbVie Scandinavia
description:
**Company Description**
 AbbVie is a research biopharmaceutical company that works to develop innovative treatments and sustainable care solutions for serious diseases, with the goal of improving the lives of people affected by disease. AbbVie is present in more than 175 countries and has approximately 50,000 employees. The Scandinavia affiliate has 290 employees with offices in Stockholm, Oslo and Copenhagen.
   

  

 AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
   

  

**Job Description**
**A workplace for personal growth**
 Since AbbVie was formed, there has been a clear belief that the people who work here are the company's most important asset and its greatest competitive advantage. Our workplace is characterized by commitment, openness and trust. We want to create an innovative environment where everyone can contribute based on their full potential. Our goal is to become the best workplace in Sweden, Norway and Denmark, and we participate annually in the Great Place to Work´s survey where we year by year has been ranked among the best companies.
   

  

****Job Description****
 AbbVie is looking for a Brand Manager within Immunology with a focus on Dermatology.
   

  

 AbbVie has been engaged in the Immunology/ Dermatology field for a long time and is one of the leading companies within these areas. Our team is currently mainly focusing on Psoriasis and Atopic Dermatitis but we are also broadening our dermatology focus further in the coming years. If you want to be a part of a fantastic team with a high commitment to help patients with dermatology diseases to get a better life, take a look at this role description.
   

  

 As Brand Manager you will have a central role in the dermatology team and focus mainly on Atopic Dermatitis. In collaboration with the cross-functional team in Scandinavia you will lead the development of the Strategic brand plan and be highly contributing to the functional planning. You will take responsibility for analysing the market landscape, collect patient and customer insights as well as gathering insights of what is happening in the external environment and the development within the therapeutic area. These insights will be used to develop local strategies and activities that further establish our products in the market.
   

  

 You will also be responsible for developing materials or localize global marketing content, mainly for the Swedish market. You will develop materials to be used in different communication channels, both printed and digital, and you have the possibility to try new ways of communicating, try innovative ideas and develop new ideas for customer activities.
   

  

 The Brand Manager collaborates closely with the Scandinavian cross-functional team and is a key member of the Scandinavian brand team and the Swedish Strategic/Operational forum.
   

  

**Key responsibilities include:**
* Lead the brand planning process on Scandinavian level; ensuring appropriate adaptation from global brand plans so that local environmental factors and market dynamics are reflected in the strategies.
* Highly involved in the development of the functional plans & account plans.
* In close collaboration with the team, develop customer activities that are in line with set strategies and that further establish our products in the market.
* Lead the cross-functional work for continuous gathering of insights regarding the patient journey, development of the market, environmental factors that effects the market as well market value drivers and perceptions of products in the market. Use these insights in the development of strategic plans as well as functional plans and activities/material development.
* Lead and coordinates roll-out of appropriate Global/Area initiatives and campaigns and train sales force in the execution of brand plan/tactical plan and marketing initiatives/materials.
* Ensure all functional deliverables are consistent with branding and set strategies and deliver emotional messages aligned to Global Brand Story. Lead the development in the team regarding multi-channel marketing to maximize our communication efforts for our products and ensure a high Share of Voice.
* Guide the design and implementation of all marketing activities including innovative marketing tactics, traditional and non-traditional partnerships, multi-channel opportunities and multi-stakeholder initiatives to meet strategic brand objectives. Ensure to use a mix of digital and traditional communication channels to maximize AbbVie's Customer interactions opportunities.
* 
* Ensure that all material is aligned to local regulation and policies, and that material and activities are taken through appropriate approval processes.
* Manage the promotional budget to maximum effect, ensuring effectiveness of spend and achievement of budget in order to deliver on objectives.
* Establish and maintain effective working team relationships with all cross-functional colleagues and take a leading role in the Brand team and Strategic/Operational forums.
* Spend time in the field to understand the development in the local market and be an active part in our customer activities.


**Qualifications**
* University degree or equivalent with a scientific background e.g. pharmacist, nurse or similar, or a university degree in marketing, business administration or similar.
* Extensive experience from marketing & sales of pharmaceuticals is required.
* Experience from brand/product management with a thorough understanding of marketing and brand building is required.
* Experience from/ knowledge of Immunology and/or Dermatology is highly desirable.
* Experience of working in cross-functional Scandinavian/Nordic teams.
* Experience of Business planning, financial analysis of business opportunities, analysis of pharmaceutical market data.
* Knowledge of regulatory and industry rules and regulations.
* Ability to support the team within tight time frames and with responsibility of several parallel projects.
* Structured, effective, creative, welcomes a challenge and able to take own initiatives.
* Excellent written and verbal proficiency in Swedish and English is required.


 Additional Information
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Kristina Norrman (Business Unit Manager) kristina.norrman@abbvie.com, or Elin Hedberg elin.hedberg@abbvie.com (Talent acquisition specialist).
   

  

 Apply before 23th of June.
   

  

 AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Chef Affärsområde Privat
description:
*Är du en senior trygg ledare som vill vara med och leda en av dom största affärsområderna inom SAK? Dessutom ha ansvar* 
*över att driva automatiseringsagendan inom skador och sälja skadereglering inom personskadeområdet? Då ska du läsa vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Chef för Affärsområde Privat ingår Privat, Motor och tillhörande skadereglering. Du leder affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling inom privat, motor, skador som är en organisation på runt 100 anställda.
   

  

 Du driver affärsprocessen tillsammans med vårt största IT-område inom säkerhet och verkar löpande för en effektivare leverans och god kommunikation med länsbolagen.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter är också:
   

  

* Stötta ett framgångsrikt användande lokalt.
* Stöttar länsbolagen i produkt och systemfrågor.
* Affärsansvaret för märkesförsäkring och stödet till Länsbolagen i bilhandelsfrågor.
* Affärskraven mot våra digitala tjänster och erbjudanden samt utveckla erbjudandet tillsammans med bank och liv.
* Ansvar över den gemensamma utredningsverksamheten för sakförsäkring och såld skadereglering inom personskadeområdet.
* Att länsbolagen får möjligheter till en fortsatt god tillväxt med god kontroll över sina skadekostnader.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser att du har flera års erfarenhet inom ledarskap där du genuint brinner och motiveras av att se resultat genom andra. Du är nytänkande, en stor drivkraft där du inte är rädd för att ta beslut och brinner för att utveckla affär.
   

  

* Du har erfarenhet av försäkringsverksamhet och kontaktyta med eller ansvar för affärsutveckling, produkt och erbjudandeutveckling och IT utveckling.
* Du är van att leda andra ledare.
* Du är en senior trygg ledare som är van att formulera och driva strategier.


**Om oss**
 Affärsenhet SAK inom Länsförsäkringar AB ansvarar för service och utveckling av länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär. Vi på SAK startar och driver även ny affär som sedan kan föras ut till länsförsäkringsbolagen, detta innefattar dessutom att komplettera länsförsäkringsbolagens erbjudande med specialprodukter för att möta kundens behov.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-28**

title: Senior Solution Developer to Team Screening within FCP | SEB, Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we are innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Are you passionate about Financial Crime Prevention - We are currently looking for a Senior Solution Developer to join the Screening team within the FCP Tribe.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 The focus on Sanctions Screening has increased significantly during the last two years due to the geopolitical situation and the volumes that we are screening are also ever increasing. SEB’s solution for screening is a business-critical system.
   

  

 As a Senior Solution Developer, you will work with the latest upgrade of our Screening solution together with the team and the 3rd party vendor. Here you will get the chance to create value by providing stakeholders with an up-to-date screening solution. You will be involved in an exciting initiative that we are currently developing. You will belong to our cross-functional team in which you will work with requirements, development, and deployment and have a dialogue with stakeholders around the solutions. In addition, you will also guide other developers in the team by coaching, performing code reviews, and being involved in design decisions, etc.
   

  

**Your responsibilities:**
* You will be involved in the ongoing development, maintenance, and support of our existing and future business systems and integrations.
* Ensure solutions adhere to SEB’s guidelines and meet regulatory and security standards.
* Guide the team's development activities and assist in work breakdown and effort estimation through agile methodologies.
* Coach the team to deliver value by helping them solve problems and remove impediments, escalate when necessary, and manage risks and dependencies
* Drive and innovate technical development aligned with Target Architecture and SEB vision to ensure future scalability and adaptability.
* Optimize how the team organizes around the flow of value
* Work in a modern, agile way and contribute with your competence and code to the bank’s digital transformation.
* Collaborate closely with the business and other teams within SEB.
* Participate in workshops and communities.
* Drive good engineering practices within your team and spread this with the development community
* Stay up to date on design patterns, technical trends, and enablers
* Assess existing technical solutions in their relevance and identify the need for technical-driven and life cycle activities


**Who we are looking for:**
* A driven person who rises to different challenges and sees problems as challenges.
* Be involved to ensure Quality assure what we deliver from a technical perspective.
* Work closely with Tech lead,
* Support Tech Lead in decisions and drive tech agenda (devsecops, etc etc)
* Help tech lead with technical road map around dev/maintenance/it sec/
* Work with the supplier and contribute to us getting an effective solution as possible
* Put technical platform in connection with our major upgrade projects
* participate in support and driving improvements that make it better to collaborate with the incident manager on issues
* Contribute to the next generation work (new system) to make sure we choose a solution that works technically.


**Experience with the following:**
* Sanctions and Screening
* MQ
* Windows
* Linux
* Kafka
* Zookeeper
* Python
* Powershell
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Github


**Experience in the following is an advantage:**
* Java
* APIs
* Tomcat
* Tableau


 We are looking for a person who shows interest and respect for others, is a team player with a positive and open mindset, and enjoys coaching other team members. You excel in coordination, are proactive in addressing significant issues, and strive by taking initiative. You always focus on delivering customer values and enjoy supporting your team by delivering knowledge and guidance in the technical vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
*We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is a nuance to every individual's career development, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:*
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Access to SEB staff banking and exclusive benefits.
* A varying position where you will be part of building our new platform as well as take end-to-end responsibility for the regulatory use cases.
* A prestigious team with experienced colleagues who value cooperation and openness.
* Opportunity to share knowledge by pair programming, demos, etc.
* A workplace where we care about the work-life balance.
* An innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Hybrid Workplace Setup


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than the 31st of June. If you have questions about the position, please contact Rasmus Hallberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career

title: HSE Advisor Sweden
description:
**Description**
**Hitachi Rail** 
 is looking for an enthusiastic self-motivated
 **Senior** 
**Advisor** 
 who thrives in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate is comfortable performing a wide range of tasks from administrative to strategic. The position is based in
 **Solna, Sweden.**
**About Us**
 A career at Hitachi Rail will help create a legacy. With operations in every corner of the world, our work goes to the cutting-edge of digital transformation and technology. From the multi-cultural strength of our global organisation to the sustainable and innovative ways we work to bring people together, there’s something for everyone to get stuck into. And that’s where you come in.
   

  

 Everything we do here is full of life. And we´re committed to developing infrastructure that benefits even more people. From the iconic bullet train in Japan, to sustainable metro systems in Europe and inspiring the next generation in North America. We´re connecting, evolving, protecting and investing in even more. And there´s so much for you to get involved in, learn from, and flourish doing.
   

  

**Job description:**
 The position will deal with all disciplines concerning office environment and projects for all relevant health, safety and environmental issues.
   

  

 You must be able to identify the OHSE Legal and Customer Requirements and to have supervision of the correct implementation of Hitachi Rail STS activities (this includes supplier and subcontractors) in compliance with OHSE Policies, OHSE Legislative requirements, HSE Customer Requirements and HSE Hitachi Rail STS Management system.
   

  

 This job requires that you are able to implement and maintain all documents and procedures needed in accordance to Local Legislation, OHSE Customer Requirements and to the HSE Hitachi Rail STS Management System. Furthermore, implement the HSE Programs for the achieving of the planned OHSE Objectives of the project, supervise the performance and implement corrective solutions in case of negative trends.
   

  

 It requires to execute the OHSE coordination activities and report the results (minutes of meeting) between Hitachi Rail STS, subcontractors, and customer during the execution of the work. This also includes implementing the HSE hazard identification, risk assessment and determination of necessary control measures and to identify and manage emergency for the construction site.
   

  

 Be able to perform regular OHSE monitoring with audit and inspections (minimum of informal monthly and formal quarterly) in work areas of Hitachi Rail STS and of subcontractors.
   

  

 You will have to meet with the Client and authorities.
   

  

 You will have to support the HSE country manager in the implementation and maintenance of the local HSE management system. This includes the preparation and update of relevant documentation, participation to internal and external audit for certification purpose, reporting to the corporate HSE management for performance evaluation and at last, the arrangement of the regular HSE Committee meetings and Management Reviews.
   

  

**Required Skills/Knowledge**
* Have a minimum of 5-10 year relevant experience as HSE professional
* Previous certified experience in Railway project/activity
* Previous experience in Civil Engineering and Construction
* Works on large-scale projects
* You need OHS, Environmental and Authority Management experience (relationships with local applicable Authorities)
* Knowledge of Applicable Legal Framework in Sweden and Europe
* Applicable Standards and Certification knowledge (ISO 14001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 45001)
* Auditing Standards (ISO 19011) and techniques certification
* Ability to travel internally and internationally.
* Reporting Capability
* presentation skills, Team working and problem solving capabilities.
* knowledge of Office (this includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint)


**Education/Qualifications**
 You are educated as Civil Engineer or similar - or Equivalent Technical background
   

  

 You have the knowledge of working Environment Act and relevant Swedish law on OHS matter
   

  

 BAS-P BAS-U certification is an advantage
   

  

**Languages**
 Fluent Knowledge of Swedish and English (written & spoken).
   

  

 Union representatives:
   

  

 SACO Ann Christin Bengtsson [email protected]
   

  

 Unionen Yang Wang [email protected]
   

  

 We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Join us at www.careers.hitachi.com/
   

  

 It is our commitment at Hitachi Rail to create a diverse environment and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
   

  

 We would be delighted if you would be one of our follower!
   

  

 Have a glance to our LinkedIn page
 **https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail**

title: Credit Project Manager, Group Credit Management
description:
**Job ID: 21469** 


  
 





 Would you like to be able to influence the future of credit processes and deliver customer value? We are now looking for a Project Manager to drive change in Group Credit Management, also the end-to-end credit processes, compliance and governance. Be part of the automation agenda, supported by a solid data foundation, deliver compliance in a way that adds customer/business value and efficiency.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 Our team adds value by organising, designing and leading business change in accordance with Business Strategy. Planning, executing, actively supervising, coaching and interacting with stakeholders to secure benefits to our customer and organisation. As Credit Project Manager, you will play a valuable role in maximising business benefits, this in a multi- national and cultural environment, were many opportunities can be harvested by having the customer in focus, supporting digitalisation, automation, value creation and benefit management, supported by your creativity, structure, drive and never give up mindset.
 





  
 





**What you will be doing** 
 :
 




* Defining governance in change, structuring roles, responsibilities and activities
* Defining benefits plans delivering continuous and incremental value to the organisation
* Driving business development and change e.g., through Business Architecture dialogues, Managing Programmes and Projects
* Executing change, creating transparency of status and predictable deliveries
* Involving the organisation through team work and collaboration
* Asking and giving feedback to continuously improve people, processes, tools and deliveries



  
 





 We are a small team driving change and nurturing change leadership, we expect you have a sharing and supporting mindset. We are looking to expand our team in the Nordics.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration – Ownership – Passion – Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best, and that we expect that you share with us.
 





  
 





 We are looking for an senior change leader with a structured and analytical approach to management who excel in collaboration, planning and problem solving. You should be a reliable, result-driven, self-starter, who is well organised, have a knack for both being in the details (not getting stuck into those) and seeing the big picture. You are a born leader, well versed in Project/Programme management best practises and methods.
 





  
 





 You are a fast learner and a strong communicator. Ideally you like to work in a fast paced and dynamically changing environment, meeting tight deadlines. You are determined and never take "no" for an answer. You take pride in delivering in time and love challenges. You like to enthusiasm people, coach and support them. You can both cooperate in a pragmatic way and make demands. You are a team player supporting the team and your management is your leading star for success. You can deal with uncertainty in a fast changing environment, keeping your team focused and motivated.
 





  
 





 You are prepared to invest yourself in the role, to grow and give what it takes. We value your personality and that you have the right leadership approach and shares Nordea values. Working with data driven transparency and smarter instead of harder is critical for us to accelerate our journey towards automation. Therefore, you need to master our planning tools such as JIRA, MS project, Kendis and how to integrate with other tools that removes redundant work and internal red-taping. You need to have good understandings of our internal frameworks to guide our team to work in a relevant and efficient way. You have proven track record of independently and proactively tackling problems before they have become an issue, and collaborating as a team member make sure that things do not fall between chairs or behind the plan. You also need to fluently bridge the landscape between Business and IT, and to make thing happen practically on a daily basis.
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you** 
 :
 




* Are self-motivated, see opportunities
* Dare to take fast decision, even when not having all the facts
* Are structured, analytical and a natural leader
* Are up to date with leadership literature, project management methods and business architecture concept
* Don’t back for challenging dialogues
* See conflict as an opportunity for improved collaboration and communication



  
 





**Your experience and background** 
 :
 




* Banking & Insurance consulting experience at senior level from any of the “big fives”
* Experience running IT project and Data projects
* Programme/Project/Agile Management certification (IPMA A/B or PMP)
* Business Architecture know-how
* University degrees in Economy & Technical
* Credit risk management and Information Technology are also good merits
* Good communication skills and to be able to make presentations at C-level management
* Fluent English and at least one of the four main Nordic languages is expected



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 30/06/2024
 



 . Please be aware that any applications coming through email will not be accepted. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Juan Cifuentes at Juan Cifuentes at juan.cifuentes@nordea.se.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden only –** 
  For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
