title: Chief Risk Officer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Risk Control Function** 





 Trustly Group AB’s second line of defense consists of the Compliance Function, Risk Function and the CISO. The position is the Chief Risk Officer who is ultimately responsible for the Risk Control Function towards the board of directors and the CEO. The Risk Control Function works closely with the Compliance team through knowledge sharing and cooperation.
 








**About the role** 





 We are looking for a Chief Risk Officer to join our Risk Control team in Trustly Group AB. As the Chief Risk Officer you will have a functional reporting line to the Board of directors and the CEO. You will report administratively to the Chief Compliance Officer and will be based in the Stockholm office. Your day-to-day work will include normal risk control tasks such as risk assessments, performing controls, hold trainings etc as well as a wide area of other tasks in order to ensure the function is executing the annual plan, addressing ad hoc issues etc in the most efficient manner. You will be part of a team covering Trustly’s Swedish operations. 
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* Lead the Risk Control Function, plan the work and execute on the tasks
* Drafting and executing on the annual plan which includes e.g. control activities, risk assessment and training
* Assist in developing and implementing risk management framework including drafting and revising internal governing documents (policies etc)
* Advice and support internal stakeholders on risk related matters
* Drafting and reporting to the board of directors and the CEO



  




**Who you are** 
* Experience in leading a small team of specialists
* You have an academic degree, preferably in economics, with relevant working experience from a regulatory/supervisory financial environment or from a consultancy firm working with compliance or risk related issues towards the financial industry
* Experience in risk management
* Previous working experience regarding PSD2 or AML/CFT is an advantage
* Organized and structured
* A team player with high communication skills and the ability to deal with diverse teams of both internal and external stakeholders in a proactive manner
* Can-do attitude and take ownership of given and proactively identified tasks
* Fluent in English, most communication is in English and Swedish






  




  


 Kindly submit your application and CV in English.
 



  






 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Senior Consultant - Wind Power
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you an experienced consultant in the Wind industry? Do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative and empowering culture? Are you able to manage complex projects on a national and international scale?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, or you’re curious to learn more, then this role could be the perfect opportunity. Join our Wind Department as our new Senior Consultant for Wind Power and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As our new Senior Consultant - Wind Power, you will be part of a large global team with approximately 500 colleagues working with wind that will support you with competence and experience to manage the projects of our Swedish and international clients through construction and completion. Wind power in Sweden is still growing and Ramboll, as a leading wind consultancy, have a key role in this development with many exciting and interesting projects both ongoing and incoming.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities will be:
   

  

  

* Technical project management in close collaboration with colleagues both nationally and internationally.
* Coordinate multidisciplinary wind power projects with energy consultants and experts within Ramboll.
* Collaborate with your closest colleagues to understand and map the internal expertise in order to always offer the best skillset to our clients.
* Identify potential projects within your expertise and widen your understanding for the clients’ needs.
* Manage projects within your area of expertise and be a part in developing services related to it.


**Your new team**
 You will be part of a Wind team with over 500 colleagues worldwide. Ramboll is at the forefront of addressing the green transition and offers a holistic approach to energy that supports the sector on the journey towards more sustainable solutions. We have 1800 colleagues in Sweden and 20 000 globally who are passionate about creating sustainable cities and societies.
   

  

**About You**
 From the moment you start at Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you can continue to grow with the company. Whilst we look forward to supporting your continued learning and development, for this role we have identified some qualifications, skills, and capabilities that will set you up for success.
   

  

 These include:
   

  

  

* A minimum of 5 years of experience within wind power and related investigations, permissions and tenders
* Specialised within one or more stages in a wind projects life cycle, from screening to repowering
* Having a qualified ability for problem solving
* Good communication skills in English


**What We Can Offer You**
* Investment in your development
* Leaders you can count on, guided by our Leadership Principles
* Be valued for the unique person you are
* Never be short of inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company


**Work at the heart of sustainable change**
 Ramboll is a global architecture, engineering, and consultancy company. We believe that the purpose of sustainable change is to create a thriving world for both nature and people. So, that’s where we start – and how we work. At Ramboll, our core strength is our people, and our history is rooted in a clear vision of how a responsible company should act. Being open and curious is a cornerstone of our culture. We embrace an inclusive mindset that looks for fresh, diverse, and innovative perspectives. We respect, embrace, and invite diversity in all forms to actively cultivate an environment where everyone can flourish and realise their full potential.
   

  

**Ready to join us?**
 Please submit your application. Be sure to include all relevant documents including your CV, cover letter, etc.
   

  

 Thank you for taking the time to apply! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**About Ramboll**
 Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a foundation-owned people company. We have more than 18,000 experts working across our global operations in 35 countries. Our experts are leaders in their fields, developing and delivering innovative solutions in diverse markets including Buildings, Transport, Planning & Urban Design, Water, Environment & Health, Energy, and Management Consulting. We invite you to contribute to a more sustainable future working in an open, collaborative, and empowering company. Combining local experience with global knowledge, we together shape the societies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Equality, diversity, and inclusion is at the heart of what we do**
 We believe in the strength of diversity and know that unique experiences and perspectives are vital for creating truly sustainable societies. Therefore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone can flourish and reach their potential. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds and encourage you to contact our recruitment team to discuss any accommodations you need during the application process.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Head of Credit
description:
**Juni who?** 
 👋
 



*We’re Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?* 




  





**What We Do 🤔** 




 Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And that’s just for starters.
 



  





**How & why we do it** 
 🚀
 



 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
 



  





**Summary 🤸‍♀️** 




 As Head of Credit you are responsible for Juni’s credit offering. You will lead our Credit Operations team, and ensure seamless collaboration with our Credit Product, Legal, and FP&A teams. You want to tailor underwriting towards our ICP and their business models, and leverage real-time on- and off-platform data to make better credit decisions than conventional lenders in order to provide an unparalleled customer experience, while managing and mitigating credit- and business risk.
 



  





**Responsibilities 👏** 




 In this role, you’ll:
 


* Lead our Credit Operations team, including Underwriting, Monitoring & Collections
* Monitor and actively improve Credit KPIs - customer time in funnel, funnel conversion, yield, margin and risk-profile at a customer and portfolio level
* Proactively improve our credit-decisioning infrastructure, including case management, risk model, underwriting scorecards and more, to ensure future scalability and optimal risk assessment processes
* Ensure sound and efficient governance within the Credit domain, fit for a bank
* Act as a point of contact and leader for the Credit domain - ensuring seamless collaboration with our Credit Product, Legal & FP&A teams



  





**Tooling ⚙️** 



* SQL
* Microsoft Office
* Credit decisioning applications (e.g. Noble, Taktile, in-house tools)
* Credit decisioning data (ERP, storefront, credit bureau data)
* CRM (e.g. Hubspot, Salesforce)
* Slack
* G-suite



  





**Qualifications 👑** 




***What we need to see***



* A bachelor's degree in either Finance or Economics
* Excellent understanding of a company’s finances, financial reporting, and risk drivers
* An operationally-focused mindset, with an ability to see a problem through to resolution.



  





***What we’d love to see***



* Strong data capabilities and familiarity working in data environments (eg SQL, Python)
* Background in Credit underwriting & operations from a fintech and/or bank
* Experience in both operational work as well as portfolio analytics
* A strong interest in our vision and creating an unparalleled credit offering



  





**Your people** 
 👥
 



 We practice people-first culture. We’re real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
 



  





**Your benefits** 
 😍
 



 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
 


* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
* Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.



  





**The process 📅** 




 CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles we’ll include a task, but we’ll notify you if this is the case)

title: Dataskyddsjurist till ICA Gruppen
description:
***Är du en engagerad dataskyddsjurist med intresse för effektivisering och ny teknik?***




  





 Till vårt Privacy Office på koncernnivå söker vi nu en dataskyddsjurist som ska arbeta inom området Privacy Operations & Development, där vi hanterar våra kärnprocesser för analys, incidenter, registrerades rättigheter etc. ICA Gruppen har på ett kvalitetssäkert sätt anpassat hela sin verksamhet till dataskyddsregleringen och är inne i en spännande fas där vi går mot att bli alltmer datadrivna inom hela koncernen.
 



  





 Kärnan i ICA Gruppens verksamhet är handel med dagligvaror. I koncernen ingår ICA Sverige och Rimi Baltic som i huvudsak driver dagligvaruhandel, ICA Fastigheter som äger och förvaltar fastigheter, ICA Banken som erbjuder finansiella tjänster och Apotek Hjärtat som driver apoteksverksamhet. Inom ramen för dessa verksamheter hanteras stora mängder personuppgifter, både för kunder och för anställda.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som vår nya dataskyddsjurist kommer du kommer att arbeta inom vårt område Privacy Operations & Development, vilket innebär att:
 



  




* äga och förvalta de processer (inklusive processbeskrivningar) och stödsystem som vi har för personuppgiftshantering, hantering av registrerades rättigheter, klagomål etc och utveckla dessa med hjälp av ny teknik, samt;
* vara första kontaktpunkt för inkomna ärenden inom ramen för dessa processer tillsammans med en ytterligare jurist samt ansvara för analys, utredning och hantering av dessa ärenden.



  





 Privacy Office lyfter fram ICA Gruppens mål och ambition med dataskyddsarbetet inom koncernen men leder även hela ICA Gruppens supportorganisation för dataskydd genom att bl a hantera dataskyddets kärnprocesser, utbildningar och styrande dokumentation. Du kommer att arbeta nära dataskyddsombuden och andra dataskyddsexperter i organisationen. Som rådgivare till verksamheten kommer du också att få många varierande kontaktytor inom hela koncernen. Du kommer agera som en drivkraft för effektivisering samt en möjliggörare och ambassadör för dataskydd.
 



  





 Du rapporterar direkt till Chief Privacy Officer och hör organisatoriskt till avdelningen Juridik med placering på vårt huvudkontor i Solna. Vi tillämpar ett hybridanpassat arbetssätt.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har svensk juristexamen och minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet inom dataskydd. Det är särskilt meriterande om du har arbetat med effektiviseringsprojekt, processer med ny teknik och har praktisk erfarenhet av kravställning från dataskyddet gentemot IT.
 



 Du har ett lösningsorienterat, processdrivet och pragmatiskt arbetssätt som tillsammans med din effektivitetstörstande sida gör att du driver vår dataskyddsorganisation framåt till att bli mer automatiserad och digital. Det är viktigt att du har rätt inställning, vågar pröva nya vägar, är social samt trivs med att arbeta med olika intressenter.
 



  





 För att passa i teamet och trivas i rollen ser vi att du har är kommunikativ och nyfiken samt har lätt för att samarbeta med andra. För rollen tror vi att du behöver vara driven, initiativtagande, självständig, prestigelös och ansvarsfull.
 



  





**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?** 




 Vill du göra varje dag lite enklare ihop med oss? Det är nämligen precis det vi vill göra. För våra kunder och för oss själva. Vi vill att alla ska kunna må bättre, handla bekvämare, laga bättre mat och leva i ett mer hållbart samhälle. Och det är du och vi tillsammans som gör det här. För att lyckas med det måste vi hela tiden utmana oss själva. Vi måste hela tiden jobba ihop för att behålla bra relationer, goda samarbeten och det där starka entreprenörsdrivet för att fortsätta att utvecklas. Innovation och digitalisering är otroligt viktigt för oss. Det är så vi hittar lösningar som håller för framtiden. När det gäller din egen utveckling är det också rätt bra att vi är så stora som vi är och jobbar inom så många olika områden. Det betyder att du kan hitta din egen väg framåt och påverka hur du själv ska utvecklas och växa. Allt det här kombinerat tycker vi skapar riktigt bra förutsättningar för att du och vi ska kunna hänga ihop riktigt länge – och ha kul längs vägen.
 



  





 Läs mer om livet på ICA här.
 



  





**Frågor och ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Sharp Recruitment & Consultants. Vid eventuella frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta Tove Flodgren Isakson på 070-241 22 27, tove.flodgren.isakson@sharprecruitment.se eller Elin Hansen på 073-540 64 13, elin.hansen@sharprecruitment.se.
 



  





 Din ansökan ska bestå av ett CV och personligt brev. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse och urvalet sker löpande så ansök gärna idag.
 



  





 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället. Vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Tester kan förekomma i processen. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser och tillämpar även drogtestning i samband med rekryteringen.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Sales Director Containerboard
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are now looking for a Sales Director Containerboard, Business Area Paperboard.**
 Are you an engaging leader with a commercial mindset and a desire to drive new business? In that case, we have an exciting and challenging position for you.
   

  

 As our new Sales Director Containerboard, you and your team will be responsible for maximizing revenue and optimizing margins for Business Segment Containerboard. You will develop, implement and follow-up the sales process within the Containerboard business, supporting, where appropriate, the alignment and harmonization with other Billerud Business Areas to achieve “One way of selling in Billerud”.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Maximize revenue and margin by translating the business offer into sales.
* Lead and shape the Sales Containerboard team. Set individual targets, follow up, and making sure that everyone has the prerequisites to succeed.
* Initiate, maintain and develop sales through existing and new customer relations in line with the Containerboard growth plan.
* Sales budgeting, forecasting and allocation management.
* Follow market developments and accumulate market intelligence to support development of the business offer.
* Be part of the Business Area Paperboard leadership team, and taking joint responsibility for our strategy, targets and execution


 You will be part of a large international business team and report to Vice President Business Area Paperboard. Frequent travelling is expected, domestic and international.
   

  

 Preferred location is Solna or Gruvön, Sweden.
   

  

 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* University degree in engineering, business or equivalent.
* Several years of professional experience in international B2B sales, including leadership positions.
* Experience from the Paper- & packaging industry including deep knowledge of competitor products and services is a merit.
* Strong negotiation skills, proven in high level commercial discussions.
* Proven capabilities to develop long term relationships with customers and partners.
* Solid leadership skills.
* A strategic mindset and business acumen.
* Fluency in English.


**Personal qualities**
 For us, personality is important. To be a good fit to the role, you need to be a team player with a commercial mindset and a deep-seated sense of sales and business partnering. You also need to have strong communicative skills and good structure in your way of working. Finally, you are an excellent collaborator with a “team before self” approach, you are down-to-earth and you have a non-prestigious attitude.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: Place customer in center, dare to innovate, lead the change and care for each other.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to find out more about this position, please contact Armin van Overbeek at Armin.vanOverbeek@billerud.com (Vice President Paperboard) or Julia Åkerlund at julia.akerlund@billerud.com (Talent Acquisition Partner) for more information regarding the recruitment process.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2024-06-26.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Opportunity to develop as a leader through our Sustainable Leadership Program.
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
**Billerud is a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials.** 
 We dare to innovate and put our customers in the center by developing sustainable alternatives that challenge the conventional in the packaging industry. Our commitment goes beyond products; it's about reshaping the way businesses and consumers perceive and use packaging to minimize environmental impact.
   

  

**We care for our people.** 
 Billerud is an international company with local roots. No matter where you work, we take pride in always making safety our number one priority.
   

  

**Realize your true value.** 
 At Billerud we lead the change in everything that we do. We have a strong focus on growth and development, offering diverse opportunities for employees to evolve professionally and personally.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Ur&Penn söker Ekonomichef
description:
**OM OSS**
 Ur&Penn, med över 120 butiker, är idag Skandinaviens ledande kedja inom klockor, smycken och modeaccessoarer. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Upplands Väsby och det blir din primära arbetsplats. Ur&Penn är ett företag där samarbete står i fokus och vi lever efter våra värdeord; glädje, tillit och vinnande attityd. Vi erbjuder en fartfylld vardag i en organisation som ser stillastående som tillbakagång!
   

  

**Om ROLLEN**
 Rollen som ekonomichef innebär att du är ytterst ansvarig för allt inom det ekonomiska området för Ur & Penns verksamheter i Sverige och Finland. Du driver självständigt både strategiska och operativa ekonomifrågor genom att känna verksamheten och analysera behoven på lång och kort sikt.
   

  

 Rollen rapporterar till VD och sitter i ledningsgruppen.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifterna består primärt av att**
* Säkerställa att ekonomifunktionen bidrar till att stötta verksamheten på bästa möjliga sätt genom effektiva, tydliga och affärsmässiga processer
* Ekonomisk rapportering till verksamheten, ledningsgrupp och ägare
* Leda och utveckla ekonomifunktionen som idag består av en extern redovisningsavdelning samt 1 anställd controller
* Beställare och kontrollfunktion för systemstöd inom ekonomi och BI
* Säkerställer att effektiva processer och arbetsfördelning upprättas
* Tillser att avtalshantering sker på ett effektivt och säkert sätt
* Primär kontaktperson för externa revisorer, bank och myndigheter
* Leda budgetarbete tillsammans med controller
* Kvalitetssäkra redovisning och bokföring
* Prognostisering, budgetering och resultatuppföljning
* Kassaflödesanalyser


**OM DIG**
 Vi ser att du har 5-10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ett modernt arbetssätt inom ekonomifunktionens alla delar. För att klara av rollen bör du ha mycket goda kunskaper inom redovisning och van samt villig att arbeta hands-on. Du är bekväm med att ta fram investeringskalkyler och beslutsunderlag för ägare/ledningsgrupp. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av att vara kravställare och det är meriterande om du dessutom varit chef.
   

  

 Som person är du prestigelös, leveranssäker, självgående, analytisk, initiativtagande och proaktiv. Det är givet att du beskriver dig själv som en framgångsrik kommunikatör (i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska). Rollen kräver att du är tekniskt bevandrad och har god kunskap att hantera och lära dig nya IT-system och löpande optimera dessa genom smarta förbättringar.
   

  

**Främsta kontaktytor internt:**
* VD & Ledningsgrupp
* Redovisningsbyrå
* Avdelningschefer inom organisationen
* Koncernbolag


**Främsta kontaktytor externt:**
* Revisorer
* Systemleverantörer
* Bank


**Systemlandskap**
* Visma Net
* Medius
* Qlik Sense
* Bizview
* Google Apps


**VARFÖR OSS?**
 Vi erbjuder ett givande arbete i ett företag med mycket energi och driv, där endast du själv sätter begränsningarna för hur mycket du utvecklas. Tillsammans med oss blir du en del av ett hungrigt och energiskt team som vill förändra en alldeles för konservativ bransch. Vi erbjuder ett snabbt tempo i en ständigt utvecklande arbetsmiljö där endast vår egen kreativitet sätter gränserna. Med vårt sociala engagemang har du även möjlighet att göra skillnad och bidra till mer glädje i människors vardag.
   

  

**MER INFORMATION OCH ANSÖKAN**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Upplands Väsby. Vår kontorspolicy är "Office First" vilket innebär att vi är på kontoret större delen av vår arbetstid.
   

  

 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med start enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Intervjuer sker löpande, ju snabbare du skickar in din ansökan desto bättre. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Processen består av personliga möten på plats och eventuellt arbetsprov.
   

  

 ”Keep it simple!” är vår filosofi, så observera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar via rekryteringsverktyget på vår hemsida.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 31a maj men tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Vi ses på Ur & Penn!

title: RRP Financial Planning & Analysis Manager
description:
We are JTI, Japan Tobacco International, and we are present in 130 countries. We have spent years innovating, creating new and better products for
 **the consumers to choose from** 
 . This is our business. But not only. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe that when they are
 **free to be themselves** 
 , and they are given the opportunity to grow, travel and develop,
 **amazing things can happen** 
 .
   

  

 That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI.
 **It is why 80% of employees feel happy working at JTI.** 
 And why we’ve been awarded
 **Global Top Employer status, ten years running** 
 .
   

  

 So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.
   

  

 Learn more jti.com
   

  

*Department Finance
   

  

 Location Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Reporting to FP&A Manager*
*Role Permanent*
**RRP Financial Planning & Analysis Manager**
**What This Position Is About - Purpose**
 The Reduced Risk Products FP&A Manager is a crucial member of the finance team and a trusted business partner to the organization. In this role, you will be active in budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes, with sole ownership and responsibility over RRP. You will participate in various ad-hoc projects and business cases to drive the growth of business in Scandinavia. The tasks may involve any of the 5 markets currently within the cluster.
   

  

**What Will You Do - Responsibilities**
* Participate in forecasting, planning, and actual follow-up in at least one of the following Marketing/COGS/Opex budget planning and reporting cycles
* Take responsibility for coordinating Business Approval Processes (BAP/MEMO) from a finance perspective
* Support sales volume planning and reporting for the Scandinavia market
* Support the financial planning cycle (Monthly closing, OL, LE, ASP) and take ownership of some of the sub-processes
* Create, update, and maintain financial model assumptions as part of the planning cycle
* Create, update, and maintain financial highlight presentations for local management, the WE region, or other stakeholders within the organization
* Take an active role and partial ownership of reporting and database maintenance in several GPM platforms
* Participate in the month-end processes and take ownership of some of the sub-processes
* Play an active role in coordinating and developing work with the Global Business Services centre
* Support any financial questions and business cases, always promoting accuracy and efficiency
* Participate in ad-hoc tasks with full P&L and MFCF responsibilities


**Who Are We Looking For - Requirements**
* University or college degree in Finance, business administration or similar
* Proven work experience in business controlling
* Experience working in an international company and with international reporting
* Experience working in SAP will be an advantage
* Fluent in written and verbal English
* Written and verbal Swedish will be an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of Excel is essential
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office pack


**You will be successful in this role if you**
* Have an analytical mindset
* Are detail-oriented and organised
* Have good presentation skills
* Can explain finance to non-finance partners


**What Do You Get - Benefits**
 You will have the opportunity to work in a role with a lot of variety in a great working culture and environment in a multinational company. Besides this, we are operating in a modern environment with beautiful surroundings. In addition, we will offer you
   

  

* Development opportunities both personally and professionally
* Company performance bonus scheme
* Wellness allowance
* Health benefits such as medical care and doctor visits
* Access to the local company benefits portal, providing exclusive discounts and services
* To support us in maintaining a safe and secure work environment, we adhere to local collective bargaining agreements


**What Are The Next Steps – Recruitment Process**
 Thank you very much for your interest in the role. You are welcome to apply.

title: Bli Systemförvaltare SimCorp Dimension hos Skandia
description:
**Vi söker en verksamhetsnära Systemförvaltare inom SimCorp Dimension, till Skandia Investment Management i Stockholm.**
 Hos Skandia Investment Management i Stockholm blir du en del av ett tight team inom kapitalförvaltning! Här får du ta stort ansvar som Systemförvaltare med SimCorp Dimension i fokus samt möjligheten att driva olika projekt inom förändring och effektivisering.
   

  

**Ditt anställningserbjudande**
 Hos oss på Skandia Investment Management kommer du att göra en verklig skillnad. Vi erbjuder dig:
   

  

* En varierad vardag att arbeta med där du får jobba med hela Dimension systemets front – back office.
* En arbetsplats där vi värdesätter engagemang och innovation.
* Stödjande och samarbetsvilliga kollegor med lång erfarenhet.
* En arbetsgivare som värnar om balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv med fina personalförmåner; försäkringar, ränteförmåner, subventionerade luncher, gym i huset m.m.


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I Rollen Som Systemförvaltare Kommer Du Att Vara Länken Som Förstår Verksamhetens Behov Och Kan Översätta Beställningar Till Färdiga Systemlösningar. I Rollen Ingår Även
   

  

* Att vara användarstöd i verksamheten samt delta i och driva effektiviseringsprojekt gällande system och processer för verksamheten.
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av systemen, inklusive löpande arbete med konfigurering och parametersättning
* Förvaltning av vårt huvudsystem, SimCorp Dimension, och flera av våra mindre system inom området.


**Värt att veta**
 Du blir en del av Systemadministration & IT, som består av sex personer inklusive chef. Teamet har en gedigen erfarenhet inom kapitalförvaltningens IT-frågor och ansvarar för användarsupport, projektarbete och processförbättringar. Inom teamet värdesätter vi ett nära samarbete, nyfikenhet och vilja att dela med sig av sin kunskap till varandra.
   

  

 Placering är i Stockholm Lindhagen, på vårt kontor, där vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt och du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån delar av veckan.
   

  

**Våra förväntningar**
 Vi söker dig som tidigare har arbetat inom en kapitalförvaltning och har sannolikt minst ett par års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning. Det är ett krav att du har mycket god kunskap i SimCorp Dimension som Systemförvaltare, eller erfarenhet från arbete inom front-, middle- eller back-office i kapitalförvaltning.
   

  

 Som person är du kommunikativ och har god samarbetsförmåga samt att du har ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt. Det är även viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och drivande, har förmågan att ta egna initiativ med fokus på att slutföra saker med kvalitet.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Junior jurist för internationella klienter till CSC Global
description:
**Job Description**
 Just nu söker vi dig som är nyutexaminerad jurist alternativt har några års erfarenhet av juristyrket och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Vi söker dig som drivs av att ingen dag är den andra lik och värderar ett arbete där teamet, leveransen och att få arbeta brett och internationellt ligger dig varmt om hjärtat.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som jurist hos oss ansvarar du för din egen klientportfölj där utländska koncerner vill etablera sig i Sverige. Du kommer att tillsammans med dina kollegor koordinera och leda den formella delen av klienternas lokala verksamhet som kan innebära allt från upprättande av klientbolagens handlingar till övergripande styrelsearbete. Som jurist hos oss blir man expert på bolagsadministration och kan ena dagen arbeta med upprättande och granskning av protokoll och diverse bolagshandlingar, nästa dag verkställa utdelningar, fusioner eller kapitaltillskott och veckan efter delta i styrelsemöten.
   

  

 Du jobbar tätt med advokater, revisorer och skatterådgivare från alla världens hörn där rådgivarna tillhandahåller den legala rådgivningen och du implementerar och administrerar det som behövs för den löpande förvaltningen av bolaget. Där rådgivare klassiskt sett involverar sig i enskilda transaktioner så följer CSC bolagen löpande under dess livstid. Vad utländska koncerner behöver vid etablering i Sverige kan skilja sig åt från fall till fall vilket innebär att vi skräddarsyr lösningar efter behov.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person uppskattar du att arbeta i en internationell miljö, är driven, trivs med ett stundtals högt tempo, är initiativtagande och tycker om att samarbeta med ditt team samtidigt som du är självgående när det behövs. Du har även;
   

  

* Erfarenhet eller intresse för t.ex bolags-, fastighets- eller skatterätt
* Utbildning/examen inom juridik
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift. Gärna kunskaper i ytterligare språk
* Goda kunskaper i företagsekonomi eller arbete för klient/som konsult är meriterande


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 CSC är globalt ledande när det kommer till att leverera företagslösningar till klienter som verkar och investerar på den internationella marknaden. Vi är över 8 500 kollegor utspridda i över 30 länder i Europa, USA, Asien och Mellanöstern. Vi levererar högkvalitativa och skräddarsydda tjänster inom juridik, redovisning, lön, fonder, förvaringsinstitut och kapitalmarknad - alltid med syfte att bygga långsiktiga relationer.
   

  

 På Stockholmskontoret är vi idag 90 medarbetare som sitter i ljusa och fräscha lokaler på tionde och elfte våningen, centralt beläget i en av Hötorgsskraporna. Vi är ett gäng som tycker om att hitta på saker tillsammans och vi värderar högt en arbetsplats som kan fungera i symbios med livet. Vi erbjuder dessutom goda möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling samt konkurrenskraftiga anställningsvillkor och härliga förmåner. Vad sägs om exempelvis SL-kort varje månad eller en cykel för motsvarande värde och ett friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr?
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök genom länken i annonsen, där kommer du att kunna bifoga CV eller LinkedIn-profil, betyg och eventuella intyg, samt personligt brev om du vill. Ser För frågor gällande tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta HR Business Partner Michelle Gernandt på 070 158 30 99 eller michelle.gernandt@intertrustgroup.com. Vi kallar löpande till intervju, så skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt och senast 31 maj 2024.
   

  

 #CSC
   

  

**About Us**
 CSC is a global business, legal, and financial services company based in Wilmington, Delaware, USA, providing knowledge-based solutions to clients worldwide. We have offices and capabilities in over 140 jurisdictions in the Americas, Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East, and more than 8,000 colleagues. We are the business behind business. ®
   

  

 CSC is committed to creating a diverse and growth-oriented environment where everyone is valued and respected. CSC offers challenging career opportunities and excellent benefits, including annual success-sharing bonuses or commission plans based on individual performance. To learn more, visit cscglobal.com/service/careers .
   

  

 Visit our careers site to learn more about CSC and our commitment to our clients, communities, and each other.
   

  

 CSC takes pride in finding and qualifying people through an internal sourcing model. We encourage candidates to apply directly to our website and not through third party sources. CSC only accepts resumes from employment agencies who are part of our approved supplier program. Resumes submitted from other agencies either to talent acquisition, our hiring leaders, employees or through any other mechanism other than our supplier process, will not be eligible to claim related fees and the submitted resumes will be considered property of CSC.
   

  

*Disclaimer: The information above describes the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not intended to describe all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications
 **.***
**Organization**
 At CSC®, we’re always looking ahead, finding ways to improve and anticipate the future needs of our customers. Curiosity fuels our innovation and productivity drives our results. This proactive mindset has helped us adapt and create solutions that have enabled businesses to run smoother and smarter for more than 120 years.
   

  

 CSC is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining talented people whose personal values align with ours. We empower our employees to bring the right solutions to market to meet customer demand. That is why we are the premier provider of global solutions for more than 180,000 businesses.
   

  

* CSC is a great place to work with smart and dedicated people.
* We have been voted a Top Workplace every year since 2006.
* We offer challenging work and career opportunities. Most positions are filled with internal moves and employee referrals.
* Employees are eligible for success sharing, bonus, or commission plans based on role and individual performance.
* CSC offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package as part of your Total Rewards that includes annual leave, tuition reimbursement, employee referral bonuses, and more.

title: Senior HR Business Partner - Tietoevry Create (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
*Tietoevry Create is the leading accelerator for customers' digital products and business models. We combine design and software engineering to create new experiences and growth opportunities for our clients. In Tietoevry Create Sweden, we have 900+ experts specializing in cloud, data, and software engineering serving both enterprises and public-sector customers.*
**We are now looking for a Senior HR Business Partner to join Tietoevry Create Sweden**
 As an
 **HR Business Partner** 
 , you will in alignment with our people & culture agenda implement & drive relevant initiatives in collaboration with our business leaders and employees. The role is primarily hands-on and covers a wide range of tasks, such as (examples);
   

  

* Driving people and culture initiatives with a focus on employee engagement and retention
* Sparring and coaching leaders and managers in various people related matters
* Supporting the leaders with change management
* Handling employment related matters in a way that is aligned with our collective agreement, company values, ethics, and at the same time ensuring legal compliance
* Support in the creation of, and implementing HR strategies, processes, and policies in alignment with our business objectives
* Being an integrated part of the Nordic HR team, and working in cooperation with HR colleagues in Sweden, across Nordic and globally to develop, improve, and implement HR processes and procedures.
* If/when required some (HR) administrative work tasks and reporting.


 In the role, you will report to Nordic HR Head, and be a member of the Create Sweden Leadership Team. Worth mentioning about Tietoervy’s HR structure is that we also have a separate centralized HR support function (ASK HR), with the responsibility to manage an absolute majority of all HR admin and payroll related inquiries from employees.
   

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role?**
* Successful track record of at least 5+ years as an HR business partner (or similar HR role) preferably in the consultancy/IT industry in Sweden
* Ability to work from both strategic and operational point of view
* Strong problem-solving, decision-making and communication skills
* Excellent understanding of Swedish labor law and proven track record successfully managing various employee related situations and matters, including union negotiations
* Highly people oriented with a proven ability to build trust
* Proactive and collaborative way of working
* Able to work in a fast-paced, changing, and complex environment
* Professional fluency in Swedish and English, both written and oral
* Experience using MS Excel as a tool for running reports/analysis, and familiarity with a professional Human Capital Management System (Workday = an advantage)
* University degree, preferably within human resources or equivalent


**What will we offer to you?**
* An interesting and innovative work environment, where you get an opportunity to influence the HR agenda for one of the largest IT consultancy firms in the Nordic.
* Flexible working environment with hybrid ways of working. Our two largest sites in Sweden are located in Arenastaden (Solna) and Karlstad, and we would expect you to be physically present in one of these offices at least a couple of days a week.
* Collaboration with supportive, experienced, and multinational teams across countries.
* Opportunity to further develop in the HR area


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Please send your application as soon as possible, at the latest on 23 June 2024. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Johan Bartholdson, johan.bartholdson@tietoevry.com
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm or Karlstad
   

  

 We perform background checks on all final candidates.
   

  

 Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
   

  

**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good.
   

  

 #
 *LI-Hybrid*

title: (Sr) Manager of Marketing Strategy & Analytics – Korean Speaking (Bangkok Based – Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our** 
**Team:**
 The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.
   

  

 (Sr) Manager of Marketing Strategy & Analytics (Korean Speaking) is a business development and marketing role within Agoda’s marketing department. It involves working with online vertical search advertisers (Meta Search Engines) to drive hotel booking sales.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Ownership of marketing spend with Meta Search Engine partners and drive profitability targets
* Manage the daily advertising relationship with Meta Search Engine (MSE) partners, including and not limited to commercial terms, bidding strategies and technical implementations
* Ensure the advertiser implements correctly Agoda search APIs and related technological innovations
* Decide in coordination with the Bidding/Analytics team on bidding strategies that deliver expected ROIs and revenue growth
* Track detailed performance/KPIs and deliver regular data-driven actionable insights to improve results
* Be immersed and intimately familiar with the entire booking funnel including the user experience and conversion drivers between the advertiser and Agoda
* Build long term relationships with advertisers that foster new opportunities and continuous growth in return from advertising dollars


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering or Economics and Finance
* Fluent in English and Korean with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
* Self-motivated person with “Get it done!” attitude
* Passionately analytical with strong ability to think logically and excellent problem solving skills
* Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
* Ability to effectively communicate, influence and persuade with different levels of stakeholders (including Senior Management) with proven strong commercial acumen
* Ability to represent Agoda with experience in interacting with external senior level executives
* Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations


**It’s great if you have:**
 Proven business development and/or account management track record with experience in online marketing
