title: ICT-Tekniker till Datacenter!
description:
Utforska en spännande möjlighet med oss på Academic Work! Vi letar efter en IT- och teknikintresserad person att ansluta till vårt dynamiska team vid ICT-centret strax norr om Stockholm, i Rosersberg. Med vårt 24/7-driftschema får du en mångsidig arbetsupplevelse med dag-, kvälls- och nattskift och en flexibel arbetsvardag. Sök tjänsten som ICT-tekniker idag!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Rosersberg
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 3-skift
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Uppdraget som ICT-tekniker ger dig en spännande möjlighet att få arbeta hos en av de ledande aktörerna inom IT och telekom med morgondagens teknik i ett team som präglas av en stor skopa lagkänsla, samarbete och humor.
   

 Uppdraget inleds med en månads introduktion på dagtid där du får ta rygg på dina seniora kollegor för att bli varm i kläderna och känna dig trygg innan du tar klivet in i skiftschemat. När du väl börjar i skiftschemat kommer du arbeta i ett rullande 3-skift med arbetspass förlagda både förmiddag, eftermiddag och kväll/natt. Du kommer alltid ha minst en kollega vid din sida under skiftpassen.
   

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du kommer bli anställd som konsult hos Academic Work och arbeta ute hos bolaget i fråga. Uppdraget är långsiktigt och förutsatt att alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet finns mycket goda möjligheter till förlängning.
 


  


  

**Vi erbjuder:**



  

  
* En spännande möjlighet att utvecklas inom IT-branschen och vara en del av den dagliga supporten.
  
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö med en stark företagskultur och skickliga kollegor som arbetar med de senaste teknikerna.
  
* En långsiktig position
   

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuder vi stora möjligheter för dig att växa professionellt, bygga ditt nätverk och skapa värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande
   

 Som ICT-tekniker innefattar dina arbetsuppgifter:
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Hantera supportärenden relaterade till organisationens hård- och mjukvara.
  
* Analysera och lösa problem, antingen självständigt eller genom att koordinera med andra supportteam för mer komplexa ärenden.
  
* Arbeta med hårdvarusupport, felsökning och övervakning.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en stark passion för IT och teknik, med förmågan att ta in ny information och driva ditt eget lärande.
  
* Har goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
* Har god datorvana och är bekväm med att arbeta i ett 3-skiftschema.
  
* Är en lagspelare med god samarbetsförmåga.
  
* Har god dokumentationsförmåga.
  
* Är ute efter en långsiktig tjänst där du kan utvecklas.
   

 Vi rekommenderar att du som söker har B-körkort och tillgång till egen bil för att underlätta din pendling till och från arbetsplatsen.
  


  


  

**Övrig information:**



  

  
* **Start:**
 Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
  
* **Omfattning:**
 Heltid. En månads introduktion på dagtid och därefter arbete i 3-skift.
  
* **Placering:**
 Rosersberg, norr om Stockholm
   

 Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och kundens önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten hanteras av Academic Work .
  


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  

  

  

  

  

**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Erik Örtegren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts02@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104891

title: Desktop Engineer
description:
**Position: Desktop Support Engineer** 




**Location:** 
**Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Duration: Permanent** 




  





**Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Requirements to Onsite Support, incl. VIP Support
* For Onsite Services, the support shall be included:
* Warranty Service
* Software Service
* Break Fix Service
* Cost Proposals
* IMAC
* Technical Courier
* Service PC or Mobile device
* Replacement Unit Stock
* Additional Resourcing Onsite/Project Delivery
* Hardware lifecycle management in ServiceNow
* Printer and in house accessories (screen, desktop etc)
* Hardware connection like LAN cable reseating and connection/ disconnection with the guidance on Infrastructure team.
* Onsite support shall also include our AV management system on a day to day basis including:
* Video support,
* Problems with HDMI cables and presentation (change of HDMI cables),
* Problems with end users using presentation/sound,
* Problems with outlook bookings (Wrong room/Wrong Meeting ID/No able to book room) (Forward meeting to a meeting room can fix many thinks) (only inside outlook),
* Problems with Touch panels (Almost every time broken PDS cables),
* Problems with dialling in to a meeting (OBTP or via Join MS-Teams app) (Often check the data of the meeting invitation) & Physical onsite support in the room or if a video system needs RMA or other type of onsite service.
* This position requires all 5 days to work from office at Hammarby allé 12, Stockholm , Swden.



  





**Essential Skills Required** 




  




* Solid understanding of computer hardware and software: This includes knowledge of components, operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux), and popular applications (Microsoft Office Suite, etc.).
* Troubleshooting expertise: You should be able to identify, diagnose, and resolve technical issues efficiently.
* Familiarity with networking fundamentals: Understanding of basic networking concepts like IP addresses and protocols is beneficial.
* Comfort with remote desktop tools: Being adept at using tools for remotely connecting to and providing support is essential.
* Excellent communication: You'll need strong written and verbal communication skills to explain technical concepts to users in a clear and concise way.
* Customer service focus: A patient, helpful, and positive attitude is key for providing excellent customer support.
* Problem-solving skills: Being resourceful and analytical will help you identify the root cause of issues and develop solutions.
* Time management and organization: You'll likely be juggling multiple tasks simultaneously, so strong organizational skills are crucial.

title: Cyber Defence DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 The Cyber Defence Centre (CDC) is a key security function at H&M Group, forming the last line of defence verifying and supporting other security controls, safeguarding company staff and assets 24/7.
   

  

 We are a friendly and collaborative team that work closely with analytics and other security functions within the group. We have a responsibility to develop, setup, manage set requirements on systems and services that are used by security analysts.
   

  

 It is crucial to this role that you are familiar with Infrastructure as Code, Terraform, Containers and a CI/CD pipeline way of working. We do not expect you to know everything; we learn as we go with modern technologies.
   

  

 We think you have previously worked in or with \*nix shells and have no problem navigating shell in VM’s or containers.
   

  

 Example of the work our team is doing:
   

  

* Sentinel optimization
* Develop automized tools and processes
* Maintain and improve current solutions
* Parse and ingest new log sources
* Continuously improve cooperation with other security teams
* Creating patch, updates and architectural processes and routines adhering to all sorts of security regulations
* Improve way or working in the team as well as towards other teams


**Qualifications**
**What you need to succeed:**
* Broad and deep knowledge in Python and/or Azure, as well as any other security toolset that you have
* Ability to navigate in \*nix and have your favorite shell and maybe even a favorite prompt
* An interest in security field with at least an overall knowledge of ISO standards, security frameworks and understanding of log handling and ingestion.
* Willingness to learn modern technology stacks/services
* A positive spirit and attitude


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden and we have a hybrid work structure.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: Infrastructure Access Specialist
description:
We are embarking on an exciting journey as we are taking a step into cloud infrastructure and are looking for a dedicated and experienced Infrastructure Access Specialist. You will have a key role in ensuring correct and efficient management of access controls within both Active Directory (AD) and Azure Active Directory (Entra ID), thereby supporting our overall IT security goals and business needs in our hybrid environments.
 



  





**About the job** 




 As an Infrastructure Access Specialist you will be responsible for creating and maintaining a structured and standardized model for permissions within both Active Directory and Entra ID. You will also conduct thorough analyses and assessments of user roles to ensure that appropriate and necessary permissions are assigned. Furthermore, your responsibilities will include implementing and maintaining permissions in accordance with the organization's policies and guidelines.
 



  





**In short what you will do:** 



* Clean up legacy to set a good foundation to build on
* Work with your stakeholders to ensure the quality of the current structure
* Set a strategy for a long-term plan on how to develop and maintain a good, secure and simple structure



  





 You will belong to Internal Operations within IT and be part of the Infrastructure Team, which currently consists of five technicians and a Product Owner (PO) who work with strong self-leadership within their areas of expertise. Your role as an Infrastructure Access Specialist will require close collaboration with our security teams. We also see that this role may evolve into a product owner role in the future.
 



  





**Who we are looking for:** 




 In order to succeed in this role we see this person having the ability to work autonomously and also collaborate with stakeholders and colleagues in order to solve complex problems. What we see as a standout quality is the ability to thrive in a relatively turbulent environment and in the meantime focus on creating structure and clarity when that is not always in place. Additionally a good sense of humor and a positive mindset makes the journey more fun!
 



  





**We would prefer that** 
 you have previous experience in administering and configuring Active Directory and Entra ID
 


* Experience with complex infrastructure is highly desirable
* Experience with Google Cloud is advantageous



  





 For this role you don’t have to be fluent in Swedish but it’s advantageous to understand the basics. Good to know is that our company language today is Swedish but we are actively working on making this shift possible and if this feels exciting we would love to see you apply!
 



  





**Application:** 




 Submit your application by clicking the "Apply Now" button below the job posting. Please send your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing, but no later than 2/6. We do not accept applications via email due to GDPR. Feel free to contact Ida Rusteberg, Engineering Manager IT, at ida.rusteberg@avanza.se if you have any questions about the position.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!
 



  





*Offers from recruitment agencies/advertisers are discouraged.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are hiring a Data Engineer to improve our data modelling in our efficient platform for data driven analytics at ICA. Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platform to Google Cloud Platform and we are creating an infrastructure to be more data driven and to run the machine learning use cases on the cloud. The team has grown into a data engineering function with multi skilled teams. We now are hiring Data Engineers ready for senior positions taking lead in different specific areas. Are you one?
   

  

 Team work – and skill development
   

  

 As our Data Engineer, you will work in a team with 3-6 Engineers, some more juniors and some Senior and Lead Engineers. You will be more focused on data modelling. But also work with Warehousing / data pipelines, building technical frameworks or AI and Machine Learning. You will also be a part of establishing frameworks, guidelines and routines for the best ways of working – we are the experts designing our way of working. Some in our DE team are working more with data modelling and analytics with data science skills. Our ambition with our work is to embed advanced analytics, AI and Machine Learning naturally into our business processes. You will be using open source and Google products in cloud environment in an agile way of working.
   

  

 You build it – You run it.
   

  

 Our mission
   

  

 Our performance is enabling the ICA Business. Great efficient data quality and advanced analysis are needed for better prices, understanding changing markets and decisions in the fast-moving consumer goods e-commerce and insights for all our ICA retailers.
   

  

 We are looking for you
   

  

 We are now scouting for a strong Data Engineer with great data modelling skills. You are qualified with experiences in GCP, DBT, Azure or AWS. You need to be skilled in Python and SQL.
   

  

 Skills and experience in Data Science Data Analysis are also merits. You need to have a valid work permit for Sweden or an EU citizenship.
   

  

 Apply now
   

  

 Any kind of questions about the position contact hiring manager Madeleine Sidmar  +46722200038, questions about the selection process or terms & conditions at ICA please contact Markus Koppari, +4672 220 28 31. Apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2024-06-21
   

  

 During this recruitment process we will use online tools for interviews and getting to know your skills. We also apply drug testing before all new hires.

title: Technical Specialist - Active Directory
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success depends on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Are you an experienced AD specialist, and looking for a challenge? Do you have the right mindset and skills to join the team and be part of the transformation journey, that Scania is in? Are you a passionate driven person with a positive attitude that like to have several ongoing activities at the same time? Then we have the job for you!
   

  

 We are now extending our IAM Governance Team within Digital Workplace, with an additional Active Directory Guru. You will be a part of the team working with ADDS at Scania. You will have close contact to our stakeholders, take decisions and deliver with quality towards our common goals.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Know the bits and bytes of ADDS, at least 10 years of experience
* Deep knowledge of ADCS, at least 5 years of experience
* Automation using PowerShell
* Master in communicating and defining technical roadmaps


 You are self-motivated and passionate about cloud solutions. You are a team player that can inspire others and appreciate working in a diverse team, solving tasks together. Furthermore, you have excellent communication and presentation skills and are proficient in written and spoken Swedish and English.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Scania is on a journey with a strong purpose: to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system. To get there, we have gathered a diverse team with talented and fun colleagues, endless development opportunities and good work-life balance. We work a mix of remote and in office. Our offices are activity based with a lot of creative spaces in Södertälje, and we also have a new office hub close to the central station in Stockholm. Furthermore, you are offered annual bonus, lunch to reduced prices, wellness contribution and much more.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Jessica Löfström (Act Senior Manager), jessica.lofstrom@scania.com.
   

  

 Kindly apply as soon as possible, but no later than the 23rd of June, since selection and interviews might be held throughout the whole application period. We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 A background check might be conducted on the final candidate.

title: DevOps Engineer - API Platforms
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Description**
 If building and maintaining technology platforms excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The API Platform team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer who will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining the deployments and integration processes for H&Ms API platform. The platform enables our product teams around the world to deploy software solutions that run independently. You will be part of a high-performance team that constantly aims to improve the experience of our end users and you. In this role, you will also be partnering with teams and areas to support our unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
* Identify technical problems in the pipelines, implement software updates and fixes
* Evaluate, build and implement new development tools and infrastructure
* Ensure systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Deliver on time, demonstrating strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Align on CI/CD guidelines/guardrails with our Developer Experience Unit
* Drive refactoring of legacy systems, to help enable decoupling and modernize the software architecture
* Build the simplest possible solution that fulfils functional and quality requirements
* Actively apply best practices within CI/CD
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years IT experience with at least 6 years working with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Azure DevOps pipelines and YAML-based pipeline configurations
* Hands-on with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementation e.g. .NET, C#, PowerShell, Bash etc.
* Good expertise and experience with DevOps services administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of pipelines
* Hands-on with managing and troubleshooting coupled integrations for SCM, Key Vaults, Logging and alert systems etc.
* Experience leveraging IaC (Infrastructure as Code) for deployment automation using Terraform, ARM template etc. on Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform
* In-depth experience with API management platform (Azure preferred)
* Hands-on experience with Azure CLI and/or PowerShell & REST API
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Experience with industry best practices, strategies and troubleshooting for integration, build and deploy capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience in deployment using GitHub actions is highly desirable
* Knowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is meriting
* Preferred to have at least Azure Administrator (AZ104) and/or Developer (AZ204) certifications
* Azure Solution Architect (AZ305) and/or DevOps Engineer (AZ400) are strong plus!
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes) is meriting
* Ability to design, document and clearly communicate ideas or issues
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira/Confluence, Miro etc.


**Additional Information**
 Working with tech at H&M Group
   

  

 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of April. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com

title: Network Engineer med inriktning på DDoS!
description:
Som Network Engineer inom DDoS befinner du dig inom teknikens framkant! Du erbjuds en spännande roll där du får arbeta med att utveckla, leverera och drifta verksamhetsanpassade och flexibla lösningar till deras B2B kunder. Följ med på deras resa för att rusta framtiden inom nätverssäkerhet! Ansök idag - vi tillämpar löpande urval.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, kontorstider
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund arbetar varje dag för att möjliggöra ett samhälle med obegränsade möjligheter genom deras breda portfölj av it- och telekomrelaterade produkter och tjänster. Med ett team av kunniga experter hjälper de kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor att digitalisera sin verksamhet, bli mer hållbara och uppnå sin affärspotential. De söker nu en ny medarbetare till sitt framgångsrika team som kommer vara med och bidra till deras tillväxt, förstklassiga kundupplevelse och höga engagemang.
 


  


 Denna roll tillhör avdelningen
   

**Network Defense Services**
 som ansvarar för design, leverans, drift och underhåll av avancerade nätverkssäkerhetslösningar. Med deras unika kompetens inom Networking levererar, utvecklar och driftar de verksamhetsanpassade och flexibla lösningar till deras Businesskunder i hela Sverige. Deras kunders krav på säkerhet och hantering av DDoS-skyddslösningar ökar exponentiellt och därför behöver teamet förstärkas för att möta dessa krav.
 


  


 Arbetet som Network Engineer med inriktning på DDoS omfattar hela kundlivscykeln från att vara med i upphandlingsarbetet, delta i implementation av nya kunder till att säkerställa att de lever upp till krav och åtaganden. I tjänsten ingår även konsultåtaganden samt analys och rapportering till kunder.
 


  


 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag på heltid där du blir anställd av Academic Work och arbetar på uppdrag hos vår kund, där ambitionen är att du efter 6 månader blir överrekryterad till kunden. I rekryteringsprocessen kommer en bakgrundskontroll att göras.
 


  


 I rollen som
   

**Network Engineer med inriktning på DDoS**
 kommer du främst ansvara för:
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Implementering av kunders DDoS-tjänst och framtagning av skyddsåtgärder som ska appliceras.
  
* Justering/Översyn av kunders DDoS-skydd över tid.
  
* Analys av DDoS larm/incidenter och rapportering till kunder med eventuella skyddsåtgärder som rekommenderas.
  
* Nära samarbete internt mellan olika avdelningar/funktioner för att stärka upp DDoS-skydd både för egen infrastruktur och för kunder.
  
* Samverkan med produktledningen för framtagning av nya DDoS-skyddstjänster och funktioner.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom nätverk och/eller att ha
   

**ett års erfarenhet**
 av att arbeta som nätverkstekniker.
  
* Har god kännedom om nätverk, nätverkssäkerhet, dess ingående komponenter och teknik (CCNP eller motsvarande).
  
* Har ett stort intresse för att lära dig vidare och djupare inom DDoS-området.
  
* Kommunicerar flytande i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
  
* Är svensk medborgare då du kan komma att behöva arbeta med säkerhetsklassad information.
  
* Har ett brinnande intresse för cybersäkerhet och cybersäkerhetslösningar.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Kunskap/erfarenhet av DDoS-skyddslösningar.
  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora IP-baserade nät hos en operatör eller stort företag är fördelaktigt.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Serviceinriktad
  
* Problemlösande
  
* Kvalitetsmedveten
  
* Kommunikativ
  


  


 Som person ser vi att du har ett eget driv och ett konsultmässigt förhållningssätt. Du klarar att prioritera och kan kommunicera på ett bra sätt med dina kollegor och med kunder. Vidare ser vi att du är strukturerad, analytisk och har en mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Arbetet bedrivs i högt tempo med snäva tidsramar i en föränderlig och mångfacetterad systemmiljö, vilket ställer krav på att du är prestigelös och drivande. Du kan och uppskattar att arbeta med ett stort mått av frihet under ansvar.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Evelina Karlsson eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stw04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104847

title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
**Role:**
* Design and implement IAM solutions leveraging HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools, ensuring seamless integration with business systems.
* Architect global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, and federation solutions such as Entra ID, ADFS, and PKI.
* Optimize and manage PAM solutions to enhance security and access control.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and develop IAM strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to cross-functional teams on IAM best practices and technologies.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies in IAM, continuously enhancing your knowledge and expertise.


****Essential requirements:****
* Proven experience in architecting and implementing IAM solutions, with a strong understanding of HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools.
* Expertise in global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, federation solutions, and PKI.
* Familiarity with PAM solutions and best practices for access management and security.


**Meritorious:**
* Experience with Saviynt as an IGA tool and BeyondTrust PasswordSafe knowledge.
* Certifications in IT frameworks and IAM technologies, such as CISSP, CISM, or vendor-specific certifications.
* Knowledge of security controls and compliance standards, including ISO standards.

title: Advanced Technical Support Representative
description:
**Why Verifone?**
 For more than 30 years, Verifone has held a leading position in the payments industry. Verifone is one of the strongest brands and one of the largest providers of payment solutions worldwide.
   

  

 Verifone has a diverse, dynamic, and fast-paced work environment where employees are focused on results and constantly striving to surpass themselves. We are proud to work with leading retail chains, companies, banks and partners to develop and deliver innovative payment solutions around the world. We strive for high quality standards in our products and services and are obsessed with customer satisfaction. Around the world, Verifone's employees ensure that we remain a leader in the payments industry, based on experience, innovation and ambitious growth targets. Whether it's developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to driving success for our customers, partners, and investors. It is this passion for innovation that drives each of our employees and ensures personal and business success.
   

  

**What is exciting about the job?**
 You will be part of our Technical Support Team. As an
 **Advanced Technical Support Representative** 
 , you will help our customers and partners with technical issues or questions. You will answer phone calls, answer emails and log all cases to our ticket system as part of your work.
   

  

 This job is perfect for you if you like problem-solving, good customer service, and talking to customers. You will be trained in systems as well as products so that you are ready to help in this position, but having a technical interest is considered an advantage. If you are a tech-savvy person and have an interest in always learning about the latest technologies, computers, programs, and whatnot, this is the perfect job for you - the payment industry is constantly evolving, and you will often have new things to learn as we have new payment terminal models, payment types, etc., that we bring to market for our customers.
   

  

 Areas that you will work with on a daily basis will be helping customers with technical problems on their existing payment terminals and helping them install new payment terminals. Good knowledge of different networks such as Cellular, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and LAN will help you with these tasks. You will also need to help with requests for changes to terminal data and perform software updates. There will also be questions from customers about settlements and transactions.
   

  

 You will be working as part of a team, and it is important for this job to have good collaboration skills, but you are also responsible for the cases you work on and must also be able to work independently. Our office is located in Stockholm, and the working hours are 37 hours a week, but you will also be part of a shift scheme where there may be shifts on weekends.
   

  

 You will use Swedish in your daily work, but some customers speak English and Verifone's official language is English, so you will also need good written and spoken English skills in the job.
   

  

**Qualifications and experience we are looking for**
* You speak and write Swedish and English
* Some experience and background in technical support is an advantage.
* Strong end-user of IT systems and good ability to familiarize yourself with new systems.
* Any experience from the support function is a plus, and you see yourself as a problem solver.
* An advantage if you have experience from industries with a high volume of customers and transactions and/or from international organizations with access to several different IT platforms. It could be telecom, banking, IT or the payment industry, for example.
* You are good at communicating and have the desire and energy to provide the best support and customer service.
* You can keep a cool head and are prepared to help where needed.
* You are social with a positive approach to your work, where you are happy to take responsibility.
* Basic knowledge of the MS Office suite.


**Our Commitment**
 We offer a position in an exciting international company in a very dynamic industry where the pace is high. We are good colleagues who respect each other. There is an informal tone here, where both professionalism, collegial sparring and well-being are highly valued.
   

  

 We offer a good salary and pension package as well as health insurance. In addition, an attractive lunch scheme, modern physical surroundings, various employee benefits such as massage schemes, departmental events and a staff association that is responsible for various exciting events. At Verifone, we strive to offer equal opportunities for everyone, regardless of who you are and what background you come from.

title: Information Security Specialist
description:
**Om oss** 




 Vi vill bli det bästa stället för dig att arbeta och utvecklas på som cybersäkerhetskonsult där vi kan erbjuda utmanande uppdrag inom både IT- och informationssäkerhet i branscher som t.ex. myndigheter, finanssektorn, spännande bolag och samhällsviktig verksamhet.
 



  





 Zacco erbjuder dig möjligheter till personlig utveckling, bra arbetsvillkor, kompetenspåbyggnad och en sann tro på att utvecklas tillsammans som medarbetare och företag.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som konsult inom cybersäkerhet hos Zacco Digital Trust får du insyn i en spännande och starkt växande säkerhetsbransch. Du kan arbeta i ett eller flera av våra kompetensområden. Du och dina arbetskamrater är viktiga stöttepelare för våra kunder och utifrån kundens beskrivning av sitt behov kommer du att arbeta med att ta fram förslag på konkreta åtgärder som du många gånger hjälper kunden att införa.
 



 Zaccos tjänster kan sammanfattas i följande kompetensområde:
 


* Säkerhetsanalyser, innebär att du tillsammans med kunden, gör en analys av kundens säkerhetsbehov inom informationssäkerhet, fysisk säkerhet, personell säkerhet, kritiska risker och hot. Här kan allt från behov av säkerhetsskydd till påverkan av NIS eller annan lagstiftning spela in.
* Informationssäkerhet, vilket exempelvis omfattar regelefterlevnad, riskanalyser för specifik information samt hela organisationer, etablering av verksamhetsanpassade ledningssystem hos kund.
* IT-forensik & incidentutredning, där du och kollegor gör utredningar kopplat till cybersäkerhetsincidenter.
* Säkerhetsgranskningar, vilket inkluderar penetrationstester och sårbarhetsskanningar av system och applikationer.
* Simulera cyberattacker samt stödja kunder med olika riskbedömningar.


- 


 Om du är helt ny som konsult så kommer din första tid på Zacco vara upplagd som en inskolningsperiod där du får en fadder och gradvis skolas in i konsultrollen.
 



  





**Du erbjuds:** 



* Ett positivt arbetsteam med ”högt i tak” där du själv kan vara med och forma din egen kompetens och framtida uppdrag inom våra kompetensområden.
* En kompetenskultur som gör att du kan bolla tankar, idéer och problemlösningar.
* Du har möjlighet att välja hur du vill utvecklas inom ett eller flera kompetensområden genom att matcha dig efter din nyfikenhet och intresse.
* Du får bland annat möjlighet att välja attraktiva utbildningar inom säkerhet för att bredda och fördjupa dina kunskaper.
* En rättvis och bra ersättningsmodell och kollektivavtal.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har som största drivkraft att utveckla din kompetens och förmåga att hjälpa kunder.
* Har god förmåga att strukturera, utbilda och förklara hur säkerhet kan tillföra värde i en verksamhet.
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete med säkerhet, kris och kontinuitet.
* Har ett svenskt medborgarskap.
* Är lockad av att bli specialist inom cybersäkerhet, dvs informationssäkerhet och it-säkerhet.
* Är bra på att presentera och har en väl utvecklad förmåga i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.



  





**Det är meriterande om du har** 



* Har certifiering liknande CISM, CISA, CIAO, CISSP eller liknande.
* Har kunskap om aktuella regleringar, standarder och MSB:s Metodstöd inom informationssäkerhetsområdet
* Har kunskap om programmering, nätverk och operativsystem för att på så sätt kunna hjälpa kunden med att förstå var bästa effekt skapas i ett framtida skydd.
* Tidigare erfarenhet inom projektledning, förändringsledning och att göra föredragningar för ledningsgrupper.



  





**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:** 




 Du är glad och analytiskt lagd, duktig på att presentera det du kommit fram till skriftligen såväl som muntligen. Du är driven och strukturerad, socialt lagd och gillar att samarbeta med andra. Vidare behöver du ta ansvar för ditt arbete och vara leverera i tid, var noggrann, transparent och kreativ.
 



  





**Övrigt:** 



* Ansökan med ett uppdaterat CV.
* Under rekryteringsprocessen genomförs i vissa fall kontroll i olika register samt screening.

title: HR Administrator
description:
**Passionate about people, culture, and a star in HR administration? Join us for a sustainable future!** 




  





 As an HR Administrator at Foxway, you will play a crucial role in partnering with our onsite managers to create an excellent employee experience.
 



  





 As part of our development plan, we are now looking for a new colleague to join our ambitious People & Culture team, focusing on HR matters including tasks like salary, insurance, benefits, collective agreements, HR system and HR related projects. The HR Administrator will advise and support management and employees across a range of functionalities.
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to be part of a global company and the forefront of circular technology products and services. Foxway offers a stimulating and inclusive work environment where you´ll have a crucial role. We aim to create a workplace where all employees are encouraged to develop and further reach their full potential.
 



  





**What you´ll do as an HR Administrator?** 




 You´ll serve as a trusted advisor providing guidance and support to management on comp & ben matters, systems, procedures, and practices relating to the employee lifecycle.
 



  





 You´ll be responsible for assessing the HR needs of the organization and designing, developing, and integrating our internal processes. An exciting part of this role is undertaking projects such as system updates, seeking efficiencies & improvements, as well as driving various other HR projects.
 



  





**We envision that you** 




 Come from and HR Admin/Coordinator background - this is the perfect opportunity for someone who wants to step up and make the role their own. To succeed in this role, you are driven and proactive, have the ability to identify organizational needs and you´re not afraid to take on and drive projects.
 



  





 In addition, you:
 


* Have 2-5 years of experience working in a similar role
* Possess a solid understanding of HR processes, policies and salary coordination
* Have a proven track record of meeting transactional deadlines accurately
* Ideally have experience working with HiBob or similar HR systems
* Have experience working closely with management and HRBPs on salary reviews, bonuses etc.
* Serve as a trusted advisor to management and employees on HR related matters
* Have an education in HR administration and/or Finance or similar
* Demonstrate the ability to operate effectively in a team, contribute positively to team operations, and build strong working relationships
* Fluency in Swedish and English; The successful candidate must be able to read, write and speak both languages fluently



  





  





  





 If this sounds interesting, please submit your resume with a cover letter detailing your qualifications and experience related to this position.
 



  





 If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our TA Partner Ellen - Ellen.Berggren@foxway.com.
 



  





  





  





  





**To thrive and succeed with us…** 




 …you should have the ability to analyze and make strategic decisions. You should enjoy problem-solving and have a drive for continuous improvement. It´s and advantage if you thrive in a fast-paced environment, take on challenges willingly, and enjoy learning new things. We also hope that you enjoy working in a dynamic environment where you show great commitment and initiative!
 



**Why work with us?** 



* At Foxway, you have the opportunity to contribute to a more circular and sustainable future
* A workplace where we have fun, challenge each other, and bring out the best in one another
* Opportunities for both personal growth and career opportunities within the company
* Employee discount in our own online store
* We also ensure competitive conditions and good pension and insurance agreements for our people



  





**About the employer** 




 Foxway is not an ordinary technology company. We are Europe´s leading promoter of ESG initiatives within the technology industry.
 



 We have developed what we believe is the world's most attractive business model in the IT sector, one that promotes both profitability and sustainability. We aim to lead as pioneers in sustainable and circular business models, while also seeking to improve procurement decision-making to influence more sustainable value chains. Our goal is to demonstrate that it is more profitable for our customers to adopt solutions that use resources in a smarter, long-lasting, and more efficient way.

title: Support Engineer for CI-Machine
description:
**Innovation Unleashed: CI-Machine's State-of-the-Art Capabilities**
 We are in the process of developing a new feature for Scania (and TRATON) that promises to be a game-changer in our ability to create innovative solutions. The complexity of this project has prompted us to assemble some of Scania's brightest minds, complemented by capable leaders and ambitious developers. Our initial progress indicates our ability to deliver substantial value for the company and to meet the heightened expectations, we are looking to further enhance our team's competence to reach even greater heights.
   

  

**What We Do**
 Scania is dedicated to achieving science-based sustainability targets in the field of transportation solutions. In a rapidly evolving world, the key to achieving speed and flexibility in developing new solutions lies in delivering frequent iterations with fast feedback loops. The CI-machine serves as the pivotal enabler for this endeavor. In simpler terms, we are working to make the world a better place! 😊
   

  

 Today, many companies have adopted Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) for their software development. Some have even successfully implemented CI/CD for both software and hardware within specific product platforms. Our mission is to create an automated pipeline – an integration-as-a-service solution – that allows designers to Build, Configure, and Trigger relevant tests for both software and hardware across the complete Scania modular system.
   

  

 We aim to be at the forefront of this field! Success will position Scania and other brands within TRATON with a superb opportunity to excel in developing sustainable solutions with world-class speed and flexibility.
   

  

**Who Are You**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our team as a Support Engineer.
   

  

 In this role, you will play a crucial part in effectively managing incidents and service requests, while also working to enhance the overall user experience.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Handle incidents and route incidents to respective functional areas.
* Resolve incidents or issues quickly and effectively, adhering to SLA guidelines.
* Develop a comprehensive known error database and knowledge base to facilitate self-resolution of incidents.
* Engage with end-users to understand and solve their problems.
* Implement an early and effective feedback loop to keep users informed and engaged.
* Drive initiatives aimed at improving the overall user experience.
* Standardize and optimize processes to improve efficiency and consistency.


**Your profile**
* A bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred.
* Experience with ITSM tools, such as ServiceNow or similar, demonstrating the ability to manage tickets and workflows efficiently.
* Experience with incident handling (L2-L3) and customer support.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, adapting to various situations and managing multiple priorities with a proactive attitude.
* Background in the IT industry is desirable.
* Experience working in a global organization with cross-functional interaction.
* Exceptional proficiency in English communication, both written and verbal


 Meritorious:
   

  

  

* Knowledge in Cloud Infrastructure & Services.
* Knowledge on test and continuous integration services.


**What We Offer**
 We have a multicultural healthy and inspiring working environment. We operate much like a startup, combining seasoned in-house expertise with fresh external ideas 😊. Our collective goal is to foster an extraordinary team spirit that maximizes everyone's competence, regardless of their formal role.
   

  

 In addition to individual career and development opportunities, Scania offers other benefits such as a discounted company car, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, subsidized lunches, and much more. In Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Job Express.
   

  

 Feel free to contact our recruiting manager, Ravindranath Singamshetty at ravindranath.singamshetty@scania.com, if you have any questions or need further information.
   

  

**Application**
 Please send in your CV, cover letter, and certificates as soon as possible. Applicants will continuously be evaluated. The last day to submit your application is 2024-06-16. Please note that for this position, a background check may be conducted on the final candidates.
   

  

 Welcome on board to join us on this exciting journey!

title: Data Scientist to Quality Information
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**About Us**
 Quality information is a team within the Field Quality organization that provide statistical tools and analysis needed to describe the quality situation in the field which for example is used to be able to start new FQ-items.
   

  

 We are handling our data and have now started our cloud journey and are currently moving all our data from physical servers to the cloud, which is a part of Scania's “cloud first” strategy. We collect data from a lot of different data sources, for example, information about our produced vehicles, warranty information, fault-codes, workshop work orders and operational data. We compile this information in PowerBI reports or in another tool called SAS Viya/Product Analytics.
   

  

 Our team consists of 3 analysts and 3 data engineers in Södertälje and 2 analysts in Sao Paolo.
 ***Since the only data scientist in the team is moving to another position for a while, we are looking for someone to replace him temporarily until the end of 2024.***
**Your Responsibilities**
 In this role you will be responsible for advanced analysis, data models and reports containing data about our customer vehicles operational data, fault codes, repair history, software updates for example. We believe that there are great benefits within machine learning in this area and you will have the possibility to explore this. You will be a part of a team with different competencies and responsibilities that have the same goal, to help our customers make data driven decisions.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We believe that you have a degree in engineering, computer science or similar and that you have excellent analytical skills and like to help others. The job will also include a lot of SQL-coding and report building in either PowerBI or SAS Viya/Product Analytics. Experience in these platforms is a merit. As a data scientist in our team, you also need to be communicative, as you will be in regular contact with both the business side and Scania IT.
   

  

 As a person, you are driven and well-structured. You thrive working, both in teams and individually, in a dynamic world where agile and conventional development methods coexist. You have excellent problem-solving skills and are curious about the automotive industry.
   

  

**Needed Skills**
* Experienced in programming
* Statistical Analysis
* DAX-programming
* SQL Server & SSAS
* Building reports in Power BI
* Python or R programming


**More information**
 Don´t hesitate to reach out with any questions of yours.
   

  

 Helena Blomqvist, head of Quality Information, helena.blomqvist@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 23 June 2024. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!

title: Network Architect
description:
Fujitsu söker en engagerad nätverksarkitekt som kan ta sig an utmaningar och intressanta uppdrag hos våra kunder. Vi arbetar med några av Sveriges mest välkända företag så väl som med myndigheter, kommuner och regioner. Som anställd hos oss kommer du ta del av varierande och spännande uppdrag där vi tar tillvara just din förmåga och erfarenhet för att hitta det bästa uppdraget för dig.
 



 Som nätverksarkitekt kommer du att ha en central roll i planering, implementering och underhåll av vår nätverksinfrastruktur. Genom nära samarbete med IT-avdelningen kommer du att bidra till utvecklingen av robusta och säkra nätverkslösningar. Att ha ett starkt kundfokus, hög social kompetens och en affärsmässighet ser vi som självklart. Du har god förståelse för processer, flöden, krav och organisation.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Designa och implementera skalbara och pålitliga nätverkslösningar baserade på organisatoriska krav.
* Konfigurera och underhålla routrar, switchar, brandväggar och andra nätverksenheter.
* Uppgradering av nätverksutrustning och programvara.
* Övervaka nätverksprestanda och åtgärda eventuella nätverksrelaterade problem.
* Implementera och hantera nätverkssäkerhetsprotokoll och åtgärder.
* Samarbeta med olika enheter för att säkerställa en sömlös integration av nätverkssystem.
* Utvärdera och rekommendera nätverkshårdvara, mjukvara och kommunikationsprotokoll.
* Dokumentera nätverkskonfigurationer och förändringar för referens och framtida felsökning.



  





**För Att Lyckas i Rollen Har Du** 



* Relevant utbildning inom data/it/nätverk
* 5 års erfarenhet av nätverksteknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* B-Körkort
* Svensktalande
* Erfarenhet av nätverkssäkerhetsprotokoll och brandväggar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med LAN, WLAN och WAN.
* Kunskap om säkerhetsåtgärder och felsökningsmetoder.
* Stark problemlösningsförmåga och god kommunikationsförmåga.
* Jobbat med ITILs ramverk Check Point med CCSA eller CCS


- 


**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av brandväggar och nätverksutrustning från tillverkare såsom Cisco, Juniper, Aruba, och Palo Alto


- 


**Startdatum:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**Placeringsort:** 
 Linköping eller Stockholm, Kista
 



  





**Det här är en hybrid roll men kan även innebära på plats ute hos kund eller på vårt kontor i Stockholm 2 gånger i veckan.** 




**Denna anställning omfattas av säkerhetsprövning som kommer att genomföras i samband med anställning.** 




  





**Vilka är Fujitsu?** 




 Fujitsu är ett världsledande japanskt företag inom IT och kommunikation. Vår marknad bygger på närhet till våra lokala kunder samtidigt som vi har det globala Fujitsu i ryggen. Det ger oss möjlighet att erbjuda alla våra kunder en bred palett av kreativa lösningar samtidigt som det ger oss de rätta verktygen att vara en föregångare inom innovation. Fujitsu erbjuder en komplett portfölj av tjänster, lösningar och produkter – vi är en global partner i den digitala transformationen.
 



  





**Vad kan vi erbjuda?** 




 Som medarbetare hos Fujitsu möter du ny och spännande teknik. Artificiell intelligens, IoT, Big Data, Hybrid IT och mycket mer. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmiljö med flexibla arbetstider där du får frihet under ansvar att själv lägga upp ditt arbete i ett modernt aktivitetsbaserat kontor. Utöver det får du vara en del av en inkluderande kultur med stark sammanhållning samtidigt som du får se bortom tekniken och fokusera på den konkreta nyttan för våra kunder, för samhället och för miljön.

title: DevOps Engineer till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Bidra till banbrytande digitalisering inom vården som DevOps Engineer hos Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset i Stockholm!
   

  

 Här får du chansen att jobba med en privat molnlösning hos Europas största Universitetssjukhus. Du är verksam i en innovativ miljö och tar fram lösningar som underlättar vardagen för såväl vårdpersonal som patienter.
   

  

 Detta är en tjänst för dig som är tekniskt intresserad och som vill göra verklig skillnad inom sjukvården.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som DevOps Engineer är du involverad i att driva utvecklingen inom CI/CD, loggning, övervakning, automatisering, säkerhet, container-teknologier och infrastructure as code. Här jobbar du nära tekniken med komplexa uppgifter inom Kubernetes-relaterad infrastruktur och applikationer, samtidigt som du också engageras i design och arkitektur. Du ingår i ett DevOps team om åtta personer som tillhör avdelningen för IT Utveckling och vårdinformation. Kulturen är öppen och hjälpsam, där nytänkande uppmuntras.
   

  

 Vidare kommer du att:
   

  

* Designa, implementera och förvalta OpenShift infrastruktur med tillhörande tjänster i det interna private cloud
* Omvärldsbevakning gällande de senaste trenderna inom DevOps-teknologin
* Driva förbättringsinitiativ


**Om dig**
 Vi tror att du antingen har en bakgrund som utvecklare i en DevOps-roll, alternativt att du kommer från driftsidan och gillar att jobba i nära samarbete med utvecklare. Som person söker vi dig som har förmåga att ta initiativ och generera lösningar. Vidare håller du dig uppdaterad inom området för DevOps och främjar innovation genom att komma med nya idéer. För att trivas bra i teamet och med andra kontaktytor behöver du också ha god samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Relevant utbildning inom IT
* Minst några års erfarenhet av DevOps på Kubernetes
* Goda erfarenheter av Linux och scripting
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 Det är meriterande om du uppfyller något av följande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur
* Erfarenhet inom loggning, Monitorering och SIEM verktyg t.e.x Splunk, ELK eller liknande
* Kunskaper i verktyg och tekniker som HELM, Ansible, ArgoCD etc
* Du har tidigare agerat mentor och gett vägledning till kollegor


**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. 6 månaders provanställning tillämpas. Beredskap kan förekomma.
   

  

 För denna roll erbjuds en hybrid arbetsmodell, där teamet jobbar på kontoret cirka 3 dagar i veckan. Kontoret ligger på Eugeniavägen 18, precis intill Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset i Solna.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-14
   

  

**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset med IDG Recruitment.
   

  

 Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Moa Eriksson, Rekryteringskonsult på 070 828 36 65, alternativt moa.eriksson@foundryco.com.
   

  

 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
*Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.*
*Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!*

title: Senior Systems Infrastructure Engineer (VMware)
description:
**Description**
 What makes us Qlik?
   

  

 A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 13 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.
   

  

 We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.
   

  

 The Systems Infrastructure Engineer Role
   

  

 Embark on an exciting journey as a System Infrastructure Engineer at Qlik. Join our seasoned team dedicated to supporting a vast Windows Server infrastructure and critical applications spanning traditional data centers and cutting-edge cloud platforms.
   

  

 What makes this role interesting?
   

  

 Diverse Challenges: Tackle a spectrum of challenges from configuring VMware technologies to ensuring high availability and disaster recovery practices.
   

  

 Innovative Technologies: Engage with cutting-edge technologies like Tanzu, NSX, Aria vSAN, and vSphere, contributing to the evolution of our infrastructure.
   

  

**Here’s How You’ll Be Making An Impact**
 Proactive Troubleshooter: Take charge of installing, tuning, and troubleshooting VMware, demonstrating your expertise in high-pressure situations.
   

  

 Holistic Monitoring: Ensure the seamless monitoring of application components, covering hardware, OS, and application levels, and proactively respond to alerts.
   

  

 Collaborative Approach: Work closely with cross-functional teams, leading troubleshooting efforts and contributing to a culture of collaborative problem-solving.
   

  

 Process Enhancement: Create and document efficient processes, from server creation to alert responses, elevating the team's operational efficiency.
   

  

 Customer-Centric Support: Handle day-to-day support activities, showcasing strong customer service, and contribute to live calls for production support incidents.
   

  

**We’re Looking For a Teammate With**
* Over 6 years of IT experience, with recent 3+ years in enterprise environments, showcasing extensive VMware knowledge.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, coupled with a customer-centric approach.
* Familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS, Azure, and GCP, and hands-on experience with Veeam, networking concepts, and TCP/IP routing.
* Proven ability to respond to critical issues, manage trouble tickets, and drive towards permanent resolutions.
* Active participation in infrastructure architecture, contributing to hardware sizing, effort estimation, and security.
* Experience with Windows and Unix/Linux environments, infrastructure-as-code tools, and virtual environments like OpenStack or Nutanix.


 The location for this role is:
   

  

 Sweden, Lund or remote in Sweden
   

  

 Apply now and help us to shape the future of infrastructure technology!
   

  

**More About Qlik And Who We Are**
 Find out more about life at Qlik on social: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our Careers Page.
   

  

 What else do we offer?
   

  

* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment


 Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs
   

  

 If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via [email protected]. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.
   

  

 Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.

title: Cloud Operations Engineer
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible,
 **meet some of our customers** 
 or
 **take a look at some of our products** 
 .
 



  





**Cloud Operations Engineer** 




 ⁠Join us as a Cloud Operations Engineer and play a crucial role in our Microsoft 365 and fast growing Azure production environment and our continued journey moving from on prem datacentres in US and Sweden. You'll develop, implement, and maintain Microsoft 365 and Azure platforms, ensuring performance, security, and availability. Collaborate with IT and external partners to optimize our platforms, enforce security policies, and automate tasks with scripting. Your expertise will drive our cloud transformation forward.
 







 In this role you will:
 






* Design, plan, and implement changes to Microsoft 365 and Azure solutions based on requirements and optimize our platforms in collaboration with resources in IT and external partners.
* Develop and continue our implementations of Microsoft 365 and Azure platform.
* Administer and maintain Microsoft 365 and Azure environments, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability.
* Provide technical support for issues related to Microsoft 365 and compute/network related issues in Azure.
* Configure and manage identity and access solutions using Microsoft Entra ID.
* Work with our security team and implement and enforce security policies and compliance standards for Microsoft 365 and Azure environments, based on our IT Security policy.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell or other scripting languages to streamline administrative tasks.
* Collaborate with other team members of IT regarding broader architectural analysis and design work.
* Maintain and improve our Infrastructure as Code
* Be in the forefront of the Microsoft roadmap and assess business impacts.
* Testing Backup and Disaster recovery scenarios in Azure.



  





 We believe that you have:
 


* A minimum of 5 years of experience working with Microsoft platforms: Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365.
* Windows server (migration, updating and configuration)
* Windows infrastructure (Active Directory, Entra ID, DNS, DHCP)
* Microsoft Exchange Online, Microsoft SharePoint, Azure Intune, Azure Virtual Desktop
* Direct experience with Azure's Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) offerings, Azure Networking, and Azure Security.
* Privilege Identity Management
* Experienced with DevOps and Orchestration of Infrastructure as Code
* Hybrid IT-environments (on-prem and cloud)
* Meriting with experience of automation through Powershell scripting.



  





**Where we stand:** 




 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
 



  





 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
 



  





 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Sales Specialist - Prisma Cloud - Sweden
description:
**Company Description**
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Our Approach to Work**
 We lead with flexibility and choice in all of our people programs. We have disrupted the traditional view that all employees have the same needs and wants. We offer personalization and offer our employees the opportunity to choose what works best for them as often as possible - from your wellbeing support to your growth and development, and beyond!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 You will join the exciting and high growth Prisma Cloud business unit positioning the industry’s most comprehensive cloud native security platform, securing applications from Code to Cloud (Cloud Security Posture Management, Cloud Workload Protection, Application Security, Cloud Identity, etc…).
   

  

 Prisma Cloud is the industry’s broadest security and compliance coverage for applications, data, and the entire cloud native technology stack throughout the development lifecycle and across hybrid and multi-cloud environments.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for managing a focus set of strategic and global accounts, driving the sales for our Prisma Cloud solutions. It is expected that you deliver or exceed your sales targets in both new business and renewals.. The role expects you to define your territory, strategies and then lead local execution and in alignment to company strategies and tactics, in partnership with the Prisma Cloud ecosystem such as CSPs, GSIs and local focus cloud security partners.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Land and expand a set of defined global & strategic accounts
* Achieve ACV sales quotas on a monthly, quarterly basis and yearly basis
* Track and report on all opportunities, pipeline, and bookings to provide forecast reports to region management
* Engage with the local ecosystem sales programs and joint activities
* Develop, share and implement standard methodologies and account strategies to increase our sales penetration of Cloud Security into our top accounts
* Engage with customers to identify and progress opportunities whilst delivering subject matter expertise on Cloud & Cloud Native Security solutions
* Establish and maintain effective relationships with channel partners
* Keep up to date knowledge of Cloud Computing, DevOps & Cloud Native technologies as well as the competitive position of the company
* Conduct consistent training and communications for the sales and channel teams as well as joint engagement within the wider organisation
* Contribute to the larger Palo Alto Network’s Cloud & Cloud Native strategy by providing regional specific intelligence and reporting


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* 5+ years' experience exceeding sales quota as an Enterprise/ Major/ Named/ Strategic Account Manager
* Experience in software solutions value selling (saas/subscription)
* Prior experience of selling cloud and/or security solutions is strongly preferred
* Experience of working for a multinational IT vendor
* Sales excellence - ability to demonstrate account planning, strategy, qualification and execution
* Excellent communication skills including strong verbal and written skills and proven presentation skills being able to articulate complex topics


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
   

  

**Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship?: No.** 
**Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.**

title: Data Engineer to Handelsbanken's Analytical Platform Team
description:
Our Analytical Platform Team at Handelsbanken is looking for a Data Engineer. Take this opportunity to become part of a large customer-centric organization where we work close to the end-user.
   

  

**Your team**
 We're a team of 10 people, Data- & DevOps Engineers, Solution Architects, a Team Coach and a Product Owner. Our team has an agile way of working and close collaboration with colleagues from several business departments and Data-, Science, Analysis and Governance teams.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Data Engineer you will focus on preparing big data for analytical or operational uses. You will design and implement scalable ETL/ELT pipelines, manage data storage and ensure the quality and accessibility of the data. Additionally you will be involved in designing and improving the architecture by, for instance, overseeing and testing robust and high-performance code with reusable components.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We're looking for an experienced Data Engineer who has worked within a larger IT organization. For this role, we believe you:
   

  

* have experience with various data ingestion techniques such as CDC, APIs, file-based loading and database links
* are accustomed to working with DBT for data transformation and pipeline construction
* have worked with relational databases and different data source systems and understand how they are presented
* are proficient in ETL/ELT processes, Data Modeling, SQL Server and T-SQL
* are used to working with Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipelines and project management as well as Airflow for pipeline scheduling
* have good knowledge of system relationships, processes, and IT Security
* have experience of python, scripting, automation and production deployment


 It's also necessary to be able to communicate in written and verbal Swedish and English.
   

  

 In addition to your technical skills, you're able to communicate with stakeholders to convey and understand the business context of the data. You enjoy collaborating with others and finding solutions.
   

  

**We Offer**
* A trusted and stable employer
* Exciting and challenging tasks
* Good work-life balance
* Career development opportunities
* Clear corporate values around social responsibility and sustainability
* Competitive package of staff benefits


**Contact details**
**Manager:** 
 Anna Baecklund, +46 101875908, anna.baecklund@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**HR:** 
 Louise Doverholt, louise.doverholt@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Union representative Finansförbundet:** 
 Susanne Ahlberg, susanne.ahlberg@handelsbanken.se

 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se
