title: Senior DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer - full-time
description:
**Join the Divio Adventure!**


Passionate about infrastructure and security, your head always in the cloud, and looking for new challenges? Look no further! Although Divio is a small hosting provider, we strive for ambitious goals.

**What is Divio?**


As a small team equipped with keyboards and ambitious goals, we provide the ability to easily deploy containerized applications to any cloud (AWS, Azure, Exoscale, you name it!) and region with just a single click. Divio offers all the features you would expect from a PaaS, and more. To find out more, visit https://www.divio.com/developers/ or, even better, try it yourself to get a feel of what we build.

**What about the job?**


As a Site Reliability Engineer at Divio, the overall performance, security, cost-effectiveness and reliability of the cloud infrastructure are in your hands (no pressure). Together with the team, you manage the entire software development life cycle, end to end. This includes creating robust solutions that follow security and good engineering principles, constantly monitoring and improving the system, replacing “boring” manual tasks with powerful automation, answering swiftly to client queries (L3 only, don’t worry) and participating in the “on-call” rotation. In all those activities, you act wisely and with foresight, make accurate estimations, and assess the consequences of your actions thoroughly.


At Divio, you will be able to touch everything, to bring your own ideas to the table and (hopefully) to have fun. However, we also care for excellence and expect you to fit into the mindset of the existing SRE/engineering team. You understand that your work is not only about programming. Your proactive nature makes it easy for you to anticipate problems and communicate any risks at an early stage. If something goes wrong, you avoid passing the blame and take on the responsibility for your work. You can see the impact your work has on others and if there is an issue arising you address it positively. You are helpful and considerate with your team members and if you can, help others to grow. On the other hand, you do not hesitate to ask for help and are actively seeking to learn from more experienced colleagues. You are passionate and continuously stay up-to-date with industry developments.


As a heads up, the recruitment process at Divio is only 3 steps: (1) a short meeting of around 30 minutes to get to know each other, (2) a no-code technical interview of around 1.5 hours with the subjects given in advance, (3) a final administrative meeting to settle on the salary, conditions, contract, etc.

**Requirements**

**Must have / very good expertise in:**

* Configuration management softwares (Ansible, Terraform)
* Docker, IaaS providers and Cloud Native Technologies (AWS, Azure)
* Linux system administration and optimization
* TCP/IP network stack (including UDP), web-related protocols (HTTP, TLS, DNS,...) and load-balancing

**Important / expertise in:**

* Backing services such as PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ, ElasticSearch, etc. including setup, administration, scaling, and monitoring thereof
* Experience in programming (Go, Java, …) with a strong preference for **Python** (heavily used at Divio)
* Scripting languages (Bash, Python)
* Git

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with Django or other Python-based web frameworks
* Experience with other cloud providers (e.g. Google Cloud)
* Knowledge of Kubernetes

**Core competencies / soft skills:**

* Very professional in contact with clients and a high degree of empathy to assess their concerns properly and rapidly
* Extremely reliable character, able to work independently and to cope with pressure
* A team player experienced in working in intercultural and remote teams
* Excellent command of spoken and written English
* Avidity to learn and improve

**Benefits**


In our small company, change is embraced, and we try to avoid endless meetings and political maneuvers as much as possible. Our focus is 100% on engineering!


Here are some of the perks of joining Divio:


✨ Remote Wonderland: join us from the comfort of your favourite spot, wherever that may be. We believe in high flexibility because creativity knows no boundaries, and who doesn’t want to work in panties?


✨ Dream Team: Members of our multi-cultural team are as nice as Swiss chocolate and as efficient as German engineers. We hold to high-quality standards and are selective in our hiring, so you will be among your peers.


✨ Tech Playground: we've got a "smorgasbord" of technologies for you to play with, and big challenges ahead of us. We are always up for adopting new and better techs & processes. Help us discover which they are!


 Big Impact: your ideas won't get lost in the abyss of corporate bureaucracy. Everyone stands on equal ground here, and your influence can be as substantial as you make it.


 Brag to Friends: the Divio platform is just awesome, so you will always have something to talk about in tech gatherings. Plus, you will enjoy premium hosting for all your projects, in case you want to show off your side hustles too!

title: HEAD OF PRIVILIGED ACCESS MANAGEMENT TILL NORDEA
description:
Vill du vara med på en mycket lärorik resa där vi leder vägen och tänjer gränser för att transformera framtidens bankverksamhet och skapa bankens framtida digitala finansiella lösningar, där samarbete och ägarskap är viktigt? Tillsammans utnyttjar vi teknikens kraft för att uppfinna framtidens bankverksamhet där du kommer att spela en stor roll i denna digitala revolution. Hos oss får du vara med och påverka i en prestigelös miljö där vi gärna utbyter erfarenheter. På Nordea får du arbeta i en snabbrörlig miljö med mycket skickliga kollegor med stor passion för finans -IT, i internationella team för att göra oss ännu mer digitala och kunna tillgodose våra kunders föränderliga behov. Detta gör vi genom innovativa lösningar, ett bra samarbete och genom partnerskap. Nordea erbjuder mycket fina förmåner och en miljö med många interna utvecklingsmöjligheter. www.nordea.se
  
Identity and Access management-området är ett prioriterat område hos oss som växer och därför söker vi nu en Head of Privileged Access Management. PAM är en del inom IAM. Inom området tillhandahåller vi centraliserade och standardiserade IAM-tjänster för hela Nordea som förvärvar dessa tjänster. IAM tillhör området Cybersäkerhet inom Nordea.
  
Om tjänsten
  
I rollen som Head of PAM ansvarar du för och leder Privileged Access Management-teamet som är består av ca 8 personer som tillsammans arbetar med krav, design och utveckling av vår affärskritiska CyberArk-applikation. Som ledare för teamet spelar du en värdefull roll i att skapa affärsplaner, utveckla och coacha dina direktrapporterande, inklusive Product Owner och Scrum Master. Du kommer också att spela en viktig roll i att bidra till den övergripande IAM-affärsplanen framåt.
  
  

**I ditt dagliga arbete kommer du att:**  

Leda ett globalt team bestående av ca 8 anställda med placering i Sverige, Finland och Polen.
  
Definiera och sätta vision och affärsplan samt vidareutveckla PAM-området. Du driver förbättringar löpande och bidrar till IAM-strategin framåt.
  
Säkerställa en bra kommunikation gentemot intressenter och ledning samt med ledningsgruppen.
  
Stötta ditt team i arbetet med att utvärdera business cases av utvecklingsobjekt och se till att produktutvecklingen är i linje med övergripande mål och behoven hos banken samt hos slutanvändarna
  
Säkerställa att kraven på efterlevnad av lagar och regler följs.
  
  

Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med bland annat Operations avdelningen för att säkerställa Devops och end-to-end ansvar för applikationen.
  
Din kompetens och erfarenhet
  
För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du har en magister- eller kandidatexamen inom exempelvis systemvetenskap eller liknande område alternativt annan dokumenterad erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig. Du är van att leda och utveckla personer och grupper mot uppsatta mål samt även mot andra länder. Du har en god förståelse för IT-processer och livscykelhantering inom mjukvaruutvecklingsområdet och har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med DevOps-team inom Agile/Scrum-metodik. Din förmåga att förklara tekniska sammanhang för personer på olika nivåer i organisationen är mycket god och du har även erfarenhet av att leverera mot uppsatt budget. Du har flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med IAM, PAM och kringliggande processer med fokus på end-to-end-lösningar. Dina tyngsta kunskaper ligger inom Privileged Access Management, för såväl lokala- som för molnmiljöer samt om grundläggande säkerhetsmetoder och principer.
  
Då vårt koncernspråk är engelska behöver du kunna tala och skriva flytande på engelska.
  
Dina personliga egenskaper
  
Som person är du kommunikativ och nätverkande med en stark drivkraft framåt och en ärlig och problemlösande inställning. Du brinner för coaching, är en bra lagbyggare och är bra på att driva samarbete och att få personer med dig i arbetet framåt. Att ge feedback känner du dig bekväm med. Du har ett strukturerat och organiserat arbetssätt med förmåga att leverera resultat med hög kvalitet. Du är förtroendeingivande och både innovativ och entusiastisk över att ta dina idéer framåt. Vidare är du proaktiv, konstruktiv och har ett ”kan-göra”-orienterat tankesätt.
  
  

I den här rekryteringen arbetar vi tillsammans med p4it Search & Recruitment. Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@p4it.se, 0733118726 Intervjuer sker löpande, så ansök så snart som möjligt! Ditt CV måste vara på engelska. Välkommen!

title: Solution Engineer at a Leading Swedish Bank!
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
Join a top financial services group in Northern Europe, known for its innovation and entrepreneurial spirit. Their tech team drives digital evolution, making a real impact on banking's future. Are you a proactive, self-driven problem solver who is able to take leadership and eagerness to take ownership - Apply today!
  
  

What they offer
  
Explore a world of enticing possibilities. From attractive compensation and benefits to exclusive perks through staff banking. Enjoy a flexible work-life balance tailored to your needs, while seizing the opportunity for extensive training and learning. Join an innovative powerhouse leading the charge in technology, where agile and modern ways of working set the stage for your brightest future.
  
  

About the position
  
Do you want to be part of their exciting solution rebuild? The bank will transition into a more modern Test Data Management (TDM) solution. Instead of developing their own solution they will leverage the benefit of using a standard solution and develop it to their needs and requirements. They will add more value to their customers by proactively provide consistent test data. Join them in their journey!
  
  

You will be part of a professional Agile team responsible for providing tools for test data creation and de-identification that enable other internal development teams to easily test their solutions. You will share your responsibilities with other team members.
  
  

As Solution Engineer in the Test Data team, you will be responsible for
  
  

Implement a new modern Test Data Management solution.
  
  

Administrate, configure, and maintain the new solution.
  
  

Maintain current solutions during the transition period and support stakeholders (internal development teams).
  
  

Providing guidance for the teams to prepare right test data for their testing.
  
  

**Who We Are Looking For:**  

We are looking for proactive, self-driven problem solvers with a technical background as solution developers, developers, or solution engineers. You should have a curious mindset, be willing to develop yourself, share your knowledge, and help others. As a team player, you should support others with your knowledge and be ready to accept help. Strong analytical and structured thinking skills are essential, along with fluency in English and good communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels.
  
  

Technical Competencies
  
  

A technical background as a solution developer, developer or solution engineer
  
  

Experience in Java and database development.
  
  

Experience with containers and both Linux and Windows OS.
  
  

**It would be considered as advantage if you:**  

Experience working with Test Data Management (TDM) solutions like K2view, Delphix, Datprof, or similar.
  
  

Experience with database architecture and design.
  
  

Experience in bash scripting and automation.
  
  

Experience in developing with Angular.
  
  

Experience in testing and understanding the requirements for test data.
  
  

Technical knowledge of building and running applications for different platforms, working with containers (Docker, OpenShift), infrastructure as code, automation, and continuous integration.
  
  

Good understanding and passion for DevOps and Cloud technology to create effective and future-proof solutions.
  
  

Experience in enterprise environments, preferably in financial or IT sectors.
  
  

Welcome with your application
  
Do you think this would suit you, or perhaps someone you know? We have an ongoing selection process and may fill the position before the application deadline, so do not hesitate - submit your application today!
  
  

**The recruitment will be conducted by Ed:** Za Group. If you have any questions or concerns related to the position and the process, you are warmly welcome to contact us at julia.sundquist@edzagroup.se.

title: Team Lead-Analytics Technical Operations
description:

**Onsite or Remote:** Hybrid
**Primary Skills:** Critical Thinking,Time Management,Growth Mindset,A
**Country/Region:** SE
**City:** Örebro
**Location:**Örebro, Orebro County, SE, 70191

**Date of posting:** Jun 12, 2024  

**Mission** **:** The Team Lead-Analytics Technical Operations has the overall responsibility of leading and coordinating IT-deliveries and support to the business that are geographically spread over the world. This role will work with committed teams on an innovative and state-of-the-art technical platform, helping to accelerate business use of analytics insights and support Epiroc transformation to a data driven company.  


**Job Description:**  


We are now looking for an experienced and qualified candidate with the main mission to work as Team Lead-Analytics Technical Operations  


**Your main responsibilities in this role will be:**  


* Actively work to ensure that the governance models and handover process/artifacts are followed from development to operations within the Analytics domain
* Ensure that change requests, service requests and incidents within the Analytics domain are delivered and the teams follow the DevOps concept that enables them to develop and deliver solutions in an agile way
* Work together with the other Team Leads within the function to see to it that the SLAs and deliveries are not impacted
* Handle complex questions and incidents from design to execution and deliver in time bound manner under constraints

  


**Educational Requirement:**  


* 5-8 years of experience of working within an Analytics domain with at least 3 years as a Team Lead
* Worked in global organisations with decentralised teams
* Extensive experience with Microsoft Azure platform, MS SQL databases and data architecture, MS Suite along with reporting tools such as Power BI
* Extensive experience in multidimensional data modelling; star schemas, snowflakes, denormalized models, handling slow-changing- dimensions/attributes.
* Experience in Service Management tools like Service Now and agile tools like DevOps and Jira is desired.
* Collaborate with other functional support teams to get production incidents resolved and proactively seek opportunities to develop preventative measures to avoid recurrence.
* Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills.

  


**Personality Requirement:**  


* Strong interpersonal and communication skills are a prerequisite to be successful in the role
* A go-getter with a results driven attitude is desired, with a capacity to deliver in line with expectations and objectives as the work is conducted with full responsibility and flexibility within given time-frames
* Well structured individual that is service minded, result oriented and adaptable to change

  

**Location:**
This position is located in **Bangalore, India.**
In this recruitment process we review applications continuously. Welcome with your application as soon as possible, but no later than 17-June-2024**.**  

**Epiroc** is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About CheckProof**
--------------------


CheckProof is a pioneering SaaS company that started its journey a decade ago and is now on the verge of significant expansion in the scale-up phase. With a presence in over 35+ countries and our application translated into 20 languages, we are poised for remarkable growth.

**The role:**


As an Engineering Manager at CheckProof, you will be responsible for managing our talented team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and productive environment. You will work closely to our Product Owner Jakob, and report directly to our CEO Håkan. In this role you are playing a crucial role in planning the future growth and development of our team. This position is ideal for someone who has a technical background and has transitioned into a management role, such as a former developer, product owner, or technical project manager. Key responsibilities include that you:

  

* Oversee a tech team of 20 members and manage personnel responsibilities, including conducting performance reviews and one-on-one meetings.
* Provide mentorship and coaching to team members, ensuring they have clear goals and the support needed to achieve them.
* Collaborate with the dev committee to make strategic decisions and ensure the team has a clear direction and development plan.
* Identify and plan necessary training and courses to keep the team’s skills up-to-date and aligned with industry standards.
* Regularly report team progress and performance.

**Who You Are:**


To succeed in this position we believe that you have:

* Proven track record of transitioning from a technical role to a managerial position.
* Experience from a startup or scaleup.
* Experience from a SaaS company.
* Basic understanding of DevOps and technical environment.
* Fluency in English. Other languages is a big bonus.


Other than that we think you are a democratic leader who are open for different perspectives and have an innovative mindset. You thrive in guiding others to success and are flexible, humble and problem solving. Effective communication and the ability to motivate and inspire others comes natural to you.

**What We Offer:**

* **Innovative Culture:** join a team that’s not just about work, but about making a difference. Creativity and innovation are in our DNA.
* **Growth Opportunities:** We’re growing, and we want you to grow with us. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement abound.
* **Flexible Work Environment:** Enjoy a balance that works for you. We believe in work-life harmony.
* **Competitive Compensation:** We offer a competitive salary and benefits package.

If you are ready to manage our successful team, we’re excited to meet you! Apply now and let’s revolutionize the world of inspections together.

**The recruitment process:**


Send in your resume for us to review. The first meeting will be with a recruiter. If we are a match you will get to do a personality test and a logic test before meeting our CEO and Product Owner. The next step is a case with a follow-up interview. In the last step we contact your references and make a full assessment.


CheckProof is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. At the moment we are a mix of 7 different cultures.

title: Platform DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you an ambitious DevOps Engineer eager to jump in a world of complex challenges to modernise web and globally distributed applications? We are hiring!
   

  

 Product Development at Betsson Group
   

  

 Our Product Development organisation is truly Global with cross functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs – Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv and Athens. With nearly 600 strong professionals, the Product Development organisation is spear-headed by our CTO-CPO with all our talented Area Teams working together.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Working with cutting edge technology enabling our Cloud Journey
* The Platform Core team is responsible for managing Infrastructure as Code for parts of our Core Platform Layer (Kubernetes Clusters, Message Broker backends, Infrastructure tooling), providing a distributed runtime platform that ensures optimal performance of our business applications, APIs and websites
* Building our Infrastructure Platforms as self-service to our developers and providing guidance and tooling for developers to self-manage their applications cross environments
* Continuously improve and develop our platforms based on business needs. Analyse, diagnose and solve issues of efficiency performance and scale collaborating cross functional with colleagues from different teams


 Right now, we are looking to strengthen further the management of our Container Platform and Kafka Messaging Platform and looking for a DevOps engineer with strong knowledge and experience in Kubernetes administration and managing Kafka infrastructure.
   

  

 You're good at
   

  

* Experience or familiar of working with Kubernetes and cluster administration, preferably with experience with AWS EKS, Rancher RKE or in alternative Google Cloud GKE, or Azure AKS.
* Strong knowledge and experience of managing Kafka infrastructure, administration, and configuration.
* Experience of working with and managing distributed messaging systems, like multiple Kafka clusters.
* Managing Cloud Infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, with a good understanding of terraform modules.
* Experience working with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and familiar with Cloud provider services, EC2, ALBs, VPC, EKS etc.
* Experience in building systems that scale is required
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Immutable Deployments
* Familiarity with the open-source monitoring stack of Prometheus/Grafana/Loki/Jaeger.
* Ability to write scripts in Python, Bash, Powershell or similar
* Good LINUX / UNIX background
* Strong analytical / problem solving skills
* 24×7 business and On-call support


 Who We Are
   

  

 Betsson Group is one of the largest companies within the Global iGaming space and can trace our heritage as far back as the 1960’s. We’re Swedish and publicly listed too with our Operational HQ located on the Mediterranean Island of Malta.
   

  

 We strive to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. As a market leader within iGaming we offer online gaming products across 12+ jurisdictions and 20+ brands.
   

  

 You will be part of a passionate team, which is building an industry leading, scalable, multi-brand platform used by hundreds of thousands of our customers!
   

  

 What we Offer
   

  

 Much like riding a roller-coaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1900 strong, spread across 7 offices! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 Challenge accepted?
   

  

**Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about**
*****By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy*****

title: SRE DevOps Engineer
description:
Experience in Site Reliability Engineering, maintenance & operations and/or development.
 





 Strong working experience in DevOps practices (CI/CD etc.).
 





 Experience within solutions architecture and how to fast pinpoint causes of issues.
 





 Experience from ITIL support processes and ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow) in a microservices context.
 





 Experience in monitoring tools (Splunk, Grafana etc.).
 





 Understanding of performance engineering (ApplicationReliability).
 





 Experience in building CI/CD workflows using GitHub Actions.
 





 Knowledge of Azure DevOps and/or other cloud environments is nice to have.
 





 Experience in provisioning Infra resources leveraging Infra as Code (Terraform / Ansible).
 





 A passion for problem solving with strong analytical capabilities.
 





 Experience working through SRE Metrics such as SLI, SLO and Error Budget.
 





 Experience with managed cloud Kubernetes services (e.g. AKS, GKE)

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Contract:B2B Contract
 



 Work mode: Hybrid
 



 location: Stockholm
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 The AWS Cloud Specialist will work with the team to secure execution towards roadmap milestones and the Cloud strategy. This includes serving as a subject matter expert on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform, staying updated with the latest AWS services and features, and evaluating their applicability to business needs. The role also involves automating processes related to cloud operations, promoting the Public Cloud offering internally, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and providing technical leadership and mentorship.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Subject Matter Expertise:**
* Serve as an SME on AWS cloud platform.
* Stay updated with the latest AWS services, features, and capabilities, and evaluate their applicability to business needs.
* Help the team automate processes related to cloud operations, security configuration, account management, and cost optimization.
* Promote the Public Cloud offering to internal stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to understand requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives.
* Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers.
* Foster a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Deep knowledge of AWS, including platform services, features, and best practices.
* Ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry best practices, adhering to security and compliance standards.
* Experience with Cloud Foundations constructs for enterprises, such as AWS Control Tower and Cloud Adoption Framework.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.
* Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and AWS CloudFormation templates to provision and manage cloud resources programmatically.
* Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices and tools.
* Comfortable with Go and Python, used extensively to build serverless integrations and APIs.
* Fluent with best practices for software development and a passion for automation.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
**Senior Cloud Engineer** 




  





  





 Vi söker för närvarande en mycket skicklig och erfaren Cloud Engineer för att stärka vår kunds dynamiska IT-team. Den ideala kandidaten kommer att ha en stark bakgrund inom cloud computing och en passion för teknik. Som Cloud Engineer kommer du att ansvara för planering, driftsättning och hantering av våra kunders molnresurser för att säkerställa optimal prestanda, säkerhet och skalbarhet.
 



  





**Viktiga ansvarsområden** 



* Planera och distribuera molnresurser, inklusive virtuella maskiner, lagring och SQL-databaser, i molnplattformar som Azure, AWS och GCP.
* Automatisera tillhandahållande och konfiguration av infrastruktur för att förbättra effektivitet och tillförlitlighet.
* Underhålla och övervaka molntjänster för att säkerställa systemtillgänglighet och hälsa.
* Implementera pipelines för kontinuerlig integration och kontinuerlig leverans (CI/CD) med verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions och Azure DevOps.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att integrera molnlösningar och livscykelhantering av programvara.



  





**Vad vi letar efter** 



* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som Cloud Engineer där du har fått god kunskap om molnmiljöer som Azure, AWS & GCP
* Infrastruktur som kod (IAC): Kompetens med verktyg som Terraform, Ansible, Bicep / ARM-mallar.
* Förmåga att skriva skript på språk som Python, Java, Bash eller PowerShell.
* Förståelse för nätverk, beräknings- och lagringsresurser i molnmiljöer.
* Kännedom om bästa praxis för molnsäkerhet, efterlevnadsstandarder och verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade databaser som Azure SQL Database.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknik eller relaterat område eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet"
* Relevanta certifieringar inom cloud computing-plattformar (Azure, AWS, GCP) är mycket önskvärda.
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta självständigt eller som en del av ett team.
* God kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





  





**Om oss** 




 Westro är ett rekrytering- och bemanningsbolag med ursprung i Stockholm. Hos oss är vi måna om vår personal och strävar alltid efter personliga och långsiktiga relationer.
 



 Vi investerar tid och engagemang i våra konsulter och erbjuder goda arbetsförhållanden, förmåner och hjälp till personlig och yrkesmässig utveckling.
 



 Glada medarbetare gör ett bättre jobb - och vi gör vårt yttersta för att just du ska trivas på din arbetsplats.
 



  





 Är du vår nästa medarbetare?
 



 Läs mer och besök oss på: www.westro.se
 



  





 Vid frågor kring tjänsten, vänligen kontakta:
 



 Thelma Hammer
 



 073-533 42 42
 



 thelma@westro.se

title: Senior DevOps
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi söker erfarna DevOps-utvecklare som vill stötta upp våra team och arbeta i en av Nordens tyngsta Linux-miljöer. Tillsammans med riktig vassa kollegor kommer du ta del av spännande kundprojekt och utveckla framtidens lösningar. För dig som har erfarenhet av, eller ett intresse för att utvecklas in i en ledande roll och driva team framåt så erbjuds även denna möjlighet.
   

  

**Du kommer exempelvis arbeta med:**
* Systemdrift, arkitektur och code review
* Automatisera arbetsflöden med CI/CD i Git och Jenkins
* Containerteknologer såsom Docker, Kubernetes och OpenShift
* Molnbaserade lösningar såsom AWS, Azure eller OpenStack
* Scriptspråk så som shell script, Ruby och Python
* PostgreSQL/MySQL, Nginx, Varnish och Apache
* Konfigurering i Puppet och Ansible


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss har du ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relaterat område
* Några års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av en eller flera av ovanstående teknologier
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Meriterande:**
* Vi ser gärna att du har en bred Linux-grund och har labbat runt med flera distributörer
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och/eller Cloud
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och GitOps


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Önskar du att bli en del av vårt team? Tveka inte att höra av dig. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Position Type : Full time**
**Type Of Hire : Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)**
**Education Desired : Bachelor's Degree**
**Travel Percentage : 1 - 5%**
 FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.
   

  

 The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk solution helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.
   

  

**About The Role**
**As a
 **DevOps/CI Engineer you will be instrumental in evolving and maintaining our build, test, and deployment infrastructure. We have a highly automated pipeline for build and test, which is currently running in our self-hosted on-premise infrastructure. We are underway with our move to a cloud-based build and test infrastructure and are looking for your help with designing and implementing this exciting journey.
   

  

 Our products are built in C++ and Python and run on Windows and Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) using MSSQL or MySQL databases.
   

  

 For build and test automation we are currently using CMake, QuickBuild, Buildbot, GoogleTest, Robot and Python, and are exploring GitHub Actions, GitHub Runners, Terraform, and Harness as part of our CI strategy.
   

  

 You will be working closely together with other DevOps/CI Engineers and our development teams.
   

  

 As a senior DevOps/CI engineer with experience in build and test automation, you are excited about leveraging tooling to drive automation, and have a passion for infrastructure as code.
   

  

**Position requirements
   

  

**We Expect You To Have The Following**
**What we offer you
   

  

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar.
* 5+ years of experience in DevOps/CI
+ Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with an ability to understand and debug complex systems.
+ Ability to work in an international, fast-paced, dynamic environment, with a focus on delivering high-quality software in a timely manner.
+ Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with good communication and collaboration skills.
+ Experience in Python
+ Experience with tools like Jira, GitHub, Bitbucket, and Artifactory
+ Experience with automated testing, preferably GoogleTest and Robot
+ Experience with Docker containers and Kubernetes or equivalent
+ Experience with public cloud platforms, e.g. AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
+ Fluent in English


 At FIS, We Offer You The Opportunity To Shape The Future Of Fintech. You Will Be Part Of An Expansive Phase In Our Continued Journey. We Believe In Creating a Workplace Where Ideas Can Flow Freely And Where Every Day Is Different. A Career At FIS Is More Than Just a Job. We Offer
   

  

* A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office.
* A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities.
* A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect.


**Privacy Statement**
 FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
   

  

**Sourcing Model**
 Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
   

  

 #pridepass********

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About CheckProof**
 CheckProof is a pioneering SaaS company that started its journey a decade ago and is now on the verge of significant expansion in the scale-up phase. With a presence in over 35+ countries and our application translated into 20 languages, we are poised for remarkable growth.
   

  

**The role:**
 As an Engineering Manager at CheckProof, you will be responsible for managing our talented team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and productive environment. You will work closely to our Product Owner Jakob, and report directly to our CEO Håkan. In this role you are playing a crucial role in planning the future growth and development of our team. This position is ideal for someone who has a technical background and has transitioned into a management role, such as a former developer, product owner, or technical project manager. Key responsibilities include that you:
   

  

* Oversee a tech team of 20 members and manage personnel responsibilities, including conducting performance reviews and one-on-one meetings.
* Provide mentorship and coaching to team members, ensuring they have clear goals and the support needed to achieve them.
* Collaborate with the dev committee to make strategic decisions and ensure the team has a clear direction and development plan.
* Identify and plan necessary training and courses to keep the team’s skills up-to-date and aligned with industry standards.
* Regularly report team progress and performance.


**Who You Are:**
 To succeed in this position we believe that you have:
   

  

* Proven track record of transitioning from a technical role to a managerial position.
* Experience from a startup or scaleup.
* Experience from a SaaS company.
* Basic understanding of DevOps and technical environment.
* Fluency in English. Other languages is a big bonus.


 Other than that we think you are a democratic leader who are open for different perspectives and have an innovative mindset. You thrive in guiding others to success and are flexible, humble and problem solving. Effective communication and the ability to motivate and inspire others comes natural to you.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
* Innovative Culture: join a team that’s not just about work, but about making a difference. Creativity and innovation are in our DNA.
* Growth Opportunities: We’re growing, and we want you to grow with us. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement abound.
* Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a balance that works for you. We believe in work-life harmony.
* Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package.


 If you are ready to manage our successful team, we’re excited to meet you! Apply now and let’s revolutionize the world of inspections together.
   

  

**The recruitment process:**
 Send in your resume for us to review. The first meeting will be with a recruiter. If we are a match you will get to do a personality test and a logic test before meeting our CEO and Product Owner. The next step is a case with a follow-up interview. In the last step we contact your references and make a full assessment.
   

  

 CheckProof is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. At the moment we are a mix of 7 different cultures.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.** 




  





 Join our mission to soundtrack the world! We are now looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Infrastructure team to help us evolve our data platform and our tooling for data ingestion, processing and management. The Data Infrastructure team is a part of the Data Platform area - our division dedicated to building our data, infrastructure and insights platform.
 



  





**How you will make an impact** 




 As a Data Engineer in our Data Infrastructure team, you will play a pivotal role in building a scalable and robust data platform to enable us to leverage a broad range of data sources at the company. You will continue building upon and improving our data platform that runs on the Google Cloud platform, where part of our solution stack includes Airflow for data pipeline orchestration, Snowplow for event collection, BigQuery as data warehouse, and Kubernetes as the underlying infrastructure.
 



  





**What you can expect to do:** 



* Collaborate with a talented and diverse team to build and enhance our data platform to enable data collection, processing, access, usability and monitoring.
* Create architectural guidelines, solutions and best practices for our data pipelines in Airflow/Composer.
* Provision and manage resources in Google Cloud using Terraform.
* Manage new and existing data sources into our ELT and reverse ETL pipelines.
* Strategize optimal technical solutions for data governance, data cataloging and discovery, and data access.
* Ensure data quality and reliability through implementing standardized monitoring, CI/CD and testing practices.
* Work closely with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop solutions that meet their needs.
* Continuously explore and adopt new technologies and best practices to improve our data infrastructure



  





**In order for you to thrive in this role, we believe that you have:** 



* A passion for solving complex data problems and building data processing applications.
* Strong experience with data pipelines, distributed systems, and cloud infrastructure.
* Solid understanding of software engineering practices, including version control, CI/CD, testing and documentation.
* A love for teamwork and an ability to collaborate with Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers.
* Proficiency in Python
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to adapt technical topics for less technical audiences.
* A pragmatic mindset with a focus on delivering practical solutions and making an impact.



  





**Why join us?** 




 This is an opportunity to join an organization with passionate data professionals at a fast-growing unicorn company, being a part of transforming how people use and experience music. You will be contributing to building a modern data platform that scales with the diverse needs of the company in our mission to soundtrack the world.
 



 We value a collaborative and inclusive work environment, emphasizing learning and we also expect you to share your knowledge with your colleagues. We collaborate constantly and are big believers in teamwork and the value of practices like careful code reviews and pair programming. This role will include finding ways to share learnings across the organization via internal presentations, tech talks, hack days, writing blog posts, or any other way you may think of. On top of this, you can expect to have lots of fun and take pride in what you and all of Epidemic is doing.
 



  





 If you are ready to be part of the journey to shape the future of music, we would love to hear from you. Add your Beat!
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English.

title: Lead React.js Developer
description:
**Job Title: Lead React.js Developer** 




  





**Role Description:** 




 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing user-friendly, responsive web applications using React.js and related frameworks. This role involves close collaboration with product managers, UI/UX designers, and backend developers to deliver high-quality software solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





 - Develop user-friendly, responsive web applications using React.js and related frameworks.
 



 - Collaborate with product managers and UI/UX designers to translate requirements and wireframes into high-quality frontend code.
 



 - Implement pixel-perfect designs and ensure consistent visual branding across the application.
 



 - Optimize application performance and user experience by implementing efficient and reusable frontend components.
 



 - Conduct code reviews, identify areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
 



 - Work closely with backend developers to integrate frontend components with backend APIs and services.
 



 - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, prioritize, and deliver high-quality software solutions within defined timelines.
 



 - Stay up to date with the latest frontend development trends, tools, and best practices, and share knowledge with the team.
 



 - Troubleshoot and resolve frontend issues, bugs, and performance bottlenecks.
 



 - Write clean, well-documented code and ensure proper version control using Git or other version control systems.
 



  





**Competencies: Digital: Node.js & ReactJS** 




  





**Experience (Years): 6-8 years** 




  





**Essential Skills:** 




  





 -Strong experience with Node.js and React.js
 



 - Experience with .NET (Good to have)
 



 - Developing and maintaining web applications utilizing React, TypeScript, .NET, and Node.js
 



 - Harnessing Azure services such as Azure Functions, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Front Door, and Azure SQL Database to address compute, storage, networking, and database necessities
 



 - Engineering API endpoints and ensuring seamless communication between frontend and backend systems
 



  





**Desirable Skills:** 




  





 - Good communication skills
 



 - Experience in building CI/CD workflows using GitHub Actions
 



 - Knowledge of Azure DevOps and/or other cloud environments
 



 - Knowledge of Agile methodologies and practices
 



 - Experience working on cloud-based infrastructure such as Azure and GCP

title: Välkänt IoT bolag söker Data Engineer
description:
Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över söker dig som drivs av komplex datahantering och arbetat med stora dataflöden
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm, Sverige
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet till distansbarbete 2 dagar i veckan
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augsti/September
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över.
   

 Detta företag är en global ledare inom IoT och hanterar mer än 20 miljoner uppkopplingar för multinationella kunder som Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct och Husqvarna. De erbjuder enkel och tillförlitlig tillgång till varje marknad i världen och möjliggör för branschledande aktörer att koppla upp sina produkter och tjänster på global skala över alla vertikaler.
   

 Företaget är rankat topp tre bästa IoT-operatörerna i Europa och bland de tio bästa i världen. Med huvudkontor och tekniskt centrum beläget i Norden har de försäljningsrepresentation i Storbritannien, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Sydafrika, Sydkorea, Kina, Taiwan och Japan.
 


  

  

**Tjänsten och teamet**
  


 De söker en erfaren Data Engineer med utmärkta färdigheter inom avancerad och modern databehandling av stora volymer och hastigheter för att gå med i deras team.
   

 I denna position är teamet ansvarigt för:
 


  

  
* Arkitektur och utveckling av deras dataplattform, inklusive insamling, bearbetning och förberedelse av data – både batch och realtidsdata.
  
* Utveckling av analysrapporter och verktyg.
  
* Utveckling och hantering av ML-modeller.
  
* Piloter och implementering av AI-användningsfall i produktion.
  
* Teamet har också ett DevOps-ansvar vilket innebär att "det vi bygger, det driver vi också".
   

 Datateamet interagerar och levererar affärsvärde till nästan alla delar av organisationen. Teamet är också ansvarigt för att leverera direkt kundvärde, antingen genom att stödja kundnära kollegor eller via kundnära datalösningar.
   

 Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att bli en del av ett moget och effektivt datateam med stor exponering mot den globala verksamheten.
   

 Denna roll rapporterar till Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) och är placerad i Stockholm, Karlskrona eller Göteborg.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 För att lyckas i denna position ska man ha omfattande erfarenhet och färdigheter inom:
 


  

  
* AWS
  
* Big data
  
* Utveckling inom Python eller Java
  


  

  

**Andra krav**
  

  
* MSc i mjukvaru-/dataingenjör eller liknande
  
* Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska och helst svenska
  


  


  

**Meriterande**



  

  
* PySpark
  
* Pandas
  
* Athena/Trino
  
* Apache Iceberg
  
* AWS Glue
  
* AWS StepFunctions
  
* Apache Flink
  
* CI/CD designmönster
  
* Dataorienterade testfall
  
* Hantering av referensdata
  
* Distribuerade arbetsbelastningar inklusive partitionsstrategier
  
* Skalbara databehandlingsmönster
   

 Stor vikt läggs vid erfarenhet av att hantera höga och växande datavolymer. Om man har varit en del av ett team som stött på skalningsproblem och löst det på ett innovativt sätt är man en bra kandidat. Kandidater bör också vara kunniga inom säker design och åtkomstmönster, och helst ha en AWS-certifiering.
  


  

  

**Som person**
  


 De söker en engagerad och självdriven person med en positiv och optimistisk inställning. Man ska inte vara rädd för att ta stort ansvar, vara affärsorienterad och bra med människor. Man ska älska att dela tekniskt kunnande och god praxis. Teamet delar en testdriven inställning och ett gemensamt intresse för att arbeta över flera miljöer och programmeringsspråk, utnyttjande av molnets krafter.
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Första steg i denna process kommer vara beteende och logik tester.
   

 Därefter telefonavstämning samt tekniskt test.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Anton Hegart eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104900

title: Lead Software Engineering – SRE (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 Lead Software Engineer in SRE is a part of data team who developing solutions for analytic production incidents, we are working close with our DevOps engineers, NOC, QA, and service owners to improve system reliability with an emphasis on safe deployment and monitoring with anomaly detection technique.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Help establish and apply SRE best practices, standards and policies in hybrid cloud environments with hybrid workloads where both VMs and containers are used
* Develop systems to prevent outages through automatic detection and remediation
* Increase observability of system health to improve availability and system uptime
* Providing guidance and expertise to the team
* Influence, design and create new architectures, standards and methods for large-scale enterprise systems
* Document and present methodologies to operations, engineering and executive teams
* Coach and develop software engineers, looks for opportunities to improve both technical and people through highly effective 1-1s and growth plans


**What You’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems/Engineering/related field
* 4+ years in a technical role supporting IT products
* Ability to multitask and pivot when necessary in a fast-paced environment
* Hands-on experience with the whole SDLC: Requirement, Design, Code, Test, Deploy
* Deep understanding of computer networks
* Proficient in at least one programming language (e.g. Ruby, JavaScript/NodeJS, Python)
* Understanding of VMs, docker/rkt containers and their applications, K8s, private cloud knowledge is plus
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing monitoring and alerting systems
* Experience in Data platforms like SQL or Hadoop
* Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
* Incident management process, analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience & can lead the incident
* Can do attitude (sometime we build news thing)
* Data driven & Data analyze skill, we move forward using data


 #telaviv #jerusalem #IT #ENG #4 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #budapest #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #osaka #malta #amsterdam #oslo #warsaw #krakow #alrayyan #riyadh #jeddah #mecca #medina #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #hcmc #hanoi #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #newdelhi #bangalore #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #jerusalem #IT #4 #bangalore #delhi #hyderabad #pune #singapore #beijing #shanghai #shenzhen #tokyo #seoul #hongkong #taipei #kualalumpur #jakarta #hochiminh #hochiminhcity #manila #instanbul #makati #dubai #riyadh #gurgaon #noida
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Experienced Test Automation Engineer to Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Financial Crime Prevention is a vital aspect not just for SEB as an institution but for society at large.
   

  

 We’re dedicated to stop fraud, prevent money laundering and identifying any other form of financial crime. If you’re passionate about crafting solutions that aims at detecting, prevent and report criminal activity we invite you to read on!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As test automation engineer in the Financial Instrument Surveillance team, you’ll embark on an innovative journey in quality assurance and test automation.
   

  

 The team is developing and maintaining systems to conduct market surveillance to detect any sort of manipulation of the financial market as well as prevent rogue trading activities.
   

  

 Your mission as a tester will be to assure quality in our delivery both with manual testing and to design and implement automation using our self-developed framework, aligning with our overarching test strategy.
   

  

 At SEB, you have great development opportunities, within a highly collaborative environment. The position is in Stockholm, Arenastaden.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* Experience and devotion in testing with knowledge in test automation.
* A DevOps mindset and versatility in technical approaches.
* Proficiency in Java/Python and experience with GitHub Actions and adequate CI/CD tools.
* Familiarity with OpenShift, Docker or Google Cloud will be an advantage.
* Analytical thinking and capability of untangling complex technical challenges.
* Openness to change and thrive on new technologies and continuous improvement.
* Proactivity as a team player who values collaboration and collective success.


 What we offer
   

  

* Comprehensive Training: Dive into a wealth of learning opportunities.
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy an attractive package, including exclusive staff banking benefits.
* Impactful Work: Contribute to transforming the industry and addressing significant society issues.
* Agile Environment: Experience our dynamic and forward-thinking work culture.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of June2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Marcus Stenman +46707394896, marcus.stenman@seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Security Engineer
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.  

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.  

As a Security Engineer at Einride, you'll be joining a top talent team of ambitious, fast moving, kind-hearted people who challenge conventional thinking and think big.
### **What you'll do:**

* Build, integrate and operate our security monitoring platforms that ensure we can detect and respond to security incidents in all our environments, including user endpoints, SaaS applications, cloud infrastructure as well as our Freight Capacity as a Service platforms.
* Build, manage and mature the vulnerability management program (including workstations, network perimeter, containers, source code, cloud configuration, etc) and build the appropriate security metrics to help drive risk-based decisions and investments
* Build out our application security program that allows engineers to be self-empowered when appropriate and able to get assistance when required. Participate in threat modeling sessions and provide security advice in design of new and existing features.

### **What we're looking for (you don’t need to tick all the boxes):**

* Working experience in securing and monitoring public cloud infrastructure (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Working experience in vulnerability management on multiple layers of the modern IT and software stackExperience with security incident management (preferably in a SOC, CDC or similar)
* Ability to code/script and automate repetitive tasks. We primarily use Go but if you have a general knack for coding, that matters more than having previous experience with a specific language.
* Great collaboration and communication skills, since you’ll be part of driving initiatives that span across the entire company.


This position is based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.  

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.  

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: Senior Full stack Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* ***Senior Full stack engineer*** *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *ASAP to 2024-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

 **About the position**  

The team is responsible for the development of core capabilities within the Commerce Platform, managing multiple backend services and data sets that powers merchandising, order management and purchase flows end to end.  

  

We are currently seeking a Senior Full stack Engineer with focus on web engineering to join our clients team. The selected candidate will play a crucial role in building the next generation of our clients technology stack. This includes developing services aimed at enhancing our clients capabilities and providing a resilient, high performing commerce ecosystem.  

  

**What you’ll do**  

Responsibilities include solution design and end-to-end implementation of capabilities within the teams’ services. As an engineer in this area you will have a unique opportunity to be part of a team that implements change to complex systems of high scale.  

  

**Who you are**  

* You are a skilled web engineer with experience with building and scaling services in React, Next.js.
* You are comfortable working across the stack and have experience with Java, Postgres services on Google Cloud Platform.
* Excellent problem-solving and fast decision-making skills with strong bias for action.
* Strong writing and communication skills. Comfortable driving engineering deep dives and workshops, as well as stakeholder demos.
* Self-driven and enjoys being part of a team that works together and makes each other better through tight collaboration and feedback.
* Ideally Experience with e-commerce or financial engineering domains.

  

**Where you’ll be**  

The team work in CET timezone with team members in both Sweden, UK, and Germany. **We are Market Partner**

 *Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: Regional Manager inom mjukvaruutveckling
description:
*Har du entreprenörsanda och älskar att hitta innovativa lösningar för kunders behov? Vi letar efter en självgående säljare som kan driva fram nya affärsmöjligheter och bidra till vår tillväxt. Om du är redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå och vara en del i vårt dynamiska team, vill vi höra från dig!*

###### **Din framtid hos oss**


I 25 år har vi arbetat med produkt- och systemlösningar som verkligen gör skillnad för omvärlden. Innovationsarbetet pågår såklart fortfarande och nu har vi fler tekniska möjligheter än någonsin! Med hjälp av vår innovationsmodell driver vi multidisciplinära projekt med kompetenser från industridesign till mekanik till mjukvaruutveckling för moderna molnplattformar. Vill du vara med oss och göra skillnad?

  

Som Regional manager har du det övergripande ansvaret för affärsenheten AIS (Avalon Information Systems) för Syd (Malmö/Helsingborg, Karlshamn/Karlskrona). Du kommer bli en viktig pusselbit i vår utveckling och alla de roliga saker som händer på kontoren. Vi vill fortsätta vår resa som en ödmjuk och erfaren teknikpartner åt våra kunder, samtidigt som vi erbjuder en rolig karriärutveckling för alla kollegor på Avalon. För att möjliggöra detta kommer du bland annat ägna dig åt:

* Budget- och säljansvar
* Rekrytering av nya kollegor
* Affärsutveckling, både av konsultaffärer och i projektform
* Beläggnings- och resultatansvar
* Aktiviteter, utveckling, after work och andra härligheter med teamet
* Driva företagets övergripande strategier i regionen och samarbeta med dina affärsutvecklande kollegor som har samma roll men i andra städer


Rollen är bred och vi vill att du äger den!


Du kommer att utgå ifrån kontoret i Malmö och spendera dina dagar tillsammans med andra Regional Managers, Teamleaders, HR, TA, marknad, konsulter och koncern kollegor… Vilket gäng va?!
  

Tillsammans är vi ett härligt taggat gäng som ser fram emot att välkomna ännu en kollega att ha med på livets resa av utmaningar och att fira uppnådda mål med!

###### **Matchar vi varandra?**


Vi letar efter mer än erfarenheterna i ditt CV - vi vill träffa vår nästa kollega. På samma sätt tror vi att du söker mer än nya arbetsuppgifter. Du vill till en plats där du kan vara dig själv och få en intressant karriärutveckling. För att ta första steget i samarbetet söker vi dig som

* Identifierar dig med våra ledarskapsvärderingar: entreprenörskap, ödmjukhet, transparens, personligt
* Vi ser att du har tidigare erfarenhet av försäljning b2b inom Software and cloud
* Har ett stort etablerat nätverk inom mjukvara
* Har en it- teknisk bakgrund i form av antingen utbildning, arbetslivserfarenhet eller starka intressen/hobbys
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Har B-körkort

###### **Vår kultur**


Vår företagskultur är bland det viktigaste vi har. Vi är alla med och aktivt bidrar till våra gemensamma framgångar och vi motiveras av att samarbeta och driva vår affär framåt. Vår ambition är inte att bli störst, däremot kommer vi alltid sträva mot att vara bäst på det vi gör. Vi är glada över att arbeta på Avalon Innovation och kan stolt säga – jag är en avalon!

###### **Vad händer nu?**


Vad kul att du har läst såhär långt! Har du frågor om oss eller tjänsten? Tveka inte att höra av dig. På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot några ansökningar via mail. Rekryteringen pågår löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in dina kontaktuppgifter och bilagor.

**Vi som MED GLÄDJE ser fram emot din ansökan heter:**


Pernilla Ingemansson, Talent Acquisition Specialist Syd pernilla.ingemansson@avaloninnovation.com
  

  

Patrik Enarsson, Business Director Syd
  

patrik.enarsson@avaloninnovation.com  

  

  



*Vi har gjort vårt medieval för rekrytering och undanber oss därför kontakt med säljare av annonser eller andra rekryteringstjänster.*
