title: Digital B2B Marketing Specialist till Coca-Cola!
description:
Är du strukturerad, har ett kreativt tänk och samtidigt brinner för försäljning via digitala verktyg? Vill du vara en del av vårt Digital team och driva vår fortsatta digitala utveckling framåt? Då kan detta vara utmaningen du letat efter!
  
  

Om oss
  
Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) är ett ledande konsumentvaruföretag och världens största oberoende buteljeringsföretag av Coca-Cola. Med ett team på 42 000 personer som servar kunder i 31 länder tillverkar, säljer och distribuerar vi världens mest älskade dryckesvarumärken. I Sverige har vi cirka 750 fantastiska medarbetare och huvudkontor samt produktion (kallad ”Happiness Factory”) i Jordbro, söder om Stockholm. I vår breda produktportfölj jobbar vi med några av världens starkaste varumärken, som inkluderar Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, bonaqua, Powerade, MER och Monster. Vi är ett innovativt och dynamiskt företag med stort fokus på hållbarhet i alla led.
  
  

Din nya roll
  
Vi söker just nu en ny kollega för ett vikariat till rollen Digital B2B Marketing Specialist. Vi befinner oss just nu i en spännande fas där vi har ett starkt fokus på vår B2B kundportal MyCCEP.com, samtidigt som vi arbetar med att implementera vår OMNI contact-strategi där vi som team kommer att möjliggöra att vi kan möta och kommunicera med våra kunder på ett så optimalt sätt som möjligt, i en kombination av fysiska besök, telefonsamtal och olika digitala kanaler.
  
Som Digital B2B Marketing Specialist blir du en del av OMNI contact team där du arbetar med underhåll av vår kundportal MyCCEP och support till kunderna som använder portalen. Du kommer att spela en viktig roll i att driva utvecklingen av portalen framåt, med allt för att förbättra vår digitala närvaro och utveckla vår kundrelation digitalt. Du kommer att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team internt samt arbeta nära Digital Customer Contact, Digital Marketeers, vår marknadsavdelning Commercial Development samt vår säljkår för att tillsammans skapa och implementera digitala kampanjer och aktiviteter.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att:**  

Arbeta i backend med underhåll av produkter, nyhetssidor, bygga widgets samt göra översättningar från engelska till svenska (från centralt content till lokal content)
  
Skapa kampanjer och underhålla point of sale material
  
I samarbete med Digital Customer Contact skapa digitalt material i Photoshop som används på MyCCEP och i digitala utskick
  
Ge kontinuerlig support, testa och implementera förbättringar och nya funktioner i MyCCEP samt Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  
Eskalera problem, skapa tickets och uppföljning
  
Samarbeta i vår digitala forum inom CCEP för att utbyta erfarenheter och utveckla kompetens
  
Kontinuerligt analysera resultaten och lära av varje digital kampanj för att förbättra och optimera
  
  

I rollen ingår även att vid behov stötta arbetet vårt Meny-team gör, detta innebär byggande av Menyer till våra kunder i programmet InDesign.
  
  

Du kommer att rapportera till Omni Contact Lead och tjänsten är placerad på kontoret i Jordbro. Tjänsten är ett vikariat tom 30 september 2025, där tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse, men vi ser gärna att du har möjlighet att börja hos oss så snart som möjligt. För rätt person finns det stora möjligheter för förlängning.
  
  

**För att lyckas i rollen behöver du:**  

Gärna erfarenhet av CRM program såsom Salesforce Sales cloud och erfarenhet av digitala marknadsföringsprogram såsom Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  
Kunskap om förbättringsarbete och insamling av underlag för kravspecifikation
  
Övergripande kännedom om digital marknadsföring B2B
  
Förståelse för system och användarbehov
  
Vana i Office-programmen
  
Grundkunskap Photoshop och InDesign
  
Flytande kommunikation på svenska och engelska
  
  

**Som person söker vi dig som:**  

Drivs av att lära nytt och bidra till nya arbetssätt
  
Har ett säljande mindset och kan omvandla strategier till operativt arbete
  
Är strukturerad med god planeringsförmåga och kan prioritera bland uppgifter utifrån deadlines och affärskritiska påverkan
  
Är lösningsorienterad, utvecklingsinriktad och kundfokuserad
  
Är organiserad och flexibel
  
Hela tiden sträva efter att lära dig och behärska de senaste tekniken inom ditt område
  
  

Vi söker dig som är van att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö med högt tempo. Du har förmågan att bibehålla fokus på lösning även i pressade situationer. Du kan planera och utveckla dina arbetsuppgifter på ett självständigt, analytiskt och strukturerat sätt. Vi ser också att du är kommunikativ och har lätt för att skapa nya kontakter och du kan påverka och övertyga samtidigt som du lyssnar och förstår andra.
  
Vi värdesätter en varierad personalstyrka och välkomnar därför dig att söka oavsett kön, ålder eller etnisk bakgrund.
  
  

Låter det intressant?
  
Då rekommenderar vi dig att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då sista ansökningsdag är 23 juni. Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta ansvarig Rekryterare Hellen Song, hsong@ccep.com. Vi tar inte emot CV via mail med anledning av GDPR. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vad du blir en del av
  
Vi brukar säga, "You may join for the brand but stay for the people", och det stämmer verkligen! Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i en snabb och innovativ bransch tillsammans med våra anställda, kunder och konsumenter. Du får mycket eget ansvar från första dagen och du får möjlighet att verkligen göra skillnad. Vårt recept på framgång är att vi är passionerade, hårt arbetande och engagerade i våra produkter, våra kunder och varandra. CCEP är en plats där människor kan växa, vara glada och må bra på en trygg, öppen och inkluderande arbetsplats. Om du vill du veta mer om människorna bakom våra drycker och dina framtida kollegor hos oss hittar du våra stories på https://www.coca-cola.se/100voices
  
You may join for the brand but stay for the people!

title: iScala Specialist
description:
iScala Specialist


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Remote/Hybrid


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Description:** **iScala Specialist**


Your job as Specialist within the Sales ERP iScala is to refine the business requirements, participate in the analysis, design, build, deploy and support of the solutions. You will deliver everything from smaller enhancements to bigger features and projects. You will be working closely the business together with the iScala Agile team.


In your work, you will both participate to new development and perform regular third line support. You will also support the Application Management team with their 2nd line support activities.


**Requirements:**


* Sales Order and Service Module.
* Understanding of the iScala Finance module.
* Manufacture and Project module is a plus
* Good knowledge of Crystal Reports
* Good knowledge Transnational SQL
* Project Management/Coordination experience
* Agile development experience (preferable but not mandatory)
* Knowledge about Epicor Services Connect is a plus.

  




The right candidate will easily network across business functions in an international and cross-cultural environment, working in line with our drivers: Action, Interaction and Satisfaction.


We are looking for someone who is ready to take responsibility and ownership of the change to be developed. Flexible to travel to Sweden as and when required.


**You can reach out to us at** **Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com** **or** **careers@swediumglobal.com**


  
Job Overview


* Location : lund, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : IScala, Epicore, SQL

title: Business Analyst för IFS på Aeronautics
description:
*Redo att hitta din grej? Testa nytt, utbyt erfarenheter och upptäck vad du verkligen gillar att göra.*


Din roll


Nu behöver vi stärka vår sektion ERP Applications, vilket ger dig en möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär tillsammans med oss. Vi söker en person som ska jobba både nära systemet men även nära våra verksamheter.


I din roll som Business Analyst inom Aeronautics IFS installationer SHARP (IFS Cloud), ERP (IFS 9) och Sherpa (IFS 10), kommer du fördjupa dig i applikationen och verksamheten för att skapa bästa möjliga systemlösning utifrån våra användares arbetssätt och processer. Vi har idag två installationer av IFS på Aeronautics IFS ERP 9 och IFS Sherpa 10 i drift. Vi genomför dessutom ett projekt för att sammanföra dessa versioner i en helt ny installation IFS SHARP Cloud. Vi jobbar dessutom mycket nära vår support och utvecklingsorganisation, en gemensam systemförvaltning på Group IT av IFS för flera affärsområden inom Saab


I rollen innebär det:

* Att kunna förstå verksamhetens arbetssätt och deras problem för att kunna ge support på ett effektivt arbetssätt utifrån de processer och flöden som finns i IFS.
* Att kunna förstå när det finns felaktigheter i systemet som ska rapporteras och stötta användare med utbildning och framtagning av arbetsinstruktioner.
* Att kunna hjälpa användaren att formulera sina krav och önskemål i de fall en förändring behövs.


Dina utmaningar kommer vara att säkerställa att vi har ett kostnadseffektivt och förvaltningsbart system som kan hantera regelbundna uppdateringar samtidigt tillgodoser användarnas behov av ett effektivt arbetssätt. Du behöver kombinera verksamhetsförståelse, IFS-kompetens och insikt i vad som pågår inom förvaltningen och applikationen för att fatta rätt beslut om vad som är bästa lösning. Vi kommer framåt arbeta aktivt med att föra ut nya förmågor i systemet till verksamheten.


Din profil


För att trivas i rollen bör du ha goda kunskaper i IFS Applications och förmåga att kunna sätta dig in i andra IFS-moduler för att lösa problem. Du ska kunna förstå och ifrågasätta kravbilder samt komma med förbättringsförslag. Du behöver kunna definiera och kommunicera systemkrav utifrån användarbehov och systemuppbyggnad. God kommunikationsförmåga och samarbetsförmåga är viktigt, liksom ett genuint intresse för kunders och användares behov. Du bör ha en analytisk förmåga, vara driven och ivrig att utvecklas, och trivas med att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp.  

  

Vi ser gärna att du har:

* Högskole-/civilingenjör eller har motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa verksamheter.
* Förmåga att kommunicera muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska.
* Arbetat med verksamhetsutveckling med koppling till affärssystem och att ha kännedom om de civila och militära regelverk som gäller inom flygområdet, vilket är meriterande.


Inom våra förvaltningsområden finns det stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling både på djupet och på bredden.


Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Senior HR Business Partner - Tietoevry Create (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.*Tietoevry Create is the leading accelerator for customers' digital products and business models. We combine design and software engineering to create new experiences and growth opportunities for our clients. In Tietoevry Create Sweden, we have 900+ experts specializing in cloud, data, and software engineering serving both enterprises and public-sector customers.*
We are now looking for a Senior HR Business Partner to join Tietoevry Create Sweden
As an HR Business Partner, you will in alignment with our people & culture agenda implement & drive relevant initiatives in collaboration with our business leaders and employees. The role is primarily hands-on and covers a wide range of tasks, such as (examples);* Driving people and culture initiatives with a focus on employee engagement and retention
* Sparring and coaching leaders and managers in various people related matters
* Supporting the leaders with change management
* Handling employment related matters in a way that is aligned with our collective agreement, company values, ethics, and at the same time ensuring legal compliance
* Support in the creation of, and implementing HR strategies, processes, and policies in alignment with our business objectives
* Being an integrated part of the Nordic HR team, and working in cooperation with HR colleagues in Sweden, across Nordic and globally to develop, improve, and implement HR processes and procedures.
* If/when required some (HR) administrative work tasks and reporting.

  

In the role, you will report to Nordic HR Head, and be a member of the Create Sweden Leadership Team. Worth mentioning about Tietoervy’s HR structure is that we also have a separate centralized HR support function (ASK HR), with the responsibility to manage an absolute majority of all HR admin and payroll related inquiries from employees.  

  

What will help you to succeed in the role?* Successful track record of at least 5+ years as an HR business partner (or similar HR role) preferably in the consultancy/IT industry in Sweden
* Ability to work from both strategic and operational point of view
* Strong problem-solving, decision-making and communication skills
* Excellent understanding of Swedish labor law and proven track record successfully managing various employee related situations and matters, including union negotiations
* Highly people oriented with a proven ability to build trust
* Proactive and collaborative way of working
* Able to work in a fast-paced, changing, and complex environment
* Professional fluency in Swedish and English, both written and oral
* Experience using MS Excel as a tool for running reports/analysis, and familiarity with a professional Human Capital Management System (Workday = an advantage)
* University degree, preferably within human resources or equivalent

  

 What will we offer to you?* An interesting and innovative work environment, where you get an opportunity to influence the HR agenda for one of the largest IT consultancy firms in the Nordic.
* Flexible working environment with hybrid ways of working. Our two largest sites in Sweden are located in Arenastaden (Solna) and Karlstad, and we would expect you to be physically present in one of these offices at least a couple of days a week.
* Collaboration with supportive, experienced, and multinational teams across countries.
* Opportunity to further develop in the HR area


Did we get you inspired?
We look forward to your application! Please send your application as soon as possible, at the latest on 23 June 2024. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Johan Bartholdson, johan.bartholdson@tietoevry.com
Location: Stockholm or Karlstad
We perform background checks on all final candidates.
Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good.

title: Partner Engineer, Google Workspace
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 6 years of experience as a partner engineer in a cloud computing environment, or in a customer or partner-facing team such as Professional Services, Solutions Architect or Systems Engineering.
* 6 years of experience with enterprise productivity (e.g., workspace) solutions, including unified communications and collaboration, and Generative AI.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Understanding of productivity technologies and how they can integrate with AI, audio/video systems to deliver next generation user experience.
* Ability to clearly articulate and present Google Workspace value to executive audiences, line of business and technology stakeholders of partners and customers organizations.
* Ability to build relationships with partners within a specific market.
  


**About the job**
-----------------


The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.



In this role you will develop Google Workspace technology partners outcomes through education, support, guidance and partnership and enabling them to drive innovation for customers.  

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Assess and analyze partners business and technical performance to support their growth. Help develop technology goal for their solutions.
* Work with partner technical teams to incorporate their existing solutions with workspace or develop proof-of-concepts industry or vertical solutions that allow partners to maximize workspace advantages.
* Advise on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure. Provide best practice advice to customers and partners and provide feedback from the field to Google Engineering teams.
* Provide design, migration and deployment expertise. Lead product and solution briefings and proof-of-concept work, alongside product management.
* Develop close relationships with Google’s Partner and Google Workspace Sales Managers to grow the relevance and impact of focused partners to the business.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Senior Project Manager for the Internal PMO at Atea Managed Services
description:
***Are you a skilled Senior project manager with a high degree of IT business understanding and proven experience in managing IT projects? Then we do have an exciting and challenging job for you.*** ***Succeed as Senior Project Manager in our global PMO in Managed Services***


As senior Project Manager in Development & Governance in Atea Managed Services you will lead IT Capability projects, IT Service Development projects, solution implementation, and transformation projects serving all Atea Managed Services divisions with a focus on delivering value.


You will be responsible for the management of projects when assessing, planning, resource allocation, execution, daily management, together with the project team do technical and organizational problem solving as well as follow-up, hand over, evaluation and closure of the project. You must manage the stakeholder’s expectations, drive, and motivate the project team and be the link between management and project team, organize internal team and cross-team cooperation, control task completion and project deliveries to ensure scope and quality is fulfilled.


You will lead the project on behalf of the Steering Committee and ensure project deliveries meet required scope, time, budget, and quality constraints. You liaise throughout the project with the Steering Committee, the Sponsor and the PMO Manager. You are responsible for compliance with the Internal Project process and agreed governance. This includes planning, taking active part in activities, that involve communicating with project team and project Steering Committee, other departments in Atea, managing local as well as 3rd party resources for being able to deliver project outcome.  



**Working with your project team your primary tasks will be to:**


* Take ownership of the project and drive it proactively following Internal Project Process to implement projects according to agreed governance.
* Unleash creativity and innovation from the Project Team.
* Carry out risk analysis, risk response planning, and risk monitoring and control with respect for budgets, governance, and deadlines.
* Ensure knowledge sharing with project manager colleagues as well as provide expert advice to lower-level project managers.
* Create and manage clear scope, milestones, tasks, handover activities for all involved parties.
* Plan and manage resources (time, people, assets, 3rd party involvement) to meet project completion deadlines.
* Share knowledge with relevant stakeholders throughout the project timeline.
* Cooperate with Enterprise Architects, Service Owners, Product Managers, IT Operations Tower Leads and Team Leads, IT Operations Experts (SME) and Service Delivery Managers during the project.
* Facilitate workshops and planning activities and participate in solution implementation activities as a management force.
* Ensure that necessary documentation is gathered, stored, and passed according to agreed knowledge management policy (KB, emails, internet etc.) for the individual projects.
* Gather financial documentation and align with accounting department.

  




**Qualifications**


* You have solid theoretical knowledge and practical experience in managing IT projects.
* You are driven by delivering high quality aligned with the expectations of the management.
* You preferably have a PRINCE2 Practitioner and / or PRINCE2 Agile Practitioner certification.
* You are familiar with RISK management, cost management, quality processes, project change management, leadership, and team building, problem-solving, reporting, facilitating meetings and workshops.
* You have high sense of responsibility, timeliness, and structure.
* English at a good level, both orally and in writing.

  




**About you**


We are searching for a professional who is not only goal-oriented and precise but also flexible and innovative in your approach. You should possess a strong sense of responsibility and professionalism that complements your superb communication and coordination skills. A diplomatic touch is essential as you navigate through the complexities of project and team dynamics.


Your strong business acumen and comprehensive understanding of the organizational aspects surrounding a project set you apart. With an enterprise mindset, you are outgoing and structured, driven by self-motivation and a relentless pursuit of results. We value commitment to continuous improvement and are looking for someone who is eager to develop both personally and professionally. If you are ready to bring your dynamic skill set to a role where you can make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you.

  


**Apply and become part of our journey!**


Applications are handled continuously, and the role can be filled before the final application date. Please respect to apply through our online portal and not by email. For questions or further information about the role contact PMO Manager, Peter Balslev, peter.balslev@atea.dk or telephone +45 3078 0676. To work within Atea AMS, you need to be a citizen of Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland or Latvia. As part of Ateas recruitment process, background checks are included. Atea wants to be the The Place To Be for our customers, partners, and employees as we value and work actively with diversity and inclusion. We welcome your application!

  


**About Atea**


Atea is the leading supplier of IT infrastructure in the Nordic and Baltic regions. Atea is present in 88 cities with over 8,000 employees in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia. Atea delivers hardware and software from leading global vendors and provides consulting and technical services to support its customers with the design, implementation, and operation of their IT environments. Atea had gross sales of approximately NOK 47 billion (EUR 4.6 billion) in 2022 and is listed on Oslo Stock Exchange.www.atea.com


Within Atea Managed Services (AMS), we are experts in IT operations. Regardless of whether our customers want to outsource parts or the entire IT operation, we are our customers preferred operating partner. We help free up resources and increase the overall efficiency of their IT organizations. We do this by delivering cost-effective operational services with the highest quality regardless of the customers platform requirements. This can mean in the customers own datacenter, in public cloud platforms or in our own Atea Cloud. Atea Managed Services is available in five countries and more than 1,500 employees work within the business area. We have operating personnel on duty around the clock.

title: Receptionist Scandic Täby
description:
**Scandic Täby** ligger invid motorvägen med närhet till såväl Stockholm city som Täby Centrum. Hotellet är nyligen renoverat i varma färger med en välkomnande känsla, en känsla som även återfinns bland hotellets medarbetare. Vi är alla delar av samma team, vi tar ansvar och hjälper varandra när det behövs. Gillar du att arbeta i team och vill tillsammans med oss leverera fantastiska upplevelser? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Täby.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Sr. Account Executive
description:
**Please return soon to complete your dream job application!**
--------------------------------------------------------------

  

**Sr. Account Executive**
=========================

Req id: 40762
Virtual, SE  

**OPENTEXT**  

OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.

  


**Your impact**  

We are currently looking for a committed Senior Account Executive with solid technology and business-to-business sales experience to grow the sale of our enterprise information management (EIM) solutions throughout customer organizations in Sweden.

  

  

**What the role offers**


* Delivering the sales revenue plan. Achieving or exceeding sales quotas for license, SaaS, maintenance, and services. Growing the business and OpenText´s market share. Responsible for managing costs and discretionary spending, including travel.
* Consultative selling and intensely listening to your customers.
* Preparing comprehensive territory plans.
* Identifying and converting opportunities into sales.
* Skillfully executing each phase of the sales process from pipeline generation to closing the deal.
* Accomplishing client presentations and running effective meetings.
* Clearly articulating the value proposition of solutions and products and the endless possibilities of the digital enterprise to your customers.
* Collaborating across all internal teams and resources and ensuring you bring the best solution to your clients.

  




**What you need to succeed**


* You have a solid track record of B2B selling across the Enterprise.
* You have experience consulting with C-level customers on complex cloud-based, on-premises, or hybrid solutions. You deploy advanced sales methodologies and tools to achieve and exceed your targets.
* You speak English and Swedish fluently.
* A university or bachelor’s degree in combination with several years of enterprise software sales experience and a willingness to travel within the assigned territory.
* You share an intellectual curiosity; you easily grasp new products and solutions, and you bring the spirit of innovation to your customers.

  




**One last thing**  

If you are passionate about driving business growth and have a proven track record in B2B sales, this role is for you. As a Senior Account Executive at OpenText, you'll have the opportunity to significantly impact our market share in Sweden by delivering innovative EIM solutions to our customers. You'll work with top-level executives, leverage your consultative selling skills, and collaborate with internal teams to provide the best solutions. Join us to take your career to new heights, exceed your sales targets, and be a key player in transforming the digital landscape.

  


OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws.


If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.
company_description: A global leader in Enterprise Information Management solutions, we enable intelligent & connected enterprises and inspire new ways to work.

title: Nattreceptionist Scandic Rubinen
description:
Västkustens pärla, Sveriges andra största stad, Lilla London. Kärt barn har många namn. Men det är här det händer! Med bästa läget i Göteborg, mitt på Avenyn, ligger Scandic Rubinen. Spännande inredning en innovativ restaurang och förmodligen Göteborgs bästa takbar. Vi är populära av stammisar, inresande och Göteborgarna själva.


Service för oss på Scandic Rubinen innebär alltid att vara det självklara valet för våra gäster, med detaljer i fokus, kreativitet och spontanitet. Ett hotell där våra medarbetare trivs och vill fortsätta utmanas och utvecklas i litet som stort. Tillsammans skapar vi stämning och atmosfären som präglar vistelsen för alla våra gäster och kollegor.


**Nu söker vi en Nattreceptionist till Scandic Rubinen.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta natt.


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid 84,21%.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Nattreceptionister sökes med erfarenhet av hotellsystemen Opera Cloud & ...
description:
**Om oss:**  

Vi på Alpa Bemanning & Rekrytering är ett etablerat bemanningsföretag inom hotell- och turismbranschen som värdesätter kvalitet och service. Vi strävar efter att erbjuda våra gäster en minnesvärd upplevelse och söker nu efter erfarna nattreceptionister som kan bidra till vår fortsatta framgång.
  
  

**Om tjänsten:**  

Vi erbjuder en extratjänst som nattreceptionist under sommaren. Som nattreceptionist kommer du att vara ansvarig för att säkerställa en smidig drift under nattens timmar och att ge våra gäster den bästa möjliga servicen. Vi söker specifikt efter kandidater med erfarenhet av att arbeta med hotellsystemen Opera Cloud & HotSoft..
  
Tjänsten är en extratjänst framförallt under sommaren.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

Minst 3 års erfarenhet som receptionist i hotellbranschen.
  
Genuin känsla för service och förstår vikten av att alltid prestera på topp!
  
Noggrann, ansvarsfull, med stort engagemang för människor och service.
  
Behärskning av hotellsystemen Opera Cloud & HotSoft
  
God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska
  
Serviceinriktad och professionell attityd
  
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och fatta snabba beslut
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

Attraktiv timlön
  
Flexibla arbetstider
  
Möjlighet att vara en del av ett dedikerat och professionellt team
  
En spännande arbetsmiljö inom hotellbranschen
  
  

Om du är en erfaren nattreceptionist som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och tror att du har vad som krävs för att lyckas i denna roll, skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
  
Ansökningar behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
Who are we?
  
WorkTiles is a collaboration tool designed to help companies organize, perform, and improve their monthly closing and consolidation process.
  
We’re building a world-class SaaS tool for professionals working within finance and accounting. As a founding engineer, you’ll be working closely with our small team with the opportunity to have a big impact on culture and our engineering activities.
  
Profile
  
Participate in all aspects of software development activities, including design, user interviews, coding, code review, unit/integration testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation
  
Work across the entire technical stack to ensure users have the most efficient and delightful experience using WorkTiles. The features you develop will span all aspects of the user experience
  
Fast prototyping of ideas and concepts and researching the latest industry trends
  
Passion for continuous improvement, technical and operational excellence
  
You take ownership and solve problems when you see them
  
High empathy, readiness to coach, pair with and learn from others
  
Fluent in English
  
  

Tech
  
SvelteKit frontend written in TypeScript
  
Tailwind for styling
  
Clerk for user management
  
Node with a TypeScript NestJs API
  
Fully managed Postgres as database
  
Hosted on Google Cloud
  
Github, Linear, Slack, Notion
  
  

Experience with listed technologies is great but not required.
  
What we offer
  
Joining as one of the first engineers you’ll have a great impact on technical decisions and culture
  
Building a great modern SaaS app from the ground up
  
Equity
  
Great remote work environment
  
Paid co-working space/desk at an office
  
Regular team events and off-sites
  
30 days of paid vacation

title: Network Architect
description:
Network Architect – NOVO Energy, Gothenburg
  
We are looking for a Network Architect to join our growing team and help us implement and develop cloud-first, state-of-the-art factory solutions. If you're a hands-on Network Architect eager to build the network infrastructure for our Industry 4.0 solutions, we'd love to discuss this role with you.
  
  

Our mission
  
Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Torslanda will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with the potential to produce battery cells for half a million Volvo cars per year.
  
  

Note; With summer holidays coming up, we will try to handle the applications as soon as we can, but you might expect feedback after summer.
  
  

The role
  
As a Network Architect, you will get the opportunity to implement and operate some of the worlds most advanced IoT networks that is the foundation for NOVO Energy’s Gigafactory in close collaboration with Northvolt. This is a unique opportunity to work with networking solutions that integrate across multiple domains and will evolve towards full automation ("network as a code") of the network infrastructure.
  
  

Your main responsibilities will be to design, build and operate a network based on principles from Northvolt. You will also be expected to use your in-depth knowledge of the network to participate in the resolution of complex network problems in the factory networks, datacenters, public cloud(s) and office networks.
  
This role requires frequent travels to Stockholm to work with, and learn from the Northvolt teams.
  
  

Key responsibilities
  
  

* Implementing strategic network and security designs following industry best practices.
* Determine the appropriate hardware, software and other equipment based on the organizations' resources and needs.
* Ensuring efficient support and maintenance of the current network, with a pro-active approach to constantly increase stability.
* Be able to examine network designs to identify issues.
* Help us build a great team and make NOVO Energy a great place to work!


Your skills and experiences
  
You will be expected to use your in-depth knowledge of the network to participate in the resolution of complex network problems in the factory networks, datacenters, public cloud(s) and office networks.
  
Deep working knowledge of the Cisco suite of products is highly beneficial.
  
  

As a person we see that you have an ability to communicate and collaborate well with team members. You are comfortable managing stakeholders (across all areas of the business) to gather requirements and present solutions. You’re are great listener and a skilled negotiator that take a consultative approach to identifying the best solutions for the business.
  
  

You have a structured way of working and take pride in ensuring your documentation is easy to understand and detailed enough to support the implementation of your design ideas. Sharing knowledge and building up others is something you love to spend your time on, and continuous improvement drives everything you do.
  
  

**To deliver in this complex task, we see that you bring:**  

* Minimum 8 years of experience in network design, development and operations.
* Experience in large scale network monitoring, automation, and testing.
* Basic knowledge of AWS/Azure Cloud networks.
* Familiar with Industrial Ethernet or any deterministic Ethernet protocols.
* Experience in GIT, terraform and Python.
* In-depth knowledge of network hardware and software technologies and best practice.
* Advanced knowledge of a network technology discipline (e.g. IP Routing and Switching, Routing Protocols, WAN, Firewall, Packet Analysis, Infrastructure, Capacity Planning, IT Tools and other relevant technologies).
* Hands on experience with network services such as DHCP, DNS, radius.
* Experience with wireless network design and implementation.
* Good knowledge of Cisco ISE for authentication and authorization for clients.
* Experience in Cisco Intent Based Networking.
* Hands-on experience with with Cisco IOS, IOS-XE and NXOS.
* Adequate knowledge about Software defined networking SDN, preferably Cisco ACI.
* Experience with Cisco Hyperconverged solution.
* Hands-on experience with Cisco ASA and Firepower.
* Hands-on experience with Palo Alto firewalls.


What’s in it for you?
  
This is a truly rare opportunity for an experienced architect to design, implement and operationalize a cloud first network - from scratch. Using best-of-breed technology, this network will need to meet the needs of highly automated manufacturing and thousands of employees with a focus on safety, security, and speed.
  
  

Our small and steadily growing IT team is a highly collaborative team working together to solve interesting problems. Together we innovate, reinvent, and learn quickly to build a world class Gigafactory, establishing a new high-tech industry in Gothenburg and build an exceptional business. Currently in a scale-up phase, this is an outstanding opportunity for you to make an outsized impact, contribute to our shared success and to grow your role, remit and career together with us.
  
  

Our expansion is rapid, and in coming years there will be 3,000 of us operating in a high-tech manufacturing setting where IT will be a critical enabler.
  
  

Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Gothenburg will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh) - thereby enabling a supply of batteries for approximately half a million Volvo cars per year. Our state-of-the-art R&D facility will gather leading expertise from all over the world, to create the next generation battery cells.
  
  

You can read more about this joint venture in these press releases, here and here.

title: Document Controller - Construction
description:
We are looking for a dedicated Junior Document Controller to join us in our mission to contribute to a greener future. By joining us, you will be a key player in establishing Document Control management and contribute to structuring and maintaining documentation and developing systematic procedures for incoming documents for current and Northvolt expansion sites.


As a Document controller you will be responsible to ensure that all documentation is created, distributed, reviewed, and approved in accordance with document control procedures using our document management systems Autodesk Construction Cloud, Teamcenter (Product Lifecycle Management PLM) and SharePoint.


You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders throughout all phases of current projects – engineering, construction, commissioning and production. You will also be a key interphase for on-boarding vendors and contractors to our systems and providing training to ensure procedures are followed.


**Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Develop and maintain the EDMS to ensure documentation is filed appropriately.
* Facilitate the transfer, update, review and approval of existing documentation to the EDMS.
* Maintain the CMDR (Contract Master Document Register) and DDM (Document Distribution Matrix) for specific engineering projects - ensuring deliverables are tracked and documents are distributed to the relevant parties.
* Responsible for the document control software tools and the associated licenses.
* Assist in the interface towards equipment vendors and contractors for their timely document delivery.
* Coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders for completion and handing over of project documents.
* Develop, maintain and quality assurance for templates and guidelines.
* Provide EDMS training for all stakeholders upon request and support with locating, downloading, exporting reports on, and reviewing and approving documents.
* Use structured metadata information to present the completion status for document packages.


The person we are looking for is flexible, curios and eager to learn. You will get the chance to have a real impact on our success story in Sweden (to start with) and see the results of your work. Our organization values great self-discipline and a natural talent to make things happen. Qualities that we cherish are sense of quality, friendliness, grit and a sense of humor.


Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development.


Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Full time employment, fixed salary.
  

Planned starting date is asap.


Skills & Requirements


**We believe that you have** **:**


* Relevant Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Business Administration.
* Microsoft office suite skills (word, excel, OneNote etc.)
* Fluent language skills in English (both written and oral) are a must. Other languages are an advantage.
* The person that we are looking for is positive, highly organized and has an eye for detail.
* Ability to work under high pressure and tight deadlines, excellent time management.
Great Place to Work


World leading technique


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Warrant program


Wellness grant
company_description: Northvolt is a supplier of sustainable, high-quality batteries. The mission is to build the world’s greenest battery, with minimal carbon footprint and the highest ambitions for recycling

title: Customer Service Agent
description:
At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Adhesive Technologies help to transform entire industries and provide our customers with a competitive advantage through adhesives, sealants and functional coatings. With our trusted brands, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.
   

  

**Dare to make an impact?**
**Your Role**
* Accountable for customer facing activities/customer experience, acting as SPOC for customer, adopting customer centric mindset Run OTC and Customer Service Management, focusing mainly on customer interaction related activities (in/outbound)
* Contribute to the understanding of customer segments, needs and expectations by providing feedback on customer interactions
* Build customer relationship by supporting enquiries; Collect feedback & identify opportunities to drive CSAT, including regular visits
* Enter relevant data in the CRM system to create call plan & ensure quality data for business development activities, schedule follow-ups
* Provide quality service to customers while identifying opportunities to secure new business or support retention via customer interaction
* Collaborate closely with internal partners (CSX, CoE, GBS+, SC), judging and aligning priorities to meet customer needs vs. SC capabilities
* Support the implementation of organizational changes, processes, projects, pilots and regional best practices
* Contribute to reviewing operations in own area of work & generate ideas to assist in identifying continuous improvement for operational efficiencies & CX
* Prioritize own workflow, ensure work is completed with productivity, quality & timeliness; use KPI's and reports to monitor own performance
* Utilize customer service systems and tools (SAP & Service Cloud), driving efficiencies and providing feedback to contribute to improvement
* Plan own activities on daily/weekly/monthly basis to ensure business continuity, enhance efficiences & improve customer satisfaction


**YOUR SKILLS**
* Previous customer service experience, preferably gained from within Industry.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English
* Planning, organising and ability to work to deadlines
* Problem solving and continuous improvement approach.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* CRM system knowledge would be beneficial


 At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect till Proffsmagasinet**
**Vi på Proffsmagasinet,** 
 en del av Ahlsell, erbjuder över 150 000 kvalitetsprodukter för medvetna hantverkare och hemmafixare. Med en omsättning på 900 miljoner kronor i Sverige, Finland, Danmark och Norge gör det oss ett av Nordens ledande företag inom e-handel.
   

  

 Proffsmagasinet befinner sig i en expansionsfas med en långsiktig strategisk plan där vi genom att tillhandahålla marknadens bredaste sortiment, ledande logistiklösningar, relevanta priser och en kundupplevelse i världsklass ska bli en destination för hemmaprojektet.
   

  

 Vi söker därför en nyfiken och driven
 **Solution Architect** 
**.** 
 Du kommer att spela en avgörande roll i att designa och implementera robusta, skalbara och effektiva helhetslösningar som är i linje med våra affärsmål.
   

  

**Som Solution Architect kommer du arbeta nära verksamheten med bland annat:**
* Ansvara för vårt e-handelsramverk, som systemarkitektur, tekniska specifikationer och dokumentation.
* Designa helhetslösningar och säkerställa att de överensstämmer med branschens bästa praxis. Kartlägga och dokumentera arkitektur och integrationer.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehov och översätta dem till skalbara och effektiva tekniska lösningar
* Azure-baserade integrationer och funktioner
* Integrationer för Marketing Automation


 Diverse teknologier och databaser så som: .NET 6+, Microsoft Azure, App Services, Logic Apps, Data Factory, Azure Storage, CosmosDB och ServiceBus, SQL, noSQL och docker containers.
   

  

 Din bas är på vårt fina kontor i
 **Liljeholmen** 
 men du kommer att arbeta i ett internationellt team med kollegor i Sverige, England och Tjeckien. Vi använder den senaste tekniken och strävar efter en inkluderande arbetsmiljö baserad på vänlighet och vilja att bidra.
   

  

**För att du ska trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du...**
* Har erfarenhet av e-handel med inriktning detaljhandel (retail e-commerce) med fokus på lösningsarkitektur
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Är social, kommunikativ och gillar att ha kul på jobbet


**Proffsmagasinet** 
**– en hjälpsam och stöttande företagskultur**
 Vi vet att vägen till framgång och en bra kundupplevelse går genom våra anställda. Proffsmagasinet erbjuder dig därför en möjlighet att jobba i en inkluderande arbetsmiljö, en hjälpsam och stöttande företagskultur med självgående arbetsteam. Det finns goda möjligheter för dig att vara med och påverka inriktningen inom vår strategi och växa i din roll. Du kommer även erbjudas goda villkor och förmåner inom bland annat friskvård och pension.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontaka Simon Patel, CTO via simon.patel@proffsmagasinet.se

title: Sales Executive, Siemens Digital Industries Software
description:
Eviden is an Atos Group business with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion and a global leader in data-driven, trusted, and sustainable digital transformation. As a next-generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing, and security, it brings deep expertise to all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 55,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
 











 Eviden is investing in the Nordics. Our ambition is to implement heavy business growth across Nordics countries and become a Leader in empowering industrial customers with unwavering adaptability and industrial excellence​. The hearth of our Nordics strategy is to build a local manufacturing center of excellence, to become a preferred partner for industrial companies in the Nordics.
 











 We are dedicated to innovating together with our clients and partners to enhance the design, manufacturing, sales, and service of products, serving our clients securely and sustainably.
 







**Position overview:** 








 Eviden is the largest Siemens software reseller in the Nordics. We have built our expertise spanning nearly 30 years in the industry and have a strong team of experts in Scandinavia and the Baltics. Siemens's partnership is a strategic choice for us. We are at the forefront of digital transformation and cloud services, and we are seeking Sales Specialists for our Manufacturing Center of Excellence in the Nordics.
 







 Your mission: As a Sales Executive, you will join our Siemens Digital Industries Software sales team and focus on selling Siemens software and services to industrial clients in the region. Your goal is to position Siemens Digital Industries Software as the preferred technology and Eviden as a trusted advisor in PLM, MOM, and Product/Production Simulation areas. The main focus is to land new customers.
 







***We will consider candidates based in the following locations: Finland, Sweden, Denmark, or Norway***








**As a key contributor to our growth in the Nordics, your responsibilities include:** 







* Strategize and penetrate large accounts with a focus on Siemens Digital Industries Software portfolio and you will be working with highly skilled professionals working in SAP, digital security, smart platforms, and manufacturing domains.
* Accrue and deploy customer insights, driving business transformation and reducing customer costs and risks.
* Lead with product and industry insights, best practices, and compelling business cases, establishing Eviden as a tier 1 industry partner and a trusted advisor.
* Manage customer relationships with integrity, driving satisfaction and positioning Eviden as a leader in innovation and service delivery.
* Leverage your existing network to land new customers in our Siemens Digital Industries Software offerings.
* Build a broad influential network amongst your clients to create additional opportunities to expand our footprint in the accounts.
* Engage prospects and provide strategic recommendations that position our products and services to advance the customer’s strategic initiatives and deliver mutual value.
* Work closely with marketing to improve our position in the market and harness your digital sales and marketing skills to drive new sales leads.
* Build and own your sales territory plan and execute the plan by leading our pre-sales consultants and marketing team.








**Qualifications:** 







* Passion for industrial digitalization and experience and understanding of industrial value chain.
* 5+ years of experience in enterprise software sales, sales enablement, business development, software industry operations
* Experience in value-based sales methodologies
* Proven track record of success in selling complex technical software solutions and building strong qualified pipeline in systematic way.
* Skill in identifying key stakeholders and decision-makers, establishing long-term relationships of trust, credibility, and respect.
* Strong work ethic: Team player, self-starter, high energy, and results oriented.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, both verbal and written, is mandatory. A fluent local language (Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian) is considered as a large benefit.








**What we offer:** 







* A role in a unique technology powerhouse with a strong local and global presence and a commitment to driving sustainability and environmental programs.
* Opportunities for growth within a company that values learning, agility, and customer obsession.
* You will have a unique opportunity to witness heavy business expansion and you are essential contributor for the growth.

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
**Brief job description** 




 Sii Sweden on its development journey is looking for talented Java engineers who can join our team and have a chance to contribute to many international projects from different industries such as automotive, healthcare, e-commerce, banking, and much more.
 



 Join Sii Sweden and unlock the perks of an experienced IT consulting company. Access training, webinars, knowledge-sharing opportunities with fellow Sii colleagues as well as our rich compensation package including insurance, pension plan, and wellness package. Thrive in our stable and growth-oriented environment!
 



  





**Your role** 



* Assuring code quality and adherence to coding standards in projects
* Designing, building, testing and maintaining the company’s product according to requirements
* Working together within the team following Agile methodology, cooperating with other teams in order to deliver a mistake-free solution
* Proactively suggesting improvements to existing functionalities



  





**Your skills** 



* At least a BA in an engineering-related field
* Experience in software development using Java
* Previous work with Unit Testing and CI/CD practices
* Hands-on experience with AWS (considerable also other services such as Azure or Google Cloud)
* Fluent in English and Swedish (written and spoken)

title: Commercial Advisor
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe-essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M: Learn more about H&M | H&M Careers (hm.com)
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are hiring a Commercial Advisor to provide expert commercial support to our Business Tech organization and hubs. The successful candidate will deliver significant business value throughout the product lifecycle by leveraging their experience in tech sourcing and procurement. This role involves the rigorous development of business cases, executing high-quality, market-competitive deals, and optimizing ongoing relationships with external partners.
   

  

 As a Commercial Advisor, you will utilize your leadership skills and commitment to a nonhierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust. Your focus will be on value creation, growth, and delivering exceptional customer and business results.
   

  

***Key Responsibilities:***
* Support leaders in defining and implementing commercial and partner strategies.
* Negotiate advantageous terms with external partners.
* Screen potential new partners and collaborations, with a focus on tech partnerships
* Establish and implement strategic parameters for partner portfolios, ensuring optimal long-term management.
* Manage collaboration and performance according to frameworks, assessing risks versus expected business outcomes.
* Oversee risk management for partner and vendor contracts and agreements.
* Challenge existing commercial models and propose new strategies for optimizing tech partnerships.
* Devise negotiation strategies and processes tailored to each deal.
* Identify potential deal designs to meet objectives, such as risk aversion versus creating optionality.
* Manage dealmaking processes, including RFPs, tendering, and time planning.
* Ensure compliance with H&M Group Purchasing and Consultant Policy.
* Execute deals in alignment with initial objectives.
* Continuously acquire knowledge of relevant technologies and business needs through supplier and market analyses.
* Monitor and act on spend analyses.
* Support the setup of collaboration and governance between product stakeholders, partners, and vendors.
* Manage contract life cycles, including extensions, renegotiations, terminations, and call offs.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience of 5+ years in managing people, vendors, and technology in the global environment.
* Strong expertise in SAP a key requisite.
* Proficient negotiator with expertise in managing relationships with technology manufacturers and service providers.
* Excellent organizational and structuring skills for complex matters.
* Preference for experience with cloud companies.
* Solid foundation in procurement and supplier management best practices.
* Ability to develop, establish, and train processes.
* Bottom-line thinker with a deep understanding of tech-related business cases.
* Proficient in tech fundamentals such as software development, architecture, integration, cloud, web applications, and microservices.
* Strong analytical skills, including KPI (Key Performance Indicators) development and business case construction.
* Methodical thinker capable of connecting business case objectives to necessary actions.
* Effective critical thinking skills and a pragmatic approach.
* Ability to influence and persuade others.
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to provide constructive challenges.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **permanent** 
 based in
 **Stockholm** 
 with a start date as soon as possible. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than
 **16th June 2024** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we are determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

title: Technical Specialist - DLP & SaaS (EMEA & LATAM)
description:
**Company Description**
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Our Approach to Work**
 We lead with flexibility and choice in all of our people programs. We have disrupted the traditional view that all employees have the same needs and wants. We offer personalization and offer our employees the opportunity to choose what works best for them as often as possible - from your wellbeing support to your growth and development, and beyond!
   

  

 At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work from the office three days per week, leaving two days for choice and flexibility to work where you feel most effective. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. While details may evolve, our goal is to create an environment where innovation thrives, with office-based teams coming together three days a week to collaborate and thrive, together!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 We are looking for a DLP & SaaS Technical Specialist who will report to the VP Strategy & GTM. The role will be an individual contributor who will support the Palo Alto Networks mission to help improve the security posture of organizations across all theaters through development of a range of security best practice products and services. This position is responsible for the conceptualization, planning, development and execution of DLP & SaaS initiatives while ensuring alignment to the objectives and priorities of Palo Alto Networks.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Will understand and characterize the needs of Palo Alto Networks’ customers leading to the identification, prioritization, and development of appropriate DLP & SaaS subscription levels, bundles and services
* In coordination with the security services team, engineering and Palo Alto Leadership, assist in the development and deployment of DLP & SaaS offerings and services to ensure timeliness to market, technical field alignment, and product quality to teams across the organization
* Monitor industry research and development efforts, as well as, identify and help sponsor research and development that will provide details instrumental to the growth of the DLP & SaaS business
* Design, plan and help articulate technical use cases that enable and accelerate organization-wide strategic priorities
* Evangelize the value of our DLP & SaaS solutions through presentations and briefings to executives, key stakeholder groups, and key internal customers (core team, theaters, marketing, operations etc.)
* Effectively run demos and assist in the running of POC's to ensure customer success


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* 5+ years experience in technical, cybersecurity role
* 2+ years DLP expertise
* Proven experience in pre-sales
* Experience of VP/C level customer engagement is preferred
* Significant set of experiences with GTM / growth in a B2B fast-growing company
* Proven track record of leading complex analysis and driving clear prioritization and strategy
* Strong knowledge of the internet security/security services product landscape with strong knowledge and experience in DLP and/or SaaS
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills - must be comfortable interacting extensively with executive staff
* Positive, growth-oriented mindset
* Thrives in a matrixed, team environment anchored by our values of Collaboration, Disruption, Execution, Inclusion, and Integrity
* Experience of travelling internationally is preferred


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our GTM team members work hand in hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 As part of our GTM team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto
   

  

 Networks who isn’t committed to your success — everyone pitches in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. You are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyber threats.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer.
