title: Senior Product Manager - Console
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*


The Customer Experience area at Tink has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences for our customers. We are a tightly-knit team with a mixture of skills such as product and engineering managers, full stack engineers, designers, data analysts and copywriters. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we ensure our customers see value from the Tink platform from day one.


**What you will do**  

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to oversee the development of the Tink Console, a web-based application that lets developers configure, manage, test and deploy access to our portfolio of API-based products.

**Responsibilities**

* Use your deep understanding of developer platforms to deliver powerful, yet delightfully simple tools that elevate the customer experience.
* Collaborate closely with other Tink product teams to constantly improve how their products are packaged, presented and delivered to their users. Articulating and delivering a vision that encompasses multiple products is a crucial part of your role.
* Develop, through stakeholder collaboration, a cohesive vision for how Tink customers should experience working with Tink's products.Establish a structure to optimize the performance of the teams and area over the long term.
* This position plays a key role in enhancing Tink's overall Product Management expertise.
* Ensure high performance and tight collaboration within teams.
* Management and mentorship of product experts for their growth is also part of the role.
* Structuring domain targets and ensuring their achievement is a key responsibility.

**What we offer you**  

Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the chance to oversee and shape the future of our product, and be part of a mission to deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers.

**What we’re looking for**


We are looking for a senior product leader who can be the domain expert and fully understand all aspects of our products. You should be able to articulate goals and objectives that encompass multiple products and deliver this vision through multiple teams. We expect you to manage and structure customer-facing collaborations, ensure tight collaboration and high performance within teams, and manage and mentor more product experts for growth.


We would like you to have:

* Significant product management experience at a technology company, creating strategic product roadmap(s) from conception to launch while working with cross-functional teams.
* A keen interest in software development, perhaps you’ve worked as a software engineer yourself.
* Previous experience working with developer-first platforms and portals is a plus.
* Exceptional product discovery, decision-making, and delivery skills.
* Strong collaboration, people and team development skills.


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

*Who we are at Tink*

*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*

*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*

*We're looking forward to your application!*

title: Engineering Team Lead
description:

* Organise effective onboarding of new team members (in collaboration with the People Team)
* Conduct coaching conversations about development and performance with team members.
* Organise training plans for team members according to their individual needs
* Create a pleasant working environment that inspires the team
* Flag any issues and proactively discuss resolution in order to keep employees engaged and to retain internal talent
* Collaborate with other Team Leads and Engineering Managers on department-wide improvements
* Contribute as an engineer. Being hands-on will not be the highest priority for this role, but it is present.

  

  

  

  

**What you will need**


* Tech Skills:
	+ Strong understanding of good engineering practices
	+ Proficiency in building reliable, highly available and scalable applications
	+ Good understanding of CI/CD. Advocating for going live continuously with small batches
	+ Deep knowledge of testing methodologies
	+ Experience with establishing monitoring and proper observability

  

* Soft Skills:
	+ Great collaboration skills
	+ Fluent in English, both written and verbal
	+ Ability to motivate and support people
	+ Knowledge of how to coach people
	+ Knowledge of modern management and software development methodologies
	+ Ability to think on a strategic level and challenge the team to do the same
	+ Ability to set goals and help people reach them
	+ Experience with building environments where people are eager to give and receive constructive feedback

 **Who we are**



Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.



We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand-side response services.



Learn more about us in this video!

  

In 2022, Sympower became a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.


*Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members!*


*Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our* *Privacy Policy**.*

  

***MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.***
company_description: Sympower is a cleantech scaleup driven by the mission of shaping an intelligent and green power system via advanced flexibility software solutions that enhance the value of energy assets.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
If you're seeking to work with fast-paced product development and want to be part of an expanding SaaS journey, then this is a great opportunity for you! Startdeliver is building the next generation Customer Success platform and are looking for new colleagues to join our great team!

#### **What you will do as a Senior Fullstack Engineer**


We’re looking for somebody to take on a core role within our development team and together with us you’ll innovate, experiment and build the next generation Customer Success Platform. As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you will be responsible for working on both new and existing components of our web application, which is built using the Vue.js framework.


Examples of tasks will be

* Building new product features
* Optimizing and polishing current functionality
* Solving bugs and issues that appear


You'll work closely with the rest of the product team, including other fullstack developers, backend developers, QA engineers, and the design team. We use tools and apps such as Figma, GitHub, VS Code, and CI/CD. We also love to try out new technologies and are always looking to improve our workflow.


We are still a small team and as such you'll have a great opportunity to really make an impact and contribute with new ideas. We are working quickly and new releases are happening daily.

#### **What we are looking for**


We're looking for a highly skilled and passionate fullstack Developer with extensive experience working with modern Javascript frameworks (such as Vue.js and React). Your primary skills include converting design mockups into seamless frontend components, employing logical code to create interactive user interfaces, and effectively handling data from backend APIs. As a person, you have a great drive to make things happen, have a problem-solving mindset and come with an open mind to try new ways of working. You're also a problem solver and good at prioritizing to make deadlines and fix critical issues.

  

Except from this, we see that you have;

* A strong technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in managing software driven projects.
* Knowledge of how backend APIs are built, preferably using Node.js
* Fluent in verbal and written Swedish and English
* Education within a relevant field
* An open approach while embracing innovation, explore new strategies, and enjoy the journey.
* **Please note, for this role it’s a requirement to have worked with a modern framework for a SaaS or similar product at a Tech company for 2+ years.**

  

It is also advantageous to have any other type of technical competence and background such as, development of APIs, mobile apps, Redis, SQL, NoSQL, Serverless, CI, Git, Docker, K8s, operation of applications and databases, etc.


So, if you are passionate about fullstack development and SaaS, get motivated by changing an industry, and want to grow your career at super speed- then this is the place for you!

#### **Who is Startdeliver and how is it to work here?**


We are offering you the chance to be a part of Startdelivers journey, when building the next generation platform for Customer Success. We believe in impact. We want to help companies transform how they work and start delivering impact to their customers. This is going to be the future for any business.


Our founders have a long background in SaaS and growing successful companies. We know what it takes to build a world class company and it starts with a world class team. You will be part of an inspiring environment, with skilled and creative colleagues, where you’ll play a centric role with a big impact on both how we are building our company and product ahead! You will be in a thriving culture, where we collaborate to reach our goals – and at the same time have fun together! Even though we love our work we still love our coffee, having team activities, or maybe a drink or two after work.


We are based in central of Stockholm at Klarabergsgatan 60, 111 21 Stockholm


Can’t wait to meet you!

title: Software Engineer (Java)
description:
**Would you like to be part of the journey in one of Europes fastest growing fintech? 🚀** 




  





**About Mynt** 




 Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, revolutionizing businesses' efficiency. Our digital software, coupled with credit cards, eradicates manual administrative tasks for businesses. Experiencing explosive growth in the Swedish and Finnish markets, we recently secured substantial funding to fuel our expansion both in Sweden and internationally.
 



  





 As a tech-first company with a product-oriented mindset, Mynt aims to address businesses' pain points. In 2021, Mynt obtained licenses as an issuer and an E-money institution from the Swedish Regulatory Authorities.
 



  





 In 2022, we announced an exclusive partnership with Fortnox, integrating corporate cards within their platform. Early in 2023, a similar card-issuing partnership was revealed with Accountor Group in Finland. Additional partnerships are in progress and under development.
 



  





 Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 50 employees, we plan to further expand our team to support our growth.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for top developers who have a passion for development and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where there is a great opportunity to influence results and the company's progress. With us, you will develop in a modern codebase using the latest technologies and take on significant personal responsibility.
 



  





 You will become part of an ambitious team consisting of several developers with senior backgrounds and knowledge from the scale-up, finance, and consulting industries. At Mynt, we work in agile sprints, closely together but with a high degree of freedom.
 



  





 As a Java developer, you will build business logic and APIs (app and web) in close collaboration with product managers for each area. We work according to agile principles, with clean code and CI/CD. Testing, TDD, and automation are a natural part of the process that ensures agility.
 



  





 You will also be part of the architecture process where you get to help develop new products. You are offered the opportunity to build a new product at an exciting stage using the latest technologies, such as Java, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Amazon AWS, Docker, CircleCI.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor/Engineering degree or equivalent
* At least 4+ years of experience in back-end development using Java
* Ability to write well-documented, clean code
* You truly enjoy finding innovative solutions together with your team
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**What we can offer you** 



* Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
* Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
* Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
* Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.



  





*The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!*

 You would be able to operate as an independent consultant for this assignment, which I can support with. If you are not available for a new project now, we offer a generous referral scheme. title: Software Engineer, Server Reliability (Europe) - World of Warcraft
description:
**Team Name**
 World of Warcraft
   

  

**Job Title**
 Software Engineer, Server Reliability (Europe) - World of Warcraft
   

  

**Requisition ID**
 R022812
   

  

**Job Description**
 The World of Warcraft team is seeking an engineer to join the Server Reliability team. In this role, you will work with engineers and designers to enable hosting new and exciting content.
   

  

 As a server reliability engineer, we’ll need you to investigate any service issues that occur, partnering closely with designers and engineers to push new content and deploy fixes. You’ll find yourself digging into source code, reviewing changes looking for hidden complexities, tracking evidence in logs and server telemetry, and using your eye for reliability to help the team make great decisions. If you are someone who loves solving technical service issues, we’d love to see your application.
   

  

 Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees along with the business. We offer competitive benefits and strive for a healthy work / life balance. We work hard to foster a deeply collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything, and we are dedicated to creating the most epic entertainment experiences… ever. Join us!
   

  

 What you will do…
   

  

* Create, and support the build systems and automation for World of Warcraft.
* Deploy data hotfixes to databases throughout the development lifecycle.
* Review, build, and deploy server software in a live environment.
* Diagnose software problems occurring within the World of Warcraft servers.
* Promote, contribute to, and participate in our culture of inclusion and diversity


 To succeed, you must have…
   

  

* The ability to use deductive reasoning to solve problems
* 3+ Years of Software Development Experience
* Proficiency with C++
* A tenacious curiosity for diagnosing exactly why something went wrong
* A reliability geared mindset, to be able to look at the architecture of a system and help predict how changes might impact customers and infrastructure
* Familiarity with Networking and Server Design concepts
* Fluency in an object-oriented programming language
* Strong communication skills


 We’re also interested in hearing stories you may have about…
   

  

* Working with Linux and/or Databases
* Used automation to help reduce toil and/or increase development velocity.
* Needing to solve problems that were tricky and technical


 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Accommodation Request: We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
   

  

 Our World
   

  

 At Blizzard Entertainment, we pour our hearts and souls into everything we create. Best known for iconic video game universes including Warcraft, Overwatch, Diablo, and StarCraft, we’ve been creating genre-defining games for millions of players around the world for more than 30 years. We’re on a quest: bring our dreams to life and craft the most epic entertainment experiences…ever. Hard work, iteration and polish go into the Blizzard “secret recipe,” but the most important ingredients come from talented people who share our vision. If that sounds like you, join us.
   

  

 The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics.

title: C++ Developer for autonomous vehicle simulations
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

*“I work in a team of talented and dedicated people. Having fun and taking care of each other is a high priority. We put great value in inclusion and interaction which becomes visible in our daily actions. My work contributes to making an impact in the journey towards a sustainable and innovative global future”.*
 Would it feel awesome to describe your work like that?  If so, please continue reading and apply for this role today!
   

  

**What does the department of Autonomous Systems at Scania do?**
 We develop transport solutions for the future. We are making self-driving trucks and buses a reality! Our group Simulation is contributing to the development of autonomous vehicles by enabling engineering productivity. We enable the use of large-scale simulation tools.
   

  

 We are steadily growing and now looking for you, a talented
 **C++ developer** 
 , to strengthen our simulation team.
   

  

**As a C++ developer in the simulation team, you will work with:**
* Enablement of advanced large-scale simulation testing for the development of autonomous vehicles
* Integration of third-party state-of-the-art tools in our simulation platform.
* Support of software developers and testers throughout the organization with the simulation tools.
* Contributing to the team’s planning and roadmaps.


 In your role, you will learn how our autonomous vehicle software stack works. Your contributions will be one of the keys to securing the efficient and safe deployment of Scania’s next-generation autonomous software.
   

  

 We give high value to cooperation, support to each other and knowledge sharing. Spontaneous mob sessions happen frequently.
   

  

**Your Skills.**
 We are looking for a developer that enjoys programming in C++. You are a humble and inclusive team player with an open mindset. To succeed in your tasks, we believe you have:
   

  

  

* True passion for programming and focus on code quality
* Interest in complex problem solving
* At least 2-3 years of professional experience in C++ development
* Linux competence
* Curiosity and you are a life-long learner.
* Working experience in product with large code base is meritorious.


 The department works according to the Scaled Agile Framework SAFe but even experience from other agile frameworks is excellent know-how.
   

  

**What is it like to work at Autonomous Systems?**
 We offer an international and dynamic environment where your knowledge and skills will be highly valued. You will be encouraged to reveal your ideas and to take initiative with a dare-to-try attitude. Our employees are our most valuable resource, so we will invest in your professional as well as personal development.
   

  

 Hybrid remote work possibilities are our current normal way of working.
   

  

 Scania is moving towards a Data & Software-driven provider of sustainable transport solutions and establishing as one of the largest software development companies in Sweden. A key to success is our people working with the software. “Software Developers at Scania” is a place where you can get inspired and learn more about internal activities such as the Scania hack.
   

  

 https://www.scania.com/group/en/home/career/life-at-scania/software-developers-at-scania.html
   

  

  

  

 As a Scania employee, you are also offered several benefits such as a mutual bonus, leasing a car, occupational pension, and flexible working hours. The position is based in Södertälje, with possibilities of hybrid office-and-remote work. If you live in Stockholm, there is a direct bus service from Stockholm City, via Liljeholmen to Södertälje, called Scania Job Express, when you want to go to the office.
   

  

**Did you like what you read?**
 Do not hesitate and apply! Do not miss the chance to be part of a great team and a great organization.
 *Join us and contribute to shaping the future!* 
  

  

 Your application should consist of a CV, personal letter, and your degree diploma/transcript of records.
   

  

**Information:**
 Please contact Raul Gonzalez Pons, Group Manager, +46 8 553 896 27, for more information.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Global Banking & Markets, Goldman Sachs Electronic Trading (GSET) DevOps Engineer, [Seniority], Associate, Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**Goldman Sachs**
 The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments, and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.
   

  

**Divisional Overview**
 Global Banking and Markets division provides financing, advisory, risk distribution, and hedging services for institutional and corporate clients. Within Global Banking and Markets, our equities professionals focus on delivering ideas, execution, and liquidity to a wide array of clients trading the entire range of equity products, including physical shares, ETFs, synthetic shares, baskets, options, and other derivatives. Our engineers play important roles in several areas within the division. Some engineers build automated trading platforms and algorithms for the firm and its clients, taking an active part in the increasing shift from voice to electronic trading. Others sit on trading desks, creating cutting-edge derivative pricing models, and developing empirical models to provide insight into market behavior. Still others develop systems and processes that assist with making the entire trade life cycle more seamless.
   

  

**GSET Engineering**
 Goldman Sachs Electronic Trading (GSET) offers a best-in-class comprehensive suite of trading strategies to help clients achieve their trading objectives and navigate a variety of market conditions leveraging historical analyses, quantitative models, and real-time market information. These strategies are built on a highly distributed, scalable, low latency trading platform, which processes billions of transactions daily in the low microsecond range, with minimal jitter. Our engineers are responsible for designing, building, and maintaining this trading platform as well as the strategies running on the platform, in a collaborative environment. The software our engineers write is of a very high standard: it is client and market facing with real time SLAs and can have high financial and regulatory impact. Some engineers focus on implementing the platform, its surrounding ecosystem and order management workflows, writing highly performant code and optimizing its interaction with the hardware and infrastructure it is executing on. Others work on building the trading models, signals and algorithmic logic which constitute the trading strategies.
   

  

**Who Are We Looking For**
 We are looking for strong engineers in the GSET DevOps space. The team owns the production plant and manages systems that process billions of dollars’ worth of trades every day. The team works to continuously improve processes and tools to achieve a quicker time to market for changes, increased stability, and reduced toil. The team also incorporates aspects of software engineering and applies it to trading operations problems. We push our own boundaries and challenge the status quo in others. Our main goal is to create scalable and resilient trading systems through best-in-class software change management. Our team supports and enhances user acceptance and production environments that are leveraged by clients and internal users for testing software and daily use.We want technical people that communicate well and have a passion for efficiency and automation, continually looking for ways to improve. As part of this effort, they will be expected to collaborate with colleagues across the world.
   

  

**YOUR IMPACT**
 Working as a member of the DevOps team, your focus will be ensuring high release velocity and stability for the trading applications. This critical role includes analysis of real-time trading issues and enhancing our processes. The role also entails planning and leading projects across the wider GSET team to accommodate change and deliver new functionality to our clients.
   

  

 The ideal candidate brings customer service excellency in their approach and have a solid understanding of distributed software systems. The role is adaptable to levels of seniority.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
* Productive in programming with a focus on scripting and infrastructure as code
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic production environment
* Ability to challenge status quo and automate manual tasks
* Ability to drive complex change to completion in collaboration and independently
* Knowledge of basic networking concepts, topologies, and technologies
* Experience in working and supporting production platforms
* Experience or willingness to quickly learn large-scale automated testing and releasing
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team


**Preferred Qualifications**
* C++ programming experience
* Hands-on experience in the release processes of large-scale software applications
* Good understanding of software development life cycle processes
* Strong grasp of computer networks with a good understanding of TCP/IP
* Application support experience within Linux environments
* Experience in application monitoring, performance, and capacity management in large-scale systems
* Working knowledge of order management systems


**Key Responsibilities**
* Ownership of our production services by measuring and monitoring availability, response times, and overall system health.
* Building tools for reducing toil and enhancing process efficiencies
* Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and release reviews.
* Responsible for the successful deployment of certified code and new functionality into the production trading environment
* Facilitate communications between trading desks, strategists, engineers, and other support teams to manage unexpected or day-to-day issues
* Continuously improve availability, stability, and performance of systems
* Coordinate the analysis, troubleshooting and resolution of system issues via postmortems

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Data
description:

 **Senior Backend Engineer** 
  to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

 About the role

title: Erfaren .NET Utvecklare till Fintech-bolag på uppgång
description:
Nu är vi på jakt efter en .Net utvecklare till ett härligt Fintech bolag här i Stockholm. Du kommer tillsammans med ett agilt team utveckla skräddarsydda finansiella lösningar till era kunder på en social och rolig arbetsplats. Så om du har jobbat med C# utveckling i tre år eller mer, sök nu!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm innerstan
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som .NET-utvecklare hos vår kund som levererar finansiella lösningar till sina kunder kommer du att vara en nyckelmedlem i teamet av utvecklare där du är delaktig i att designa, utveckla och underhålla applikationer. Du kommer att arbeta med en bred portfölj av projekt, samarbeta i team där kvalité är av största vikt och skriva kod av.
 


  


 Bolaget är del av en större koncern som funnits i snart 25 år. Nu testar de vingarna och har brutit sig ut från moderskeppet och i och med det anställer de fler kollegor. Du kommer att vara baserad på kontoret i Stockholm med en flexibilitet att jobba hemifrån 50% av tiden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En arbetsplats med härliga kollegor och bra arbetsklimat
  
* En attraktiv lön
  
* Nyrenoverade lokaler mitt inne i stan med hemtrevlig stämning
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckla och underhålla .NET-applikationer i C#
  
* Arbeta i en agil möjlig där du kommer samarbeta med flera olika team-kollegor dagligen
  
* Felsöka och lösa programvarufel och problem
  
* Då högkvalitativ kod är av största prioritet kommer ni kodgranska tillsammans
  
* Du kommer vara med och ta beslut kring design och arkitektur
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av .Net utveckling, med huvuddelen i frontend
  
* Är väl bevandrad inom C# programmering
  
* Har kunskap av att jobba i databaser och SQL
  
* Språk: Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift
  
* Utbildning: En akademisk examen inom systemutveckling, datateknik eller liknande
  


  

  

  

  

  


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en driven individ som tycker om att lära dig nya tekniker och hålla dig uppdaterad på det senaste.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Problemlösande**
  
* **Samarbetsorienterad**
  
* **Driven**
  
* **Konsultmässig**
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 



 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på nils.norgren@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105257

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**MUST BE AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN SWEDEN.** 




  





 Are you a highly experienced Python developer seeking a senior role in building innovative technology solutions in Stockholm? Join our growing team at ValueChecker.ai, a revolutionary product expert tool for the insurance industry.
 



  





 We seek individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
 



  





 We are specifically looking for experienced applicants as the responsibilities from the beginning of the enrollment will be high. We understand that if you do not have much experience you can “learn as you go” and we have no doubt that many of you are capable of becoming experienced and highly skilled developers. However, as mentioned, the expectations are set at a high level from day 1 (maybe day 2).
 



 Please demonstrate the requirements listed below in your application. (Otherwise, please wait for an entry level, or intermediate role to be posted)
 



  





  





**Who you are:** 
 Technical proficiency
 



  




* Minimum 5 years professional experience with Python (not including internships)
* Proven experience with: Databases and datasets (MySQL preferred), Cloud environments (GCP preferred) and Collaborative coding (code review, source control etc..)
* Experience with software design and application development
* Automation in deployments (CI)
* Experience with ElasticSearch, MongoDB, data algorithms, and web scraping.



  





  





**Personal qualities** 




  




* Passionate about building technology solutions and eager to learn and grow.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities
* Ability to work independently and take ownership of projects
* Fluent in English (both written and spoken)



  





 We are hiring dynamic individuals - always looking to improve themselves and their projects. As we are developing applications that are already live in some stage - experience with client interaction will be a plus.
 



  





 Additional skills that will be beneficial to working with us are:
 


* Understanding of ML algorithms
* HA application design
* BI data handling
* AI usage and integration
* Web data ingress, scraping etc..



  





  





**Compensation & Benefits:** 




  




* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects and tasks
* Career improvement opportunities
* Collaborative and supportive work environment
* Working for and with international clients
* Great culture, a learning environment and potential for career advancement



  





  





**About Us** 




  





 ValueChecker is a project by ICSS which was founded in 2005 and we have been at the forefront of the reviews and product aggregation sector. We collect, catalog and warehouse data as well as write software to manipulate, present and share it. We are a diverse team, currently hailing from every continent except Antarctica.
 



  





 We have developed the cloud-based product appraisal tool ValueChecker.ai, that is now quickly growing globally within InsurTech.
 



  





 ValueChecker is a revolutionary product expert tool for the Insurance industry. It enables fast, simple and credible identification, valuation and depreciation of product claims. ValueChecker builds upon the technology and experience gained by ICSS (and its flagship project, alaTest) since 2005 in the field of consumer product information. We welcome all nationalities and backgrounds - so long as you are legally employable in Sweden. Our company's primary language is English.
 



  





  





  





 Ready to take your career to the next level?
 



**Apply now!** 




 Please send your CV and cover letter in English through our careers portal:
 



 https://careers.valuechecker.ai/jobs/3657283-senior-software-developer/b3bf51bf-f3a9-4bd8-8150-a73be6e6c435
 



  





  





  





 Note: We require a small coding challenge to be completed by all applicants that pass the first review round. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
 



  





  





  





**ALL APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED IN ENGLISH.** 




**MUST BE AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN SWEDEN.**

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.
   

  

 We are on an exciting journey building a global IT platform to support our vision of making cities more livable, and we need someone to help us to define the new global Enterprise IT platform.
   

  

**The role**
 As an IT Enterprise Architect at EasyPark Group, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technology landscape of EasyPark’s business solutions, like CRM, ERP, HRIS, etc, ensuring that our IT systems align with the organization's strategic goals. You will work closely with stakeholders, including business leaders and technology teams, to design, implement, and maintain the architectural framework of our enterprise IT infrastructure.
   

  

**This Role Will Be Responsible For**
* Architectural Planning
* Solution Design
* Technology Evaluation
* Standards and Best Practices
* Integration
* Change Management
* Risk Management
* Governance and Compliance
* Collaboration
* Documentation


**I** 
**s this you?**
 You are a person who thrives in an environment where you will have the opportunity to contribute on a high level, where your input is valued, and where you together with others will build a global IT platform.
   

  

 You are experienced within the field and have a good understanding of what working in a global environment means in terms of migration and integration. You are someone who is pragmatic and flexible with a
 *can-do attitude* 
 who values working in dynamic ways in order to move forward and create great solutions.
   

  

 You have been working close to business before and understand the challenges and benefits of working with a remote team. Knowledgeable on large scale enterprise systems like ERP, CRM and HRIS are a must for this role.
   

  

**Further We See That You Have**
* At least 3 years as Enterprise Architect in a global company
* Experience from working in an organization with a decentralized IT ownership structure, and managing it from an IT governance perspective
* Great communication skills and strong in building relationships
* Fluent understanding and uninhibitedly spoken English
* Experience with working in a global organization


 The role is to be based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden. Swedish is not required for this role.
   

  

**Life at EasyPark**
 We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiatives and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embracing change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
